column1: DETROIT --   J.P. Arencibia and Mark DeRosa gave the struggling Toronto Blue Jays a chance to feel good . 	 Arencibia hit a three - run double in the seventh inning and the Blue Jays rallied from a five - run deficit to beat the Detroit Tigers 8 - 6 on Wednesday . 	 Toronto had opened a season of high expectations with five losses in seven games . 	 " No reason to panic
column2: but when you see it slipping away in the fifth or sixth inning
column3: it was nice for the bats to come alive
column5: whose pinch - hit double in the sixth got the comeback started in earnest . " We obviously did n't get off to the start we wanted to
column6: but we fought . " 	 Detroit led 6 - 1 in the sixth
column7: but starter Rick Porcello allowed hits to the first three batters that inning . They all eventually scored
column8: and Toronto added four more runs the following inning . 	 Brayan Villarreal ( 0 - 1 ) came on with one on and one out in the seventh and proceeded to walk three straight hitters
column9: forcing in a run . Arencibia followed with a drive to the gap in left - center off Octavio Dotel to make it 8 - 6 . 	 " It was nice to finally get a few hits and walks and guys grinding out at - bats
column10: and string it all in the same inning
column12: you need to be able to do that collectively in an inning . " 	 Aaron Loup ( 1 - 0 ) pitched a scoreless sixth for the Blue Jays . Casey Janssen
column13: the last of five Toronto relievers
column14: pitched a perfect ninth for his second save . 	 The game started after a rain delay of 2 hours
column16: and it was also raining when the Tigers made the final out . 	 The Blue Jays fell behind early . Mark Buehrle
column17: acquired in the same offseason trade that brought Jose Reyes and Josh Johnson to Toronto
column18: allowed six runs -- five earned -- in 4 1/3 innings . 	 Three of those runs came home after Buehrle left the game in the fifth . Reliever Steve Delabar allowed bases - loaded walks to Victor Martinez and pinch - hitter Andy Dirks
column19: and Jhonny Peralta added an RBI single to make it 6 - 1 . 	 But Porcello did n't get another out . He allowed four runs and eight hits in five - plus innings and left the lead to what is already a beleaguered Detroit bullpen . The Tigers do n't have a set closer . Manager Jim Leyland says he 's willing to use anyone to pitch with a lead in the ninth inning -- but he never even got to make that decision Wednesday . 	 Edwin Encarnacion doubled in a run to chase Porcello
column20: and DeRosa followed with a two - run double off Darin Downs . That set the stage for the seventh inning
column21: when the Blue Jays took the lead . 	 " We really did n't give ourselves a chance
column22: " Leyland said . " We walked the guys . You do n't give yourself a chance when you walk guys . " 	 Toronto
column24: blanked the Tigers over the last four innings . After Loup 's scoreless frame
column25: Brett Cecil pitched the seventh and Darren Oliver worked the eighth . 	 Oliver got a bizarre assist when Austin Jackson 's line drive hit him around the left elbow and bounced right to DeRosa at first base for an easy 1/3 putout . The left - hander was able to continue . 	 " You never like to see a teammate get hit with a line drive
column26: " DeRosa said . " But for the ball to carom right to me -- maybe things are starting to change a little bit . " 	 Dotel had his own injury scare in the top of the inning when a one - hopper by Emilio Bonifacio hit him in the groin area . Dotel was also able to continue pitching . 	 Game notes 	  Encarnacion snapped an 0 - for-19 skid by doubling in the fourth and sixth . ... Tigers 1B Prince Fielder helped his team with his legs
column27: beating out a potential double - play grounder in the first to drive home a run and later reaching on an infield single . ... Jose Valverde
column28: who was Detroit 's closer last year before being demoted during the postseason
column29: threw a bullpen session in Lakeland
column30: Fla.
column31: on Wednesday . He 's expected to pitch Friday in an extended spring training game
column32: and again Monday in a scrimmage . Valverde
column34: signed a minor league deal with Detroit last week . ... All nine runners inherited by relievers came in to score . ... Detroit RHP Doug Fister ( 1 - 0 ) takes the mound against Toronto RHP Josh Johnson ( 0 - 0 ) on Thursday

column1: ST . LOUIS --   Jake Westbrook bounded out of the dugout for the ninth inning before manager Mike Matheny could change his mind . 	 The right - hander quickly finished off a five - hitter for his first shutout in more than six years
column2: backed by four home runs in the St. Louis Cardinals ' 10 - 0 rout over the Cincinnati Reds Wednesday . 	 " He was making a statement
column3: " Matheny said . " He wanted to make sure he gave the appearance he was ready to go . What a great day for him . " 	 Westbrook ( 1 - 1 ) has n't allowed an earned run in 15 2/3 innings this season
column4: although he took the loss on an unearned run in a 1 - 0 setback to Barry Zito in San Francisco in his season debut . He relied heavily on a sinker against the Reds with 16 groundball outs . 	 " It always means a lot when you can finish what you started
column5: " Westbrook said . " The ball was in the zone and really moving a lot . I guess I know when I 'm good is when I get a lot of ground balls . " 	 The lineup made a statement
column7: Carlos Beltran and Matt Adams homered in a span of seven at - bats off Homer Bailey as the Cardinals took two of three from the NL Central champions after Cincinnati stunned them with a nine - run ninth in the home opener . 	 " It 's a great point about resiliency
column8: " Matheny said . " They certainly showed a different brand the last two days . " 	 Matt Carpenter added a two - run homer on a four - hit day . Adams homered for the second straight game and added an RBI double and walk . 	 The Cardinals have dominated the Reds at home the last decade
column9: losing just three of 28 series with two splits . They outscored them 15 - 1 the last two games of the series and the Reds were shut out for the first time in the finale . 	 " I was hoping this would be different this time especially after that first night
column10: " Reds manager Dusty Baker said . " The thing about it is their pitching really shut us down . " 	 Westbrook ( 1 - 1 ) pitched his first shutout since Aug. 9
column12: against the Angels when he was with Cleveland
column13: and this was his 15th career complete game . He held the Reds hitless in six at - bats with runners in scoring position
column14: and contributed his 11th career RBI with a single in the seventh for St. Louis ' final run . 	 " It was a perfect storm
column16: one of the few Reds with much success
column17: going 2 for 3 with a walk . " He did n't surprise us because he definitely has that capability . " 	 Bailey ( 1 - 1 ) had gone 23 straight shutout innings -- including his no - hitter against Pittsburgh last season -- before the Cardinals broke open a scoreless game with four runs with two outs in the fifth . 	 " Once they started seeing the ball there toward the end
column18: they hit it
column19: " Bailey said . " After watching the film
column20: I missed a spot to Beltran pretty big . The others hit pretty good pitches . They just got ahold of them . " 	 Bailey was charged with seven runs in five - plus innings and dropped to 3 - 8 with a 5.52 ERA against the Cardinals
column21: including 0 - 4 with a 6.93 ERA at Busch Stadium . 	 Baker pulled Bailey after Pete Kozma 's liner struck the pitcher just above his right ankle
column22: with the ball caroming into left field . But Bailey walked off without a limp . 	 " I was trying to wave him off
column23: " Bailey said . " It was more because of giving up the rockets that have n't really landed yet . " 	 The Cardinals advanced only two runners into scoring position in the first four innings and Bailey got two quick outs to start the fifth before running into trouble against the top of the lineup . St. Louis scored 10 runs on 11 hits in the fifth
column25: Logan Ondrusek and Alfredo Simon . 	 Jay 's second homer just cleared center fielder Shin - Soo Choo 's leaping attempt at the wall . Carpenter followed with a single and Matt Holliday hit an RBI double
column26: prompting a visit from pitching coach Bryan Price . 	 Beltran then hit his first homer of the season on to make it 4 - 0 . 	 Adams hit a two - run homer in the sixth off Bailey . Carpenter 's two - run shot homer three batters later made it 8 - 0 . 	 Game notes 	  Jay has 19 career homers
column27: six of them against the Reds . ... Choo was 0 for 2 with a walk and hit by pitch to end a four - game streak of two hits each game . ... Cincinnati 's Todd Frazier was 0 for 11 in the series after opening the season with a six - game RBI streak . ... The RBI was Westbrook 's first since hitting a grand slam at Milwaukee on Aug. 31

column2: Texas --   When Ben Zobrist caught a flyball in deep right field
column3: Tampa Bay manager Joe Maddon was more concerned about the runner who was going to third base . 	 Zobrist instead made a perfect throw to home plate for a double play to end the Texas eighth inning
column4: and the Rays held on for a 2 - 0 victory Wednesday
column5: winning the finale of what had been a difficult three - game series in Texas . 	 " Especially in a big situation
column6: where we 're trying to prevent runs
column10: and warmed me up just a little bit . " 	 Matt Moore ( 2 - 0 ) combined with four relievers on a five - hitter and the Rays got their only runs on a fielder 's choice grounder by Zobrist and a sacrifice fly by Evan Longoria to win the coldest day game ever at Rangers Ballpark . 	 It was only 39 degrees when the game started after a rain delay of 1 hour
column11: 29 minutes . That was 40 degrees colder than Tuesday night . 	 Texas had runners at second and third with one out in the eighth when pinch - hitter Leonys Martin hit the fly to right . Adrian Beltre tagged up from third base
column12: and David Murphy was ready to advance from second . 	 " I was really surprised on Zo 's throw . I did not think he had a shot
column13: I thought it was too deep
column14: " Maddon said . " But he made an absolutely perfect throw and ( catcher Jose Lobaton ) did a nice job on the other end . " 	 Texas
column15: which had won six of seven since its season - opening loss at Houston
column16: also appeared to have a run in the sixth . Mitch Moreland
column17: the third batter after Moore left the game
column18: beat out an inning - ending double - play grounder . 	 Moreland had already been signaled safe and Nelson Cruz had crossed home plate when interference was called against Jeff Baker at second . Baker slid away from the bag and into the path of shortstop Yunel Escobar
column19: who double - clutched before making the relay throw . 	 " It was obvious ( Baker ) made no intent to get to the bag
column21: who did go out to discuss the call with second base umpire Marty Foster . " He may have done that
column22: but that had no effect on why ( Escobar ) double- or triple - clutched on the throw . " 	 That inning - ending play was much different than the game - ending strike in Monday night 's series opener that Texas won 5 - 4 . That game ended with Zobrist batting when Foster was behind home plate and called strike three on a full - count curveball low and outside -- a call the ump later admitted he got wrong . 	 " The last two days were tough days
column24: " Zobrist said . " But getting a win going into an off day certainly feels a lot better
column25: albeit how cold it was and how we did n't necessarily kill the ball . " 	 Longoria had a sacrifice fly in the fifth for Tampa Bay
column26: which had lost three in a row and on Thursday has its only day off in a 27 - day span to start the season . The Rays start a four - game series at Boston on Friday . 	 Derek Holland ( 0 - 1 ) limited the Rays to two runs and five hits over eight innings . The Texas lefty struck out four and walked three
column27: all those walks coming in the third to load the bases before Zobrist 's grounder . 	 Moore limited Texas to a single and struck out five
column28: but had six walks and threw 106 pitches -- 52 of them balls with two wild pitches -- in his 5 1/3 innings . He benefited from two double - play grounders
column29: one soon after he came out of the game . 	 " Where the big pitches that really needed to be made
column30: I was locked into those moments
column31: " Moore said . " From that
column32: we can be happy with what the results were . " 	 Cesar Ramos
column34: Joel Peralta and Fernando Rodney finished out Tampa Bay 's third shutout of the season . Rodney got his first save . 	 The only other time Moore pitched in Texas was the 2011 AL division series opener
column35: when he threw seven scoreless innings for the Rays . He threw six shutout frames against Cleveland last week in his first start this season . 	 Holland 's first walk was to No . 9 hitter Kelly Johnson leading off the third . Johnson eventually scored when Zobrist beat out a throw to first that prevented an inning - ending double play . 	 " I felt like I had better command of my fastball . I got a little erratic ( in the third )
column36: " Holland said . " I went out there and battled . I 'm not going to sit here and beat myself up about it . ... It definitely was cold
column37: but I 've got to make my pitches and he 's got to make his pitches . " 	 Game notes 	  The only colder start at Rangers Ballpark
column38: which is in its 20th season
column39: was a night game against Boston on April 7
column41: when it was 38 degrees . Texas is more known for the summer heat . Just two seasons ago
column42: the temperature was at least 100 degrees for 27 games at the park . ... Rangers pitching coach Mike Maddux had to go to the dentist when a crown came loose . That 's why bullpen coach Andy Hawkins visited Holland on the mound in the third . Maddux was back in the dugout soon after that . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column43: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column44: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million
column45: sources confirmed to ESPN . 	 From who we think deserves MVP and Cy Young to if the voters got it right

column2: doubled and drove in four runs as the Arizona Diamondbacks salvaged the final game of their series against Pittsburgh
column3: routing the Pirates 10 - 2 on Wednesday . 	 Pollock began the day in an 0 - for-14 rut . He also made a diving catch in center field to rob Andrew McCutchen in the first inning . 	 Wade Miley ( 2 - 0 ) allowed two runs on five hits in 6 2/3 innings . 	 Jonathan Sanchez ( 0 - 2 ) was charged with nine runs and eight hits in 3 1/3 innings . The last two of those runs came after Sanchez left and reliever Chris Leroux walked two batters
column5: with the bases loaded in the Diamondbacks ' four - run fourth . 	 Pollock
column6: a long shot to make the opening day roster before spring training injuries to Adam Eaton and Cody Ross
column7: hit a three - run homer in the second and a solo shot leading off the fourth . He had two home runs in his 81 big league at - bats last season . 	 Pollock
column8: moved up to the No . 2 spot in the batting order by manager Kirk Gibson

column13: and manager Clint Hurdle had seen enough from his left - handed starter . 	 Leroux came on and promptly walked three straight . column2: Barry Zito had a large lead that would make most pitchers plenty comfortable . 	 Zito never allows himself to think that way . Not with all the ups and downs of his Giants tenure . 	 " I think the mindset that it 's easier because you have a lead will tie the game up quickly

column19: " Francis said . 	 The Giants had a season - high 16 hits a day after getting 14 . 	 Zito had an RBI single in the fifth . He singled the next inning for his first career multihit game
column20: prompting a standing ovation from the sellout crowd of 41
column21: 606 and chants of " Barry ! Barry ! " He has a four - start hitting streak dating to the 2012 postseason . 	 " He 's going to have a shift soon

column25: and he has n't lost since Aug. 2 against the Mets . 	 " You ca n't have more confidence out there than what Barry has right now
column26: " Giants manager Bruce Bochy said . " It 's fun to watch when a pitcher 's on and hitting his spots . It 's a thing of beauty . He 's as tough a competitor as I 've ever been around . column1: PHILADELPHIA --   Phillies manager Charlie Manuel calls the summer months " hittin ' weather . " With unseasonably warm temperatures in April reaching the mid-80s
column2: Philadelphia started its hitting a bit early . 	 Domonic Brown and Chase Utley homered in a five - run first
column3: Kyle Kendrick threw six effective innings and the Phillies beat the New York Mets 7 - 3 Wednesday night . 	 Pinch - hitter Laynce Nix also went deep for the Phillies
column4: who took two straight from the Mets to earn their first series win of the year . 	 The suddenly slugging Phillies have six homers in the last two games -- both days were in the 80s -- after hitting four in the first seven . 	 " We just started getting good balls to hit and started swinging the bats good
column5: " Manuel said . 	 John Buck homered for the third straight game and Lucas Duda had two solo shots for New York . The Mets set a club record by hitting at least one homer in their first nine games . 	 Kendrick ( 1 - 1 ) allowed two runs and eight hits to become the first Philadelphia starter other than Cliff Lee to get a win . 	 " I wanted to pitch as deep as I can
column7: " Kendrick said . " I felt like as the game went on
column8: I got more comfortable . " 	 Mets starter Jeremy Hefner ( 0 - 2 ) gave up five runs and six hits in three innings . 	 " I know I 'm good enough to beat those guys
column9: " he said . 	 A rain delay halted the game for 27 minutes in the bottom of the fourth
column10: and strong winds and a heavy downpour late in the game left the field littered with trash during the final inning . 	 A night after hitting three homers off Dillon Gee in the third inning
column11: the Phillies used the long ball in the first to jump ahead 5 - 0 . 	 Jimmy Rollins hit a double after Ben Revere was caught stealing second because he overslid the bag . Utley then drove one out to straightaway center for a 2 - 0 lead . 	 Ryan Howard followed with a single and Michael Young walked before Brown launched a changeup into the first row of the second deck in right field to make it 5 - 0 . 	 " I think there 's something to be said for everything being contagious
column12: " Young said . " Starting pitchers feed off each other and hitters can
column13: too . " 	 Buck connected in the second for the Mets
column14: lining a shot out to left - center . He has five homers and 15 RBIs in nine games . The Mets had five homers last season from all of their catchers -- Josh Thole ( one )
column16: Mike Nickeas ( one ) . 	 Duda hit a towering
column17: 414 - foot drive into the second deck in right field in the fourth to cut it to 5 - 2 . He took Mike Adams deep in the eighth . 	 Kendrick pitched out of a jam in the fifth after the Mets put the first two runners on . He struck out David Wright swinging at a 2 - 2 changeup . After a wild pitch
column18: Revere ran a long way to catch Ike Davis ' shallow fly to left - center . Revere than threw to second base to double off Daniel Murphy . 	 " It was a bad play
column19: " Murphy said . " Even if it falls
column20: it 's first and third with one out . Just a bad play . " 	 Mets center fielder Jordany Valdespin made an outstanding shoestring catch on a shallow fly by Erik Kratz to leave the bases loaded in the third . 	 Nix hit a two - run shot off LaTroy Hawkins in the sixth . 	 Game notes 	  Nix has three career pinch - hit homers . ... Davis was 0 for 4 to drop to 4 for 30 this season . ... column1: BOSTON --   Most of the seats were empty late on a rainy night when the Boston Red Sox 's home sellout streak of nearly 10 years ended . 	 Manny Machado ruined it for the fans who remained . 	 His three - run homer off closer Joel Hanrahan capped a five - run ninth inning and gave the Baltimore Orioles an 8 - 5 win Wednesday night . 	 " It was a huge win for us
column2: " Machado said after his first homer of the year . " To come out with the victory is just going to give us the big boost that we needed to get this show rolling . " 	 The Orioles were headed for their fourth straight loss after consecutive homers by Daniel Nava and Jarrod Saltalamacchia gave Boston a 5 - 3 lead in the sixth . Then Hanrahan
column3: who was three - for - three in save opportunities as Boston 's new closer
column4: came on in the ninth . 	 " I felt fine
column5: " he said . " I got ahead of a couple of guys and I just did n't put them away . " 	 Chris Davis started the inning with his fifth homer before Hanrahan
column6: obtained in the offseason from the Pittsburgh Pirates
column7: retired the next two batters . Then he was one strike away from winning
column8: but Ryan Flaherty singled on a 2 - 2 pitch for his first hit in 18 at - bats this season . He had struck out in his other three at - bats Wednesday . 	 " You want to get on base and give your team a chance to win
column9: " he said . " You never want to wait until the ninth
column10: but it was good resilience and a good win . " 	 Nolan Reimold then walked on four pitches and Nate McLouth walked on a borderline pitch with a 3 - 2 count
column11: loading the bases . 	 " There was some calmness and professionalism to those at - bats
column12: " Baltimore manager Buck Showalter said . 	 On the first pitch to Machado
column13: Hanrahan fired the ball into the dirt for a wild pitch that scored pinch - runner Alexi Casilla with the tying run . And the next pitch was Hanrahan 's last of the game -- Machado 's homer over the Green Monster in left field . Hanrahan left to a round of boos . 	 " I probably would have given the same reception
column14: " Hanrahan ( 0 - 1 ) said . " They stuck through a rain delay . They stuck it out . " 	 Darren O'Day ( 1 - 0 ) got the win and Jim Johnson pitched the ninth for his third save . 	 " You 've got your closer in the game
column16: it 's tough
column17: " catcher Saltalamacchia said . " But I still feel that Joel 's got some of the best stuff I 've ever caught . " 	 The sellout streak began on May 15
column19: lasted 820 games
column21: and was the longest in major pro sports history . It broke the record of 814 set by the NBA 's Portland Trail Blazers from 1977 - 95 . Boston 's streak of 794 regular - season sellouts also is the longest in major pro sports history . The previous longest regular - season streak in major league baseball history was 455 set by the Cleveland Indians from 1995 - 2001 . 	 Nava gave the Red Sox a 4 - 3 lead with his third homer in three games
column22: an opposite - field shot over the Green Monster . Saltalamacchia followed with his first homer
column23: a hard shot over the right - field fence . 	 Baltimore took a 1 - 0 lead in the first with the help of Boston 's first error of the season . McLouth walked before Machado hit a fly ball to right - center . Center fielder Jacoby Ellsbury and right fielder Shane Victorino converged on it . Victorino ducked in front of Ellsbury and the ball fell safely . Victorino was charged with the error during the game
column24: but the error was later given to Ellsbury after manager John Farrell said Ellsbury had called for the ball late . 	 Machado moved to third on the play and scored on a groundout by Nick Markakis . 	 The Red Sox tied it in the second on a walk to Nava and an RBI - double by Saltalamacchia . They went ahead 3 - 1 in the third when Jackie Bradley Jr. led off with a walk
column25: Ellsbury tripled him home and Victorino hit a sacrifice fly . 	 Another error helped the Orioles tie the game in the fourth . Markakis started the inning with his first homer of the season . Adam Jones then walked
column26: extending his hitting streak to all eight games
column27: and moved up on a wild pitch . Matt Wieters then singled to left and Jones scored when the ball eluded Bradley . 	 Game notes 	  The game was delayed by rain for 43 minutes after the fifth inning with the score 3 - 3 . ... Reimold returned to the lineup after leaving Sunday 's 4 - 3 loss to the Minnesota Twins with a strained right hamstring . ... There was a moment of silence before the game for Dave O'Hara
column28: the former New England sports editor for The Associated Press in Boston
column29: who died Wednesday at the age of 86 . ... The Red Sox activated SS Stephen Drew from the seven - day concussion disabled list
column30: optioned SS Jose Iglesias to Pawtucket and called up RHP Alex Wilson from that Triple - A team . ... The Orioles traded RHP Luis Ayala to Atlanta for LHP Chris Jones . Jones was assigned to Double - A Bowie . Baltimore purchased the contract of OF Chris Dickerson from Triple - A Norfolk . column1: MIAMI --   The Atlanta Braves ' latest victory was especially splashy : Evan Gattis ' three - run homer landed in the nightclub swimming pool beyond the left - field fence . 	 Two batters later
column2: Juan Francisco homered off the upper - deck facade in center field . The Braves had too much muscle for the feeble Miami Marlins and completed their second consecutive three - game sweep by winning 8 - 0 on Wednesday night . 	 The homers came in a six - run fifth inning
column3: when Atlanta broke open a game that had been scoreless . 	 " That 's real men hitting the baseball
column4: " Braves outfielder Jordan Schafer said . " That 's not little kids . " 	 Mike Minor pitched 5 2/3 innings for the Braves
column5: whose 8 - 1 record leads the majors . They 're off to their best start since 1994
column6: when they began the season 13 - 1 . 	 Atlanta takes a six - game winning streak into a three - game series at Washington
column8: " manager Fredi Gonzalez said . " Winning is always good . It 's a good feeling . It 's early
column9: but you want to be the guy in front all the time . " 	 Only three series into the season
column10: Atlanta enjoys a seven - game lead over the Marlins
column11: who have the worst record in the big leagues at 1 - 8 . They 've scored just 16 runs
column12: and with five consecutive losses they 're off to their worst start since the 1998 team began the season 1 - 11 . 	 " It 's snowballing a little bit
column13: " first - year manager Mike Redmond said . " We 're pressing . They need to relax . " 	 The Marlins kept the game scoreless until the fifth
column14: when Gattis hit his third homer
column15: a line drive that scattered revelers in the nightclub . 	 " I thought it was going to decapitate somebody
column16: " Gonzalez said . 	 " I never hit a home run into a pool before
column17: " Gattis said . " Notch that one . " 	 The 26 - year - old rookie also singled and is batting .391 with a slugging percentage of .826 . He has been sharing playing time at catcher with Gerald Laird
column18: who is batting .400
column19: and Gonzalez said he would consider playing Gattis at first base Friday . 	 Was Gonzalez serious ? 	 " It 's hard to take that bat out of the lineup
column21: I 've got two days to think about it . Probably not
column22: but we 'll see . I 've done crazier stuff . Make sure you tune in . " 	 Gattis hit six home runs in spring training as a non - roster invitee to earn a spot on the team . His surprising success gives the Braves considerable depth at catcher
column23: with Brian McCann expected to return from shoulder surgery by the end of April . 	 Andrelton Simmons drove in two runs for the Braves
column24: while Schafer -- a reserve making his first start this year -- had four of their 13 hits . 	 The home team could be grateful there were few witnesses . For the second night in a row
column25: the Marlins drew the smallest crowd since their park opened a year ago . Announced attendance was 13
column26: 810 . 	 Minor ( 2 - 0 ) pitched around a leadoff double in the second and another in the third . Two relievers completed a seven - hitter . 	 The Braves came into the game with the best ERA in the majors at 2.13
column27: and they 've allowed only three runs in the past four games . 	 Miami went 0 for 9 with runners in scoring position and is batting .153 in those situations . Four starters ended the night hitting .200 or worse
column28: including slugger Giancarlo Stanton at .167 . 	 Alex Sanabia ( 1 - 1 ) gave up six runs
column29: all in his fifth and final inning . 	 " It 's tough to pitch and be perfect
column30: especially when you 're playing teams like the Braves and the Phillies
column31: " Redmond said . " We 've got to do our part offensively to take some of the pressure off the pitchers . We ca n't ask those guys to go out and throw a shutout every single night . " 	 Schafer led off the Braves ' big inning with a bunt single
column32: stole second and scored on a single by Simmons . Following a walk
column33: Gattis hit a two - out homer . 	 After another walk
column34: Francisco hit his first homer . 	 " One through eight
column35: we 've got guys who can hit the ball out of the ballpark
column36: " Minor said . " A lot of times it leads to a big inning . We 're not really worried about it throughout the game if we have zeros on the board
column37: because at any time
column38: they can put one out of the ballpark . " 	 Game notes 	  Slumping Braves CF B.J. Upton ( .103 ) was given the night off . ... Braves RF Jason Heyward went 0 for 4
column39: dropping his average to .071 . ... Marlins rookie Chris Valaika
column40: who started at 1B
column41: said he never played the position before
column42: not even in Little League . He mishandled his first chance for an error . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column2: Mo. --   Not even a bitter cold and steady rain could slow the Kansas City Royals . 	 Wade Davis pitched out of bases - loaded jams in the first two innings
column3: Billy Butler and Jeff Francoeur homered and the Royals beat the Minnesota Twins 3 - 0 on Wednesday night to sweep the three - game series . 	 With the first - pitch temperature at 45 degrees
column4: a wind chill in the mid-30s and rain most of the game
column5: the Royals won their fourth straight and sixth in seven games to move three over .500 for the first time since May 12
column8: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . " The conditions were not very conducive to playing baseball . It was cold and wet
column9: but it played the same for both teams . It was tough to score . I did n't think anybody would be able to hit a home run tonight with the heavy air and damp air . " 	 Butler homered in the first
column10: while Francoeur led off the seventh with a home run to extend his hitting streak to seven games . 	 " It was cold
column12: " Royals third baseman Mike Moustakas said . " As long as we get a ` W ' it does n't matter how cold it is . " 	 The Royals have won their first three Kauffman Stadium games after losing their first 10 at home last April . 	 " That 's in the past
column13: " Yost said . " That 's not in our mind anymore . We remember it
column14: but this is a new team . It 's nice to be 6 - 3 . " 	 The Royals got another run in the seventh when Alcides Escobar 's single scored Chris Getz . Salvador Perez had three of the nine Kansas City hits . 	 Davis ( 1 - 0 )
column15: acquired from Tampa Bay in a December trade
column16: held the Twins to four singles in five scoreless innings
column17: striking out six
column18: walking three and hitting a batter . 	 " The first two innings
column19: he did a magnificent job of pitching out of bases loaded jams and in the second inning with nobody out
column20: " Yost said . " He kind of settled down from that point . He got through five and his pitch count was up . " 	 Twins right - hander Liam Hendriks ( 0 - 1 )
column21: who is 1 - 11 in 22 career starts
column23: although he gave up just one run -- Butler 's homer -- on four hits in five innings . 	 " I went out there and I was feeling a little disoriented
column24: " Hendriks said . " I was n't feeling right . Once I got locked in it was better . It was just the one pitch ( Butler 's home run ) which hurt . 	 " I felt really good out of the stretch .   The number of pitches
column25: 96 in five innings
column26: that 's not a positive . Just the one home run
column27: I was pleased
column28: compared to the last time out . It was tough conditions today . " 	 Davis
column29: who threw 52 pitches in the first two innings
column30: struck out Aaron Hicks and Joe Mauer to start the game
column31: before walking two and yielding a bloop single to Justin Morneau . Trevor Plouffe flied out to end the inning . 	 Davis faced a bigger predicament in the second when the Twins loaded the bases with none out . He rebounded by striking out Hicks and Mauer and retiring Josh Willingham on an infield popup . 	 " I got into a little trouble early and did n't make it too easy on myself
column32: " Davis said . 	 Bruce Chen replaced Davis and worked three innings
column34: while Kelvin Herrera completed the shutout with three strikeouts to pick up his second save in as many opportunities . 	 The Twins stranded 12 runners and went 0 - for-11 with runners in scoring position . 	 Game notes 	  Twins LHP Scott Diamond
column35: who had arthroscopic surgery in December to remove a bone chip

column37: but will be skipped his next start with the Royals having four off - days in the next 12 days . ... After committing just one error in their first eight games

column2: Calif. --   Hitting has n't exactly been a science for Brandon Moss
column3: whose bat has become one of the Oakland Athletics ' most dangerous weapons since he returned to the American League last season . 	 Moss tied a career high with five RBIs
column4: including his second homer in two games
column5: and the A 's extended their winning streak to seven games with an 11 - 5 victory over the Los Angeles Angels on Wednesday night . 	 The seven - year veteran first baseman 's other five - RBI game was on Sept. 29 against Seattle
column6: when he hit a game - ending

column20: I generally do n't try to strike guys out . I try to make the defense work for me . But with ( John ) Jaso up in the third with a runner at third and two strikes on him

column23: then extended Oakland 's lead to 5 - 2 in the fifth with a two - out solo homer to right - center . It was the fourth allowed by Blanton

column38: who hit a go - ahead
column39: three - run homer as a pinch - hitter in Oakland 's series - opening 9 - 5 win on Tuesday night

column1: SEATTLE --   Chris Carter could sense the Houston Astros were poised for another offensive outburst Wednesday night . 	 Carter and Rick Ankiel each hit a two - run homer to help Houston beat the Seattle Mariners 8 - 3 before a crowd of 10
column3: the smallest at Safeco Field since the ballpark opened 13 1/2 years ago . 	 After losing 3 - 0 on Monday
column4: the Astros scored 24 runs on 37 hits in winning the final two games of the series . Carter
column5: who hit two home runs in a 16 - 9 rout Tuesday
column6: added three hits in this one . He finished the series 8 for 15 with three homers and five RBIs . 	 " Everyone 's confidence was still rolling into today
column8: which arrived in Seattle with a .199 batting average
column9: hit .367 in the series to raise the team mark to .262 . 	 " When they 're finding the barrel of the bat that much they are doing things right
column11: " Mariners shortstop Brendan Ryan said . " At the same time
column12: not every one has to go in the gap or over the fence . That 's the way it goes
column13: I guess . " 	 Ankiel snapped an 0 - for-13 slide with a second - inning homer . Carlos Pena had three hits and scored twice for the Astros
column14: who also got two RBIs from J.D. Martinez and a late home run by Marwin Gonzalez . 	 Brad Peacock ( 1 - 1 ) allowed three runs and four hits in five - plus innings for his first major league win since Sept. 22
column16: with Washington at Philadelphia . 	 " I had a good feeling going into today
column17: " Peacock said . " It definitely carried over . They swung the bats awesome today . " 	 Kelly Shoppach had three hits for the Mariners
column18: including a home run and an RBI double . Franklin Gutierrez hit his third homer in the sixth . 	 Seattle right fielder Michael Saunders sprained his right shoulder crashing into the outfield wall to make a catch in the first inning . He will be re - examined Thursday . 	 " It 's a right AC sprain
column19: " manager Eric Wedge said . " He 's going to have to miss some time . It 's just a matter of how much time . It could be a DL situation . We 're working through everything right now . " 	 The Astros scored three times off Blake Beavan ( 0 - 1 ) in the second
column20: highlighted by Ankiel 's shot to center . Mariners pitchers have allowed 19 home runs
column21: most in the majors . 	 Houston added two more runs in the third . Jason Castro reached on a two - base error when Gutierrez could n't gather a popup in center that Ryan lost in the dusk . Castro scored on Pena 's single
column22: the first unearned run ( out of 54 ) allowed by the Mariners this season . 	 Martinez doubled home Pena for a 5 - 0 lead . 	 Shoppach 's first home run with the Mariners was a solo shot to left in the third . His second drive to left in the fifth required a video replay to confirm that it was a double . With Dustin Ackley on first
column23: Shoppach hit a long shot to left - center . The ball ticked off the glove of a leaping Martinez and hit the yellow line at the top of the wall . Ackley raced around to score . 	 After Wedge argued that it was a home run
column24: crew chief Wally Bell gathered the umpires and they marched under the stands to check the replay . They ruled it a double and Shoppach was left stranded . 	 Gutierrez 's leadoff shot in the sixth ended the night for Peacock . He walked one and struck out three . 	 The Mariners have 14 home runs in their first 10 games . They hit just five through 10 games last season and did n't hit No . 14 until their 20th game . 	 Carter put it away in the seventh with his home run to left off Carter Capps . 	 Game notes 	  The Mariners called up LHP Bobby LaFromboise from Triple - A Tacoma and optioned LHP Lucas Luetge to their top farm team . Wedge said the move was necessary because of the strain on the pitching staff after Tuesday 's loss . " It was nothing in regard to Lucas . He has options . He threw three innings ( Tuesday ) and we needed another arm

column1: SAN DIEGO --   After floundering in Boston in 2011 and playing only 31 games last year due to injuries
column2: Carl Crawford is off to the fast start he knew he needed to have with the Los Angeles Dodgers . 	 Crawford led off with an opposite - field homer and A.J. Ellis added a two - run shot to back Chad Billingsley 's strong season debut and lead the Los Angeles Dodgers to a 4 - 3 victory against the San Diego Padres on Wednesday night . 	 Crawford homered to left field on the second pitch from Eric Stults ( 1 - 1 ) . He tripled off the left - field wall with one out in the fifth and scored on Mark Ellis ' single through a drawn - in infield to make it 4 - 1 . 	 " I just want to play baseball
column4: who came over from the Red Sox along with Adrian Gonzalez and Josh Beckett on Aug. 25 . " That 's all I want to do
column5: man . I 'm not trying to prove nothing to me
column8: whoever . I just want to play good baseball this year . " 	 Crawford had reconstructive elbow surgery two days before the trade and did n't get to play for the Dodgers last year . 	 He 's hitting .464 ( 13 of 28 ) . This was Crawford 's fourth consecutive game with multiple hits and his sixth in seven starts this season . 	 " You never know how it 's going to go . You hope for the best
column9: " he said . " The last two years the way things were going for me it 's kind of a surprise
column10: but a good surprise . It 's definitely fun .   Even if I would n't have had a fast start like I 'm having now
column11: everything is just good for me right now . " 	 Dodgers manager Don Mattingly said he certainly did n't expect Crawford to hit this well at the start of the season . 	 " I 've seen how good Carl has been in the past and the last two years have been spotty as far as injuries and things like that
column12: but I think we pretty much knew what he could do
column13: " Mattingly said . 	 Billingsley ( 1 - 0 ) opened the season on the disabled list after bruising his right index finger during a bunting drill on March 15 . He held San Diego to one run and five hits in six innings

column1: DETROIT --   Miguel Cabrera set the tone in the first inning
column2: stealing third before the opposing pitcher even started his motion . 	 On a chilly day when the ball did n't appear to be carrying
column3: the Detroit Tigers kept their legs moving . 	 Cabrera tripled and scored twice
column4: and the Tigers knocked Josh Johnson out of the game with a five - run second inning en route to an 11 - 1 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays on Thursday . There were no home runs on this wet day
column5: but Detroit did n't need any . 	 " Miggy stealing
column6: getting a triple -- we were running around a lot today
column7: " catcher Alex Avila said . " Had to -- it was pretty cold outside . " 	 Avila described the weather as " miserable " -- it was 35 degrees at game time

column1: CHICAGO --   Bruce Bochy was n't tempted to take out Ryan Vogelsong when he faltered early
column2: and the pitcher rewarded his manager 's confidence with a fine finish . 	 Vogelsong gave up five early runs before retiring his final 10 batters and helped his cause by walking with the bases loaded as the San Francisco Giants rallied for a 7 - 6 victory over the Chicago Cubs on Thursday . 	 " He was out of sync
column3: even said he was having a hard time getting the ball where he wanted
column4: " Bochy said . " But he got in a good groove there after that one inning and started getting pitches where he wanted and he got in a good rhythm there . " 	 Vogelsong ( 1 - 1 ) yielded eight hits and five runs in the first three innings before going on a solid run in a foggy and damp
column5: 40 - degree day to help the World Series champion Giants win their fourth straight . 	 " I still do n't feel all that great after that
column6: " Vogelsong said . " I just was trying to throw the ball and hopefully things were going to change
column7: and they did . We started hitting the ball and some people made some really good plays . " 	 Trailing 5 - 0 after three innings
column8: the Giants got some help in staging their comeback : Cubs shortstop Starlin Castro 's a two - out fielding error spurred a four - run fourth . 	 With runners on first and third in the fourth
column10: allowing the first run to score . Scott Feldman ( 0 - 2 ) then gave up an RBI single to Angel Pagan and hit Brandon Crawford with a pitch ahead of Sandoval 's double that pulled the Giants to 5 - 4 . 	 " I think that one is basically not understanding that the pitcher hit the ball and you had plenty of time
column11: " Cubs manager Dale Sveum said about Castro 's error . " You did n't have to overcharge the ball and overcook that whole play . " 	 Added Castro : " It 's really frustrating . I feel bad myself because that 's a routine play and that 's not supposed to happen . I tried to be too fast but I can learn ; that play ca n't happen again . " 	 Feldman allowed a single to Brandon Belt and walked Gregor Blanco after getting one out in the fifth . Hisanori Takahashi relieved and Nick Noonan singled to load the bases . Vogelsong then walked to force in a run and Pagan put the Giants ahead with a flyball to left field . Brandon Crawford then singled in a run to make it 7 - 5 . 	 Feldman lasted just 4 1/3 innings and gave up six runs -- two earned -- on seven hits . He walked three and struck out three . 	 " We came back yesterday against the Rockies
column12: " Crawford said . " We have a lot of good guys in our lineup
column13: so we 've battled back before . We did it last year in the playoffs and we have a lot of similar players back this year
column14: so we know how to battle back
column15: for sure . " 	 Jeremy Affeldt relieved Vogelsong after the sixth but he faltered in the eighth and was lifted after Alfonso Soriano doubled and Nate Schierholtz reached on a broken bat infield single . Santiago Casilla came on and got Welington Castillo to hit into a double play that scored Soriano to make it 7 - 6 . 	 Luis Valbuena followed with a double to deep center
column16: but pinch - hitter Steve Clevenger ended the inning looking at a third strike . 	 Giants closer Sergio Romo allowed a one - out double to David DeJesus in the ninth but finished for his sixth save . 	 " I feel pretty good right now
column17: " Romo said . " It 's a long season and I still have a lot of work to do . I 'm real happy with the way I 've started
column18: but I just try to do the best I can for my teammates . " 	 Anthony Rizzo hit a two - run homer in the third inning to give Chicago a 5 - 0 lead . Brent Lillibridge broke an 0 - for-17 start to the season with a two - run single in the second for the Cubs . 	 Game notes 	  San Francisco is in the midst of playing five consecutive day games ( including four scheduled at Wrigley Field ) for the first time since April 17 - 21
column19: 1996 . . The Giants have now won eight of their last nine games vs. the Cubs . ... Friday 's probable pitchers : Giants RHP Matt Cain ( 0 - 1 ) vs. Cubs RHP Carlos Villanueva ( 0 - 0 ) .   ... Former Blackhawks great and NHL Hall of Famer Tony Esposito was guest conductor during the seventh inning stretch 's " Take Me Out to the Ball Game . " ... Thursday marked the earliest date for the Giants to play at Wrigley Field in the team 's 131 - year history . The previous earliest visit to Wrigley was April 13

column1: WASHINGTON -- Here 's the dilemma Chicago White Sox manager Robin Ventura faced Thursday night in the fourth inning of a close game against the Washington Nationals : 	 Pitch to No . 3 hitter Bryce Harper with a runner on base or walk Harper and pitch instead to cleanup man Ryan Zimmerman with two aboard . 	 Ventura chose to have right - hander Dylan Axelrod intentionally walk the lefty - swinging Harper . That brought up the right - handed Zimmerman
column2: who delivered a two - run double
column3: breaking the game open and helping the Nationals beat the White Sox 7 - 4 for a three - game sweep . 	 " You 're rolling the dice either way
column4: " Ventura said . " You just take your chance . " 	 Nationals manager Davey Johnson raised an eyebrow and grinned when asked what he thought about that sequence . 	 " I 'm glad
column6: " I do n't have to make those decisions . " 	 Zimmerman 's modest take ? 	 " I would n't pitch a righty against Bryce right now
column9: two - word explanation : " Harper 's hot . " 	 That 's certainly true
column10: and Harper himself was n't surprised about the walk there
column12: " First base open . Hitting righties pretty good . " 	 Actually
column13: it does n't seem to matter who 's on the mound at the moment . 	 The reigning NL Rookie of the Year is hitting .417 with four homers
column14: eight RBIs and a .778 slugging percentage . His run - scoring single in the eighth gave the 20 - year - old Harper at least two hits in seven of Washington 's nine games so far . 	 " Obviously
column15: they 're showing a lot of respect for Bryce
column16: 10 days into the season
column17: " Nationals starter Dan Haren ( 1 - 0 ) said after getting the win despite allowing 10 hits in five innings . " I mean
column18: he 's special . Our lineup 's really good
column19: though . There 's no soft spots . " 	 With the score tied at 3 in the fourth
column20: Haren helped himself by doubling off Axelrod ( 0 - 1 ) and eventually scoring on a wild pitch with two outs . Chicago then put Harper on base on purpose
column21: but the move did n't work : Cleanup hitter Zimmerman lined a double to right on Axelrod 's 103rd -- and final -- pitch of the evening . 	 " I just did n't want to give in . We got to 3 - 2 and I went with the changeup . I had n't thrown a changeup to a right - hander all game
column23: " and it seemed like a good idea at the time . " 	 That put Washington ahead 6 - 3
column25: Tyler Clippard and Rafael Soriano made it hold up . Soriano pitched the ninth for his fifth save in six chances
column26: and third in three days . 	 " Well
column27: I was tempted to go another route
column28: " Johnson acknowledged afterward about using Soriano again
column29: " but he had n't cried ' Uncle ' for me yet . " 	 Washington
column30: 6 - 0 at home and 7 - 2 overall
column31: opens a three - game set Friday against visiting NL East rival Atlanta . The Braves are on a six - game winning streak and own a major league - best 8 - 1 record . It 's their best start since opening 13 - 1 in 1994 . 	 Swirling wind carried napkins and other debris from the stands onto the grass
column32: pushed batted balls away from the fences
column33: and turned some otherwise routine plays into adventures for fielders . Following a couple of days in the 80s
column34: the temperature dipped into the 50s . 	 And after hitting 11 homers in their previous four games
column35: the Nationals turned to some small ball . 	 In the first inning
column36: Jayson Werth singled to cap a 10 - pitch at - bat
column37: stole second and moved to third when catcher Tyler Flowers ' errant throw went into the outfield . Adam LaRoche made it 1 - 0 with a single on Axelrod 's 33rd pitch . He would need 40 just to get the first three outs . 	 In the third
column38: Denard Span singled
column39: stole second
column40: took third on Werth 's flyout and came home on Harper 's single up the middle . After consecutive walks
column41: Ian Desmond 's sacrifice fly made it 3 - 1 . 	 Chicago pulled even in the fourth . With a man on
column42: Axelrod popped up a bunt that first baseman LaRoche could n't quite reach
column43: and the ball bounced by for an infield single . Alejandro De Aza and Jeff Keppinger hit RBI singles -- ending Chicago 's 0 - for-10 stretch with runners in scoring position over two games . 	 Haren threw 101 pitches and allowed three runs . Shaky
column44: but far more effective than his Nationals debut after signing a $ 13 million
column45: one - year contract as a free agent . In that game

column1: BOSTON --   The Baltimore Orioles used the same formula Thursday night that made them such a surprising success last season . They counted on a strong effort from the bullpen and pulled out a one - run win . 	 Chris Davis hit his sixth homer and Adam Jones drove in two runs
column3: to lead Baltimore past the Boston Red Sox 3 - 2 . 	 After going 29 - 9 in one - run games last season
column4: the Orioles improved to 1 - 3 this year . 	 " It was just a matter of time before that one - run stuff
column5: " Jones said . " We 've got the kind of bullpen that can shut down any type of lineup any night . We 've got the majority of the same team . I know those guys down there
column7: they want to come in and get the job done and have done a pretty good job of it . " 	 Davis and Jones extended their torrid starts for the Orioles
column8: who took two of three games in Boston . The pair has combined for 30 of Baltimore 's 85 hits . 	 " I feel good at the plate . I 'm just not trying to turn and burn
column9: " Jones said . " I 'm just trying to make contact and hit the ball hard and live with the results . That 's been my concept since the beginning of the season . " 	 Then
column10: when asked if he thinks it 's working
column11: the center fielder smiled and said : " I 'm trying to . " 	 Jones is 18 for 39 this season ( .462 ) . 	 Dustin Pedroia and Mike Napoli had consecutive RBI singles for the Red Sox
column12: who dropped a series for the first time after taking two of three on the road from both the New York Yankees and Toronto . 	 The teams played on a chilly night with a game - time temperature of 45 degrees and Fenway Park only about two - thirds full a night after a record sellout streak ended . The paid attendance was 27
column14: the smallest crowd at Fenway since April 16
column15: 2003 . 	 The Orioles broke a 2 - all tie on Jones ' RBI double in the seventh . Manny Machado had a two - out single off reliever Clayton Mortensen ( 0 - 1 ) . Andrew Miller relieved and walked Nick Markakis . Jones then lined reliever Koji Uehara 's first pitch into the left - field corner . 	 That was all the Orioles bullpen needed to close it out . 	 Brian Matusz ( 1 - 0 ) struck out the only two batters he faced and got the win . Jim Johnson pitched the ninth in a light rain for his fourth save . 	 " Brian came in and got some big outs for us . They do what they do
column16: " Orioles manager Buck Showalter said . " Jimmy Johnson -- one - run lead in the American League East . " 	 Baltimore starter Chris Tillman lasted 5 1/3 innings
column17: giving up two runs and six hits . He walked two and struck out five . 	 It was an unusual start to the work day for Tillman . Showalter said the right - hander and fellow pitcher Miguel Gonzalez were in a very minor accident when the taxi they were riding in was tapped from behind en route to the ballpark . 	 Boston fill - in starter Alfredo Aceves pitched five innings
column18: allowing two runs and six hits while walking three and striking out four . He took the spot of John Lackey
column19: placed on the 15 - day disabled list Wednesday after straining his right biceps in his previous start . 	 " Gave us five solid innings of work . Eighty pitches
column20: 80 - 85 was kind of the range we had targeted for him tonight
column21: " Boston manager John Farrell said . " But given his first start of the year
column22: kept the game under control . I thought he managed the lineup well . With the exception of the solo home run on the 3 - 0 pitch by Davis
column23: I thought he worked his way around the lineup fairly well tonight . " 	 Aceves thought his first start went fairly well . 	 " I feel OK . Lasted five innings
column25: we did n't win the game . That 's all that matters . " 	 Davis belted a 3 - 0 fastball into the bleachers behind Boston 's bullpen to push Baltimore ahead 1 - 0 in the second . 	 Boston jumped in front 2 - 1 in the third on the run - scoring singles by Pedroia and Napoli . 	 But the Orioles tied it against Aceves in the fifth when Jones had a two - out RBI single after Machado reached on a bunt single and advanced to second when he was running on the pitch on Markakis ' bouncer to third . 	 Red Sox right - hander Alex Wilson made his major league debut
column26: working a scoreless ninth with a walk . 	 Game notes 	  Farrell said he talked a bit with closer Joel Hanrahan " about going forward . " The right - hander gave up five runs and only got two outs in the ninth inning of Wednesday 's 8 - 5 loss . " He 's our closer
column27: " Farrell said . ... Showalter is one who thinks Fenway 's dugouts are a bit small . He said before the game that he let the four other starting pitchers go into the clubhouse to watch the later part of Wednesday 's game to open some room for others to sit . ... Red Sox DH David Ortiz
column28: who missed all of spring training with a sore right Achilles
column29: went 2 for 3 with two singles
column30: an RBI and a run in his first rehab start for Triple - A Pawtucket . " We feel 20 or so ( at - bats ) are needed and then we 'll reassess
column31: " Farrell said . ... There was an unusual 3 - 5 - 3 play when the left - handed batting Davis hit into a shift and the ball caromed off 1B Napoli over to 3B Will Middlebrooks
column32: who was shifted to the right side . He then threw back to Napoli . ... column2: Calif. --   At this time of the season
column3: diplomacy can be just as important as pitching
column4: hitting and defense . So even though the Oakland Athletics appear to have a decided edge against the AL West rival Los Angeles Angels
column5: they are n't beating their chests about it . 	 Josh Donaldson hit a tiebreaking
column6: two - run homer in the sixth inning
column7: Yoenis Cespedes also went deep and A.J. Griffin pitched eight solid innings Thursday night
column8: leading Oakland to an 8 - 1 victory over the Los Angeles Angels that extended the Athletics ' winning streak to eight games . 	 " They have a heck of a team
column9: but sometimes you catch a team when they 're down and we were lucky to do that
column10: " A 's manager Bob Melvin said . " They 're one of the best teams in all of baseball . So anytime you come in here
column11: you 've got your work cut out for you . Tonight our offense has continued to flourish
column12: and that takes some pressure off the rest of your game . This was probably our best game all the way around . " 	 This was the first time Oakland swept the Angels in the first head - to - head series of a season since 2003
column13: and the first time the Athletics swept their first series at the " Big A " since 1996 . The defending AL West champions outscored the Angels 28 - 11 and were retired in order in only three of the 27 innings . 	 " It 's always great to get off to a good start
column14: but you have to maintain it because it 's a long season
column15: " Melvin said . " If this was in the middle of the season and we had a run like this and they had a poor period
column16: I do n't think it would be significant . Those guys will go on a stretch where they play real well . " 	 Seth Smith had four hits for the A 's
column17: who swept a road trip of six or more games for only the third time since the franchise relocated from Kansas City to Oakland in 1968 . They had a 10 - 0 trip in August 2002 and an 8 - 0 excursion in April 1981 . 	 Griffin ( 2 - 0 ) allowed a run and five hits
column18: struck out two and walked one . The right - hander did not allow a hit after giving up an RBI double by Howie Kendrick with one out in the fourth . 	 " I 'm kind of at a loss for words
column19: actually
column20: " Griffin said . " It 's what you always want to go out there and do
column21: just give your team a chance to win . I did n't have a real good feel for the curveball tonight
column22: but I just tried to keep it in the back of their guys ' heads and just attack the zone and get ahead of people . " 	 Jason Vargas ( 0 - 1 ) was charged with five runs
column23: 10 hits and three walks over 5 2/3 innings . The left - hander yielded just one run over 5 2/3 innings last Friday at Texas in his Angels debut
column24: getting a no - decision in Los Angeles ' 3 - 2 loss . 	 Vargas escaped a bases - loaded jam in the second when Smith grounded into a double play . But he was n't as fortunate in the sixth
column25: when Derek Norris doubled with one out and Donaldson drove his next pitch into the left - field bullpen after going hitless in 11 previous at - bats against Vargas . 	 " Vargas has pretty much had our number -- I know he 's had my number
column26: " Donaldson said . " He 's one of those guys who throws pitches that you 're never looking for
column27: it seems like . And if you are looking for it
column28: it 's just barely off the barrel of the bat . I 've got a lot of respect for Vargas . He 's probably one of the most underrated pitchers in the game . But we were able to grind some at - bats against him . We hit a couple of mistakes and that was the game . " 	 Smith followed Donaldson 's first homer of the season with a double
column29: and Chris Young greeted Kevin Jepsen with a two - run double after Vargas intentionally walked his last batter
column30: Coco Crisp . Cespedes greeted Sean Burnett with a leadoff homer to left - center in the seventh
column31: and the A 's tacked on two more in the ninth against Jerome Williams . 	 " I would like to have that sixth inning back
column33: " Vargas said . " The teams we 've faced
column34: they 're really good offensive clubs . But I think everybody believes in the team we have . " 	 The Angels ' starting pitchers in the series -- C.J. Wilson
column35: Joe Blanton and Vargas -- gave up a combined 15 earned runs and 26 hits in 16 2/3 innings
column36: and each of them allowed a home run . The Angels are off to a 2 - 7 start
column37: the worst since the club 's inaugural 1961 season ( 1 - 8) . The bullpen has a 7.71 ERA over its last six games . 	 A 's second baseman Andy Parrino
column38: recalled from the minors after Scott Sizemore sustained a season - ending knee injury on Tuesday
column39: got his first American League hit when he legged out a double to left - center leading off the third inning . He scored the game 's first run two outs later on a single by Jed Lowrie . 	 Angels left fielder Mike Trout
column40: last season 's AL Rookie of the Year
column41: was moved from the leadoff spot to the No . 2 hole and was 0 - for-4 . Manager Mike Scioscia
column42: whose offense produced a .120 average with runners in scoring position through the team 's first eight games ( 9 - for-75 )
column43: said he made the move to give Trout more of an opportunity to drive in runs . 	 Trout was in the starting lineup 138 times last season following his promotion from Triple - A Salt Lake on April 28 -- all of them in the leadoff spot -- and finished with 83 RBIs
column44: 30 homers and a .326 average . He started in 40 games two seasons ago and batted everywhere in the lineup except third . 	 Game notes 	  Two - time NL Gold Glove 1B Albert Pujols dropped Parrino 's foul pop with two outs and runners at the corners in the fourth
column45: but C Chris Iannetta was right there to make the grab before the ball hit the ground . Iannetta was 0 - for-3 and is hitless in his past 17 at - bats .   This was the first time Oakland began its road schedule with more than five consecutive wins since 1990
column46: when the A 's won their first eight . Their next road trip will go through Tampa Bay and Boston .   The Angels
column47: who finished five games behind Oakland last season
column48: already are 5 games behind the A 's .   Angels 3B Alberto Callaspo was 0 - for-3 in the leadoff spot before leaving in the eighth because of tightness in his right calf . column1: SEATTLE --   All A.J. Pierzynski could do was wait . 	 First to see if his second - inning fly ball would clear the top of the right - field fence for a homer . Then for a crucial flip from pitcher Robbie Ross in the eighth inning as Seattle tried to squeeze across the tying run . 	 Both times Pierzynski and the Texas Rangers came out ahead . 	 Pierzynski homered
column2: David Murphy snapped a 2 - 2 tie with an RBI single in the fifth
column3: and the Texas Rangers toppled Seattle Mariners ace Felix Hernandez in a 4 - 3 win on Thursday night . 	 Pierzynski hit his second homer of the season with one out in the second . The Rangers added an unearned run later in the inning and scored twice in the fifth to deny Hernandez ( 1 - 2 ) a shot at his 100th career victory . 	 " We scored some runs off of Felix
column4: which does n't happen very often
column5: " Pierzynski said . " He 's had the career he 's had and the numbers he 's put up in his career because he 's one of the best . He 's never a fun at - bat . " 	 Joe Ortiz pitched two innings in relief of Texas starter Justin Grimm to get his first victory . Ortiz ( 1 - 0 ) allowed no hits and striking out two in his fourth relief appearance of the season . Joe Nathan pitched the ninth for his third save . 	 Thursday night was Hernandez 's first home start since he signed a $ 175 million extension in the offseason that will keep him in Seattle through the 2019 season . The occasion was celebrated with all 22
column6: 000 - plus fans in attendance receiving giant yellow K - cards and a yellow T - shirt with " King Felix " printed on the front . 	 There were plenty of cheers early when Hernandez recorded a pair of first - inning strikeouts to reach the 1
column7: 500 - mark in his career .   Hernandez got Murphy looking to end the first inning for No . 1
column8: 500 . He walked off the mound to be greeted by a handshake from Adrian Beltre -- one of Hernandez 's closest friends in the game -- and catcher Jesus Montero waiting with the ball to commemorate the milestone number . 	 Hernandez allowed the homer to Pierzynski in the second then saw his defense let him down . Raul Ibanez misplayed Mitch Moreland 's line drive to left field for an error . Leonys Martin followed with a single and
column10: Elvis Andrus had an RBI single to score Moreland and give the Rangers the lead . 	 After Seattle pulled even
column11: the Rangers broke the deadlock in the fifth . Ian Kinsler led off with a single and scored on Murphy 's two - out hit . Nelson Cruz followed with a double to left field to score Lance Berkman for a 4 - 2 lead . 	 Hernandez allowed 10 hits and three earned runs
column12: leaving after giving up a single to Beltre with two outs in the seventh . 	 " I thought he was sharper today than his last outing
column13: " Seattle manager Eric Wedge said . " He had better stuff . A couple of pitches he left up that they got to . " 	 Seattle threatened twice late in the game
column14: none bigger than the eighth inning . Justin Smoak singled and Jesus Montero doubled to open the eighth . Robert Andino followed with a slow chopper to score Smoak and cut the Rangers ' lead to 4 - 3 with pinch - runner Endy Chavez advancing to third . 	 Seattle then tried to squeeze across the tying run
column15: but Brendan Ryan 's bunt went directly back at Ross
column16: who moved quickly off the mound and flipped the ball Pierzynski in time to get Chavez breaking from third . 	 " Lucky for us he bunted it hard enough to where Robbie could get it to me in time
column17: " Pierzynski said . " I was just begging for him to get it to me as fast as he could because it 's an awkward play for a catcher . " 	 An inning earlier
column18: Ross entered and struck out Raul Ibanez with the bases loaded to end the seventh . 	 It was Seattle 's third straight loss and the only bit of news that was good for Seattle surrounded Michael Morse
column19: who left the game in the seventh inning after getting hit on the right hand as he checked his swing . Morse was diagnosed with a small fracture in his right little finger . He 's expected to miss three to seven days . 	 " I 'm going to try and rehab this as best I can real quick
column20: " Morse said . " Might have to play through some pain . " 	 Game notes 	  Seattle Seahawks CB Richard Sherman threw out the first pitch . He was joined by teammates Earl Thomas and Kam Chancellor with seats in the first row near the Rangers ' dugout .   Seattle gave 2B Dustin Ackley the night off . Ackley is hitting just .100 .   Japanese pitchers Yu Darvish and Hisashi Iwakuma will meet for the third time in their major league careers on Friday night . The pitchers faced off six times while playing in Nippon Professional Baseball . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column21: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column22: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million

column1: SAN DIEGO -- Dodgers pitcher Zack Greinke broke his left collarbone in a bench - clearing brawl with the San Diego Padres during Los Angeles ' 3 - 2 victory Thursday night . 	 Juan Uribe 's pinch - hit home run in the eighth put the Dodgers ahead
column2: two innings after Greinke hit Carlos Quentin on the left shoulder with a pitch . 	 The slugger started walking toward the mound

column1: CHICAGO --   Starlin Castro had a rough Thursday . His Friday was considerably better . 	 One day after misplaying a routine grounder that led to four unearned runs
column2: Castro hit a home run and drove in the winning run with a double in the ninth inning to give the Chicago Cubs a 4 - 3 victory over the San Francisco Giants . 	 The Cubs trailed 3 - 2 heading into the bottom of the ninth after Kyuji Fujikawa blew the save but pinch - hitter Dioner Navarro
column4: led off and connected for a wind - blown homer off Giants closer Sergio Romo ( 0 - 1 ) to tie it . 	 The young Cubs ' shortstop
column5: who was spotless in the field Friday

column7: " Castro said . " Every day is a new day . Play hard

" With Cain you want to be aggressive . He throws strikes

column1: NEW YORK --   Robinson Cano jumped up after applying the tag that completed a triple play and thrust his arms above his head . Kevin Youkilis grinned broadly and slapped as many hands as he could . Jayson Nix and Lyle Overbay high - fiving each other
column2: too . 	 The New York Yankees ' makeshift infield was having triple the fun Friday night . 	 The Yankees turned a triple play at home for the first time in 45 years
column3: Adam Jones dropped Vernon Wells ' fly ball while blowing a bubble for a tiebreaking three - run error and New York beat the Baltimore Orioles 5 - 2 Friday night for its fourth straight win . 	 " That 's like being a kid again

column8: who replaced injured shortstop Eduardo Nunez in the third inning

column18: " Teixeira said . " That 's one of the toughest triple plays you 'll ever see . " 	 The Yankees

column22: at Oakland -- with Sabathia on the mound . They had n't accomplished the feat in the Bronx since June 3

column1: PITTSBURGH --   Andrew McCutchen and the Pittsburgh Pirates hope they 've finally put an end to their hitting woes . 	 McCutchen hit a tiebreaking homer in the seventh inning and drove in three runs to lead Pittsburgh past the Cincinnati Reds 6 - 5 on Friday night . 	 The Pirates entered the game batting .153
column2: the second worst average for a major league team through nine games since 1921
column3: according to STATS . The 2003 Detroit Tigers hit .140 in their first nine games on the way to a 119 - loss season . 	 McCutchen 's leadoff shot to left field off J.J. Hoover ( 0 - 3 )
column4: his second homer of the season
column5: snapped a 5 - all tie . 	 Cincinnati had just tied the score in the top of the seventh on Brandon Phillips ' second home run of the game
column6: a two - run drive to center off Tony Watson ( 1 - 0 ) . 	 " It was important for us to answer back right away
column7: " McCutchen said . " That 's the type of team we are . We 're fighters . " 	 The first four batters in Pittsburgh 's lineup -- Starling Marte
column9: McCutchen and Garrett Jones -- had two hits each as the Pirates totaled 12 . They entered the game with a .153 batting average
column11: and had scored only 21 runs in their first nine games . 	 Every Pirates position player had a hit by the end of the fifth inning . 	 " This is what we 're capable of doing
column12: " McCutchen said . " We have good hitters in our lineup . It 's a matter of getting in that Michael Jordan - type mentality where you start thinking that you can outdo the next guy . That 's how we were tonight . One guy started hitting
column13: then everyone else did . That 's how it 's always been in baseball . " 	 Hoover took over the big league lead in losses after giving up the decisive homer to McCutchen . 	 " It seems like he leaves that one pitch out over the plate and they 're not missing it
column14: " Cincinnati manager Dusty Baker said . " You 're going to give it up sometimes and he gave it up to one of the best . McCutchen is n't a slouch . He 's one of the best players in the league . " 	 Walker and McCutchen hit consecutive two - run singles in the second to give Pittsburgh a 5 - 1 lead . 	 Marte extended his streak of multihit games to six . He is 12 for 24 during that stretch . The leadoff batter also has had a hit in the first inning in each of those six games . 	 " He may not be the typical leadoff hitter who draws a lot of walks
column15: but the thing he does well is that he swings at good pitches
column16: " Pirates manager Clint Hurdle said . " When he sees the first hittable pitch
column17: he goes after it aggressively and puts a good swing on it . " 	 The Pirates had not scored more than four runs in any of their previous 13 games against the NL Central rival Reds . Pittsburgh has won three of four overall after starting the season 1 - 5 . 	 Phillips hit a leadoff homer in the second inning off Pirates starter A.J. Burnett . The cleanup - hitting second baseman has four home runs this season and 10 career two - homer games . 	 " He hit two home runs to straightaway center and you just do n't see that very often in this ballpark
column18: " Hurdle said . " That was impressive . " 	 However
column19: Phillips struck out to end the game with runners on first and second as Jason Grilli pitched a scoreless ninth inning for his fourth save in as many opportunities . 	 Burnett went six innings and allowed three runs on six hits . He struck out eight and walked three . 	 " I need to start working deeper into games
column21: pulled after 106 pitches . " I 'm trying to throw nasty pitches to get strikeouts when I do n't necessarily make nasty pitches and it 's running up my pitch counts . " 	 Cincinnati starter Mike Leake is now winless in eight career starts at PNC Park
column22: more than any visiting pitcher in the history of the 12 - year - old ballpark . He gave up five runs and 10 hits in six innings with two walks and two strikeouts . 	 " He really settled down after those first two innings and gave us some innings
column23: which is important with the stretch of schedule we 're facing now where we ca n't afford to blow out the bullpen
column25: whose team began a string of playing on 20 consecutive days . 	 Pittsburgh catcher Russell Martin
column26: who entered with a .043 batting average
column27: singled home a run in the first inning to open the scoring . 	 After Walker and McCutchen gave the Pirates a four - run lead in the second
column28: Cincinnati cut the deficit to 5 - 3 as Devin Mesoraco drove in a run with a groundout in the fourth and then hit an RBI double in the sixth . column1: MIAMI --   Chase Utley 's bat is drawing more attention than his knees . 	 Utley 's go - ahead triple in the 10th inning off Jon Rauch led the Phillies over Miami 3 - 1 on Friday night and dropped the Marlins to 1 - 9 . 	 Utley is hitting .316 with two homers and 10 RBIs
column2: reaching base in all 10 games . He was bothered by knee problems the previous two years and did n't make his first appearance of 2012 until June 27 . 	 " I 'm pleased that I 'm starting the season
column4: " Utley said . " We 're starting to play better baseball . Swinging the bats better . The weather is warming up . I think it 's going to be a fun summer . " 	 John Lannan gave up one run and three hits in six innings . 	 " He 's back to the Chase that 's wreaked havoc in my games against the Phillies
column5: " Lannan said . " It 's good to be on this side of it . I 'm just glad to see he 's out there playing every day . " 	 Miami is off to the poorest start by a big league team since Baltimore and Houston lost nine of their first 10 games in 2010
column7: held to four singles by Lannan and four relievers
column8: are batting .209 with just two home runs and 15 extra - base hits . 	 " We have to keep grinding
column9: get on the other side of this thing and get that confidence back
column10: " Marlins manager Mike Redmond said . 	 Ben Revere singled with one out in the 10th and Utley tripled into the right - field corner . Ryan Howard was intentionally walked
column11: and Michael Young hit a hard grounder up the middle that shortstop Adeiny Hechavarria gloved with a dive . He flipped the ball to second baseman Donovan Solano
column12: who missed stepping on the base as Utley scored on the infield hit . 	 Utley missed a home run when he a pulled a 3 - 1 fastball from Rauch ( 0 - 1 ) far foul . He then jumped on a hanging changeup
column13: with Revere running on the pitch . 	 Marlins right fielder Giancarlo Stanton was a late scratch with a sore left shoulder . He said he will undergo an MRI Saturday and could miss several games . 	 Phillippe Aumont ( 1 - 0 ) pitched a scoreless ninth for his first major league win
column14: and Jonathan Papelbon finished for his second save with a scoreless 10th . 	 The crowd of 17
column16: 810 Wednesday
column17: a record low for Marlins Park
column18: which opened last year . 	 Ricky Nolasco
column19: at $ 11.5 million the only high - salaried Marlins player to survive an offseason payroll purge
column20: allowed one run and seven hits in six innings . 	 Doubles by Howard and Domonic Brown put the Phillies ahead in the sixth . Miami ended a 15 - inning scoreless streak in the bottom half when Juan Pierre was hit by a pitch and scored on a two - out single by Placido Polanco .
