column2: Mo. -- Jose Reyes heard a pop in his left ankle as he awkwardly slid into second base . After that
column3: everything else was a blur to the Toronto Blue Jays on Friday night . 	 The trainers lifted their star shortstop onto a cart
column4: and the cart drove through the bullpen gate in right field . The sight was of Reyes
column6: being pushed out of their clubhouse after an 8 - 4 win over the Kansas City Royals
column7: on his way to have an MRI exam . 	 The sound of general manager Alex Anthopoulos on the phone with other GMs
column8: already trying to make a deal for a replacement amid the sobering news that Reyes could be out up to three months . 	 " It 's on everybody 's mind
column9: " Blue Jays manager John Gibbons said . " Does n't matter if he 's on our team or another team
column10: in the baseball world -- the baseball community -- your heart goes out to whoever it might be . In this case
column11: he 's one of the top guys in the game . " 	 Reyes had just driven in two runs with a base hit when he was attempting to steal second base in the sixth inning . He appeared to be indecisive about whether to go in sliding or standing
column12: and made the late choice to hit the dirt
column13: his trailing ankle twisting cruelly beneath him . 	 Reyes slid over the bag
column14: and then rolled around on the dirt
column15: screaming in pain . Trainers for both teams ran out to help him while a green cart was driven in from the outfield . 	 " It did n't look good
column16: obviously
column17: " Blue Jays starter J.A. Happ said . 	 Anthopoulos said the results of the MRI exam may not be known until Saturday
column18: and while the initial diagnosis was a sprained left ankle
column19: the GM acknowledged Reyes is headed for the disabled list and that he could be out from one to three months . 	 " You never want to see it
column21: you 've been through enough to know it 's going to happen over the course of the season
column22: " Anthopoulos said . 	 " If it 's good news
column24: " he said . " The other scenario could be three months
column25: or if something comes up we 're not expecting
column26: it could be more than that . " 	 Happ ( 2 - 0 )
column27: the only Blue Jays starter to win this season
column28: gave up three runs on 41 pitches in the first inning . But he survived a couple shaky stretches to last four more frames
column29: and Aaron Loup went the final three innings for his first career save . 	 Adam Lind and Emilio Bonifacio also drove in two runs each for the Blue Jays
column30: who hammered the Royals ' Luis Mendoza ( 0 - 1 ) for eight runs -- seven of them earned -- in just 5 2/3 innings . 	 " He really struggled to get the feel of his breaking ball
column31: struggled to keep it down in the zone
column32: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . " There were some times he was trying to bounce it and could n't do it . It was just one of those nights . He was n't near as sharp as he was in Philly . " 	 Lorenzo Cain drove in a pair of runs for Kansas City
column33: which could n't overcome some shaky pitching and even shakier defense . The Royals committed three errors
column34: matching their season total . 	 Toronto struck first for just the second time all season when J.P. Arencibia 's single to left and a double by Lind down the right - field line gave the Blue Jays a 2 - 0 lead . 	 The Royals answered back with three in the bottom half . 	 Salvador Perez 's single to right drove in the first run . Happ loaded the bases moments later
column35: earning a visit from Blue Jays pitching coach Pete Walker
column36: and then watched Cain smack the first pitch he saw to center field to give Kansas City a 3 - 2 lead . 	 Bonifacio pulled the Blue Jays back ahead in the second when he doubled off the wall in right to drive in a run . The speedster headed for third on the throw to the plate
column37: and then scored when Perez threw the ball down the left - field line -- the catcher 's second error of the game . 	 Lind delivered a sacrifice fly in the third to extend the Blue Jays ' lead
column38: and Alcides Escobar matched him with a double in the fifth to pull Kansas City back within 5 - 4 . 	 Bonifacio 's two - out double in the sixth gave Toronto its two - run cushion back . Luke Hochevar came in to relieve Mendoza
column39: and Reyes followed with a two - run single to make the score 8 - 4 . 	 That 's when the star shortstop attempted to steal second . 	 The momentum of his late slide carried him over the base
column40: and his ankle twisted backward as second base umpire Marvin Hudson signaled safe . Reyes screamed in pain
column41: and then pulled the front of his blue jersey over his face as trainers from both teams ran out onto the infield . 	 A hush fell over the crowd
column42: and Blue Jays ' clubhouse was so quiet that it seemed as if they had lost the game rather than won when it opened shortly after the final out was made . 	 " Jose is great . He 's a big part of this team . I ca n't emphasize that enough
column43: " Anthopoulos said . " Every team goes through these things . I do n't believe we 're a team built on one player
column44: no matter how great a player it is . Just continue to move forward . " 	 Anthopoulos said he was n't sure who would replace Reyes on the roster
column45: but that a move could be made before Saturday night 's game . ... Toronto will start RHP R.A. Dickey on Saturday against Royals RHP James Shields . ... Toronto designated RHP Edgar Gonzalez for assignment and sent him to Triple - A Buffalo when he cleared waivers . 	 Information from The Associated Press was used in this report . column1: MINNEAPOLIS --   As snowflakes swirled over Target Field
column2: John Buck drove another ball deep into the air to join them . 	 Buck and the New York Mets sure did n't let the wintry Minnesota night slow down their swings . 	 Buck kept up his powerful start with a grand slam
column3: his fourth home run in the past four games
column4: and the Mets beat the Twins 16 - 5 on Friday . 	 " You 're almost starting to take it for granted
column5: " Mets manager Terry Collins said . " When you need a big hit
column6: he 's going to get it . And he 's going to drive in runs when he gets his hit . It 's just amazing
column7: one night after the next . " 	 Buck became only the fourth major league player in at least 92 years to reach 19 RBIs in the first 10 games of a season
column8: according to STATS research dating to 1921 . Chris Davis did it for Baltimore this year
column9: Manny Ramirez for Cleveland in 1999 and Lou Gehrig for the Yankees in 1927 . 	 In his first two weeks with the Mets after being traded twice during the offseason
column10: Buck already has six homers . His career high is 20 . He also has the most RBIs in history by a player in his first 10 games with a new team . 	 " I 'm benefiting from last year . I just tried too hard
column12: recalling his .192 batting average for Miami in 2012 . " Now I 'm just going up there and trying to hit the ball solid
column13: and good things are happening . " 	 Jonathon Niese ( 2 - 0 ) lasted only five innings in the frigid weather
column14: ending his streak of 22 consecutive starts of six or more that dated to last June . That was the longest current run in the majors . He threw 101 pitches
column16: five runs ( four earned ) and four walks while striking out one . 	 " The balls
column17: they felt like pool cues out there . They were slippery
column18: " said Buck
column19: who told Niese to ditch his cutter because he could n't hang onto it . 	 David Wright drove in four runs and missed the cycle by a home run
column20: Daniel Murphy had four hits and four RBIs and the Mets did n't let the wintry conditions hurt their offense in any way . They overwhelmed Twins starter Vance Worley ( 0 - 2 )
column21: who got three outs and gave up nine runs . 	 " It did n't affect the other guys
column22: so it 's hard for us to whine about it
column23: " Twins manager Ron Gardenhire said of the cold . " The other guys came out on the other side and whacked the ball around pretty good . " 	 The Mets batted around in each of the first two innings
column24: scoring five times in each frame . The first five batters reached base in both innings . After Worley walked Ike Davis to leave the bases loaded in the second
column25: the short - sleeved right - hander was removed by Gardenhire . 	 Pedro Hernandez relieved
column26: and Buck drove a full - count pitch into the second deck of seats above left - center field to stretch the lead to 10 - 2 . 	 The Mets have 14 home runs
column27: at least one in each game . Marlon Byrd
column28: who had two RBIs
column29: missed another by a few inches in the second
column30: settling for a triple . 	 Considered a throw - in for the Mets when they sent NL Cy Young Award winner R.A. Dickey to Toronto last December
column31: and also for the Blue Jays when they acquired four other stars in the fire - sale deal with Florida a month earlier
column32: Buck is crouching behind the plate until top prospect Travis d'Arnaud is ready to take over . But the way the 32 - year - old catcher has been hitting so far
column33: there should be no rush . 	 Buck 's previous career high for RBIs in a month was 17 in August 2004 with Kansas City . He has 17 games left in April to obliterate that total . 	 " We 're fortunate to have a guy like that
column34: a veteran guy who can handle the pitching staff as well as he does and also handle the bat the way he does
column36: " Niese said . 	 Enticed by free coffee and hot cocoa
column37: Twins fans came layered in ski gear
column38: hunting clothes and whatever else to keep warm . The announced attendance was 23
column40: but that 's tickets sold and not the actual number of people inside . Propane heaters whirred in the dugout
column41: and most players had almost every inch of skin covered . 	 Except Worley
column42: who prefers to work without sleeves . He allowed seven hits and two walks while striking out one . Seven of the runs he gave up were earned . He has lost a career - worst five straight decisions spanning seven starts since last Aug. 1 for Philadelphia . 	 " It did n't affect me at all
column43: " Worley said . " It was pretty similar to opening day . " 	 Except for the boxscore . Worley 's ERA jumped to 10.50 . He has allowed 17 runs in 12 innings over three starts . 	 Game notes 	  LHP Scott Diamond
column44: who was held back at spring training to continue rehabilitation on his surgically repaired throwing elbow
column45: will make his 2013 debut for the Twins on Saturday against RHP Matt Harvey ( 2 - 0
column46: 0.64 ERA ) of the Mets . The weather is supposed to be dry but still cold . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: ST . LOUIS -- Shelby Miller 's lone regret is it took a lot of work to send Milwaukee Brewers hitters trudging back to the dugout . 	 The 22 - year - old rookie allowed one hit in seven innings
column2: a single by Norichika Aoki to open the game
column3: and the St. Louis Cardinals had just enough to spoil Kyle Lohse 's first start as a visitor since 2007 in a 2 - 0 victory on Friday night . 	 " He was impressive
column4: " closer Mitchell Boggs said . " He 's been impressive since he got to St. Louis
column5: so I do n't think anybody 's surprised by what he 's doing . " 	 Miller
column6: a first - round draft pick in 2009
column7: has worked 13 scoreless innings in two career starts at Busch Stadium . Faster outs
column9: and he might have gone the distance against Milwaukee . 	 " They were battling me all night
column10: they were n't giving in at all
column11: " Miller said . " At the end of the day I found a way to get them out . 	 " It was usually seven pitches later
column12: but as long as I 'm getting them out I guess that 's all that matters . " 	 Miller did n't trick the Brewers
column13: held to two hits overall and shut out for the first time this season . He just overpowered them . 	 " They were trying to catch up with it
column14: " manager Ron Roenicke said . " After the first time through
column15: it was n't like he was surprising them . They just were n't catching up to it . " 	 A near - sellout crowd of 42
column16: 528 bundled up on 44 - degree night for the second Stan Musial tribute of the opening homestand
column17: featuring a harmonica giveaway and the unveiling of a memorial plaque attached to the iconic Musial statue outside Busch Stadium . Seven members of the Musial family threw simultaneous first pitches and Musial 's No . 6 was cut into the outfield grass in center . 	 David Freese had an RBI single at the end of a three - hit flurry to open the second and Yadier Molina hit his second homer in the seventh for the Cardinals
column18: who have allowed one run during a three - game winning streak . 	 Lohse
column19: a 16 - game winner whom the Cardinals did not attempt to re - sign
column20: allowed two runs in seven innings while throwing 82 pitches -- 31 fewer than Miller needed . He received a nice ovation before his first at - bat leading off the third
column21: with hundreds of fans standing . 	 " It was pretty cool
column22: " Lohse said . " I felt like I did my thing here and it was appreciated . " 	 Miller ( 2 - 0 ) had a career - best eight strikeouts in his third career start
column23: one more than he had in his debut against the Reds in the 2012 regular - season finale . He retired his final 17 in order after hitting Alex Gonzalez with one out in the second
column24: and fanned Ryan Braun and Carlos Gomez twice each . 	 Lohse ( 0 - 1 ) pulled a nice escape in the second
column25: holding the Cardinals to one run after giving up three straight hits . He allowed one hit the next four innings before Molina homered with one out in the seventh . 	 He 's still rounding into form after signing a three - year
column26: $ 33 million free agent deal on March 25
column27: and facing the Cardinals posed an additional challenge . 	 " I did n't get ahead of as many guys because I was trying to be really careful knowing that they know me
column28: " Lohse said . " I did n't want to groove any first - pitch fastballs or anything . " 	 Lohse
column29: who is 30 - 18 with a 3.39 ERA at Busch Stadium
column30: made his first start in St. Louis in an opposition uniform since a 5 - 1 win for the Reds on June 7
column31: 2007 . 	 Trevor Rosenthal retired the side in order in the eighth and Boggs stranded two runners in the ninth
column32: striking out Braun and Rickie Weeks to earn his second save in four chances to wind up a game played in 2 hours
column33: 15 minutes . 	 " I take a lot of pride in what I do
column34: " Boggs said . " That was a big one for me and a little emotion shows . " 	 Carlos Beltran led off the first with a broken - bat single that gave him a .575 average ( 23 for 40 ) against Lohse
column35: and the Cardinals had runners on second and third after Braun
column36: leaving his feet at the last second on a running attempt
column37: could n't hang onto Molina 's double to the gap to left - center . Freese singled up the middle on the next pitch to put St. Louis ahead
column38: but Lohse got eighth - place hitter Pete Kozma on a called third strike and Miller grounded into a double play . 	 Aoki is 12 for 25 during a six - game hitting streak . ... Cardinals rookie Matt Adams
column39: the backup first baseman
column40: was on the bench despite his .643 average . " He 's done a nice job for them
column41: " Brewers manager Ron Roenicke said before the game . " Hopefully
column42: he 's not in there a lot . " ... The Brewers ' Alex Gonzalez got hit by a pitch on the left hand in the second and was taken out the next inning . X - rays were negative . column1: PHOENIX --   Patrick Corbin did n't earn a spot in the Arizona rotation until a couple of days before the season started . He was sent up to the majors and back to the minors three times last season . 	 He 's had his struggles but
column3: he sure can pitch against the Los Angeles Dodgers . 	 The young left - hander gave up three hits in six innings and the Diamondbacks beat the Dodgers in Arizona for the sixth time in a row
column4: 3 - 0 on Friday night . 	 Corbin got the best of a far better known lefty
column6: who ran his scoreless innings streak to 19 to start the season before the Diamondbacks scratched one across in the fourth inning . Arizona got two more in the eighth . 	 " I knew coming in that it was going to be tough for us getting runs
column8: " so I knew I had to go out there and put up some zeros . " 	 Corbin is 2 - 1 with a save against the Dodgers
column9: giving up three runs in 20 1/3 innings ( 1.33 ERA ) . 	 " He was throwing the ball really well
column10: " Arizona manager Kirk Gibson said . " He had great command and it helped us going down the road in our bullpen in extra innings . Kershaw walked three after walking just one in 16 innings in his first two starts . 	 " It was a battle for me
column18: " Kershaw said . " After the first inning I really did n't have a breaking ball . I just could n't find the rhythm with it . I was basically pitching with a fastball for most of the night
column19: which obviously makes it difficult . " 	 Dodgers manager Don Mattingly could n't find much fault with Kershaw 's performance . " They kept us down . You kind of hate to waste a performance like that from Kersh
column20: but we were n't able to get anything on the board

column2: Calif. --   Bud Norris has done a good job so far as the No . 1 starter for the Houston Astros . 	 Norris pitched three - hit ball over seven innings
column3: Rick Ankiel drove in three runs and Justin Maxwell hit his first home run of the season

column5: " Norris said . " It 's not like anything changes . You try to do it every time and it 's not necessarily going to go down that way . " 	 Norris ( 2 - 1 ) struck out five and walked two in his 100th big league start
column6: helping the Astros win their third in a row after six straight losses . 	 Rookie manager Bo Porter used three relievers in the ninth to clinch the combined four - hitter . 	 " This guy 's a No . 1 starter and he 's pitched a lot of big games
column7: " Porter said . " I think his best years are definitely ahead of him . He 's growing up right in front of our eyes
column8: and it 's a pleasure to see . " 	 Singles by Brendan Harris
column9: Mark Trumbo and Hank Conger were their only hits against Norris . 	 The Angels
column10: coming off a three - game sweep by Oakland
column11: have lost five straight and are off to a 2 - 8 start -- matching the worst in franchise history . 	 The inaugural 1961 club also lost eight of its first 10 . 	 Making matters worse was the way Friday 's game ended
column12: with Josh Hamilton forgetting the number of outs and getting doubled up at first base on Mark Trumbo 's foul pop to Jason Castro . 	 " That 's obviously a bad play . That 's a mental mistake
column13: " manager Mike Scioscia said . " As perfect as players try to play
column14: and as hard as they try to play
column15: unfortunately mental mistakes are occasionally going to creep into the scenario . 	 " We 've seen it from other teams
column16: and unfortunately it got us tonight . And Josh knows it . He 's accountable . He knows he messed up . So we 're going to move on . It 's a mental mistake . It happens . It 's obviously ugly when it happens
column17: and we 're going to move on . That 's it . " 	 Tommy Hanson ( 1 - 1 ) threw 108 pitches through five innings
column18: giving up five runs
column19: eight hits and two walks . 	 The Angels
column21: have had their rotation struggle on this homestand . 	 Hanson
column23: Joe Blanton and Jason Vargas have allowed a combined 20 earned runs
column25: four homers and 10 walks in 21 2/3 innings . 	 Ace right - hander Jered Weaver is on the disabled list for at least a month because of a broken bone in his left arm . 	 Garrett Richards will come out of the bullpen to make his first start of the season on Saturday . 	 Hanson gave up hits to his first four batters and threw 27 pitches before retiring anyone . 	 Jose Altuve singled and scored on a drive to right - center by Justin Maxwell
column26: who was thrown out trying for a triple . TV replays showed that umpire Laz Diaz got the call wrong
column27: as Luis Jimenez took the relay throw from second baseman Howie Kendrick and applied the tag after Maxwell 's foot hit the bag . 	 Castro and Chris Carter followed with singles
column28: and both runners advanced when Hanson attempted to pick off Castro and shortstop Brendan Harris mishandled the throw for an error . A full - count walk to Carlos Pena loaded the bases for J.D. Martinez
column29: who struck out . But Ankiel grounded a two - run single just past shortstop on Hanson 's 35th pitch
column30: giving Houston a 3 - 0 lead . 	 Maxwell
column31: who led the Astros last season with 18 homers
column32: made it 4 - 0 in the second inning with a drive to left - center on a 2 - 1 pitch . It was the 18th home run given up in 90 1/3 innings this season by a Angels pitching staff that has a 5.38 ERA . 	 Ankiel
column33: playing for his fifth big league club after signing a minor league contract with the Astros and getting an invite to spring training
column34: completed the scoring with an RBI double in the third . 	 Game notes 	  The Angels paid tribute to their late public address announcer

column2: Calif. --   Josh Donaldson never had a game - ending hit in one of Oakland 's major league - high 14 walkoff wins last year . 	 His opposite - field home run with one out in the 12th inning Friday night extended the Athletics ' winning streak to nine games with a 4 - 3 victory over the Detroit Tigers in a rematch of their playoff series last fall . 	 Donaldson 's drive to right off Brayan Villarreal ( 0 - 2 ) was his first career game - ending hit . 	 " It was fun . This team has a bunch of great guys here and lots of players with the capability to win games
column3: " Donaldson said . " I never had a walkoff last year . Obviously it 's special for me this year . " 	 And in typical fashion for the reigning AL West champions
column4: Josh Reddick found Donaldson with a pair of celebratory whipped cream pies -- a scene reminiscent of those 14 walk - off wins last year . 	 Prince Fielder homered and had four hits for the Tigers
column5: who beat Oakland in a five - game AL division series last season on their way to the World Series . 	 Ramon Santiago hit a two - out triple in the top of the 12th before Chris Resop ( 1 - 0 ) relieved Jerry Blevins and retired Austin Jackson on a fly to center . 	 The A 's improved to an AL - best 9 - 2

column13: broken - bat single in the seventh but was replaced in the field in the top of the 10th after straining his left groin . 	 Fielder connected for his third home run with a drive to center in the third . He singled in the first and led off the sixth with a double
column14: then singled again in the 11th . Fielder had two four - hit games last season . 	 Oakland has n't lost since dropping its first two games of the year at home to Seattle . 	 The A 's
column15: coming off a 6 - 0 road trip through Houston and Anaheim
column16: accomplished the 14th winning streak of nine games or more in Oakland history . They also have the second - longest winning streak in Oakland history during the month of April . 	 Tigers catcher Alex Avila was hit in the helmet on a backswing when Brandon Moss struck out in the eighth but stayed in the game after being examined . Moss was called for interference on the play and Yoenis Cespedes had to return to first . 	 Cespedes was then picked off for the third out
column17: and landed hard on his left hand after a tumbling slide on the play . He was removed in the 11th

column21: " manager Jim Leyland said Friday . " Weather conditions were as bad as I 've ever played in

column1: SEATTLE --   Through the first couple weeks of the season
column2: Hisashi Iwakuma has been the most impressive part of Seattle 's starting staff . 	 Iwakuma pitched 6 2/3 solid innings and got the better of countryman Yu Darvish as the Mariners beat the Texas Rangers 3 - 1 on Friday night to end a three - game losing streak . 	 In his three starts
column3: Iwakuma has allowed a total of five earned runs and nine hits in 20 2/3 innings . While he is overshadowed by Felix Hernandez
column4: Iwakuma 's start to 2013 is worth noticing . 	 Kyle Seager gave Seattle an offensive jolt with a two - run double in the first inning and Iwakuma made it stand . 	 " I knew from the very beginning it was going to be a pitchers ' game
column5: " Iwakuma said through an interpreter . " And knowing that ( Darvish ) is on the mound on the other side
column6: it 's always exciting because he 's a good pitcher . " 	 It was the seventh all - time pitching matchup between the pair
column7: both in Japan and the majors . Darvish ( 2 - 1 ) holds a 4 - 3 advantage . 	 This time it was Iwakuma 's turn to shine . 	 He held the Rangers bats silent until the fourth inning when Ian Kinsler led off with a homer . That proved to be the extent of the Rangers ' offense as Iwakuma and three relievers combined to shut down Texas . 	 Tom Wilhelmsen pitched the ninth for his fourth save . 	 " He was throwing pitches to the corner of the strike zone and had a good split working
column8: " Texas DH Lance Berkman said . 	 " I might have counted three splits that stayed up all night . Everything else was in the zone and out . He was just really good . He threw a great game . " 	 He was perfect through three innings until Kinsler led off the fourth with a towering homer that barely cleared the glove of Raul Ibanez leaping at the wall in left . 	 It was the most obvious example to date of the new dimensions at Safeco Field being a factor . 	 A year ago
column9: Kinsler 's homer would have either been caught on the warning track or caromed off the wall
column10: which has been moved in slightly and lowered to 8 feet . 	 " It is what it is . But I have to keep the ball down and that ball was up . I paid the price for it
column11: " Iwakuma said . 	 Instead of getting rattled
column12: Iwakuma kept rolling . He retired the next five straight and eight of his final 11 . Iwakuma left with two outs in the seventh after throwing 90 pitches
column13: giving up just three hits and striking out six . 	 Texas had a chance to get to Iwakuma in the sixth when Kinsler led off with a single and was called safe stealing second base by umpire Gary Darling when replays clearly showed he was out . 	 With Mariners fans expressing their displeasure after the missed call was shown on the giant new video board
column14: Iwakuma escaped the jam getting Berkman and Adrian Beltre to pop out to the infield to end the inning . 	 Iwakuma could have continued if not for problems with a blister on his pitching hand . He said a second blood blister was forming on top of the original and that was why his night ended after only 90 pitches . 	 " That was something I had to think about being on the mound . But I 'll be ready
column15: I have five days of rest this time . I should be ready for my next start
column16: " Iwakuma said . 	 Charlie Furbush took over with two outs in the seventh and allowed a single and a walk

column1: BOSTON --   Shane Victorino did n't even notice Tampa Bay 's unusual five - man infield . His only thought was to make contact with the speedy Jacoby Ellsbury standing on third base . 	 Victorino had a well - placed RBI single into an overloaded infield in the 10th inning Saturday
column2: lifting the Red Sox to a 2 - 1 win over the Rays . 	 Ellsbury singled with one out against Brandon Gomes ( 0 - 1 )
column3: stole second and advanced on catcher Jose Lobaton 's throwing error when the ball deflected off shortstop Yunel Escobar 's glove and into short right field . column4: but was unable to make a throw home . 	 " That 's the goal right there

column7: " he said . " It 's probably got to be hit right at someone to have them make a throw . " 	 David Ross had a solo homer for Boston

column1: CHICAGO --   San Francisco showed off its deep bullpen on a day the Cubs had to look for yet another closer this season . 	 With Sergio Romo unavailable after pitching four of the past five days
column2: the Giants turned to Santiago Casilla
column3: who nailed down his first save of the season with two scoreless innings in a 3 - 2 victory over the Chicago Cubs on Saturday . 	 The Cubs threatened in the eighth
column4: putting two on with no outs
column5: before Soriano grounded out and Welington Castillo hit into a double play against Casilla . 	 " It 's a nice luxury to have 2 - 3 guys
column6: when you give your closer a break
column7: that you 're comfortable with them closing the game and they 're comfortable out there
column8: " Giants manager Bruce Bochy said . " And what a great job Santiago did . " 	 The Cubs put Kyuji Fujikawa on the 15 - day disabled list with a strained right forearm . He had taken over for Carlos Marmol
column9: who had been ineffective . 	 They could use a reliever like Casilla
column10: who saved 25 games for the World Series champion Giants last season . 	 " He 's versatile
column11: " Bochy said . " We can use him seventh
column14: lefties . He 's throwing the ball well right now . He 's got four pitches . He 's a guy who likes being out there late in the ballgame too . " 	 Madison Bumgarner allowed two runs while pitching neatly into the seventh inning and Marco Scutaro had three hits for the Giants . 	 Pinch - hitter Dioner Navarro hit a two - out
column15: two - run homer off Bumgarner in the seventh to pull the Cubs to 3 - 2 . It was Navarro 's second career pinch home run in two days
column16: each hit from a different side of the plate . His tying homer in the ninth Friday was hit from the left side . 	 " I 'm just getting myself mentally ready
column17: taking swings in the clubhouse
column18: " Navarro said . " Just go out there and swing . 	 Bumgarner ( 3 - 0 ) struck out six and walked two
column19: one intentional
column20: in 6 2/3 innings . 	 " All the pitches felt pretty good today
column21: " Bumgarner said . 	 Cubs starter Jeff Samardzija ( 1 - 2 ) allowed two runs and seven hits
column22: struck out five and walked one in six innings . In his previous start
column23: he struck out a career - high 13 and allowed four runs in 5 2/3 innings in Atlanta . 	 " You play a team like that
column24: you 've got to get ahead in the count
column25: " Samardzija said . " They work the count . They make you throw a lot of pitches . " 	 A few snowflakes fell in the morning
column26: and the temperature at first pitch was 38 degrees . 	 Gregor Blanco 's RBI single snapped a scoreless tie in the fifth . He drove in Andres Torres
column27: who led off with a double . 	 The Giants went ahead 2 - 0 in the sixth on Pablo Sandoval 's RBI single . Scutaro scored after he led off with a single and advanced on a wild pitch . Samardzija struck out Torres looking to end the inning . 	 Scutaro 's RBI single off Michael Bowden in the seventh made it 3 - 0 . Bumgarner scored from second as right fielder Scott Hairston threw to the middle of the infield . 	 The Cubs stranded seven on base
column28: leaving the bases full in the second and two on in the sixth and eighth . Soriano had three hits for the Cubs . 	 " We 're not quite clicking offensively
column29: but the pitching is doing a good job
column30: " Bochy said . " When they stumble
column31: the offense seems to pick it up when we need them . " 	 Sandoval fell into the stands making a diving catch in the ninth . He had a bruised shin and said he should be ready to play Sunday . 	 Game notes 	  The Cubs called up reliever Rafael Dolis from Triple - A Iowa . Shawn Camp and James Russell are possible closers . column1: WASHINGTON --   Tim Hudson and Stephen Strasburg were so sharp
column2: it became evident very early there would be little margin for error . 	 The Washington Nationals made the game 's most costly miscue
column3: and that helped the Atlanta Braves emerge with a 3 - 1 victory Saturday in a showdown between the top two teams in the NL East . 	 Hudson pitched seven innings of four - hit ball
column4: Evan Gattis hit a third - inning homer after an errant two - out throw
column5: and the Braves escaped with their eighth straight win . 	 Strasburg ( 1 - 2 ) did n't give up an earned run in his six innings of work
column6: but Atlanta got all the offense it needed when Washington third baseman Ryan Zimmerman threw wildly to first base after fielding Justin Upton 's grounder and Gattis followed with his fourth home run in eight big league games . 	 " In close games like today
column8: it 's the little things you have to do that win the game
column9: " Hudson said . " They made one mistake that cost them the game
column10: and we were pretty solid all day . " 	 Zimmerman 's error was Washington 's 10th in 11 games . 	 " It was just a bad throw
column12: today they took advantage of it . Stephen threw the ball so well today
column13: and when you do that and that happens in a game like that
column14: you feel bad . But that 's part of the game . " 	 Hudson ( 2 - 0 ) allowed one run
column15: walked none and struck out three in improving his lifetime record against Washington to 15 - 5 . Not only did the right - hander outpitch Strasburg
column16: but he also got two singles off Washington 's hard - throwing ace . 	 " I bet you he had more fun getting those two hits than pitching seven innings
column17: " Braves manager Fredi Gonzalez said . 	 Hudson said : " I 'm not supposed to hit
column18: so it was a little exciting getting those two knocks there
column19: especially against a guy throwing that hard . " 	 Hudson permitted only one runner past second base -- Danny Espinosa
column20: who hit a solo homer in the fifth . 	 Strasburg struck out seven
column21: walked one and hit a batter . He insisted he did not lose his focus after Zimmerman 's error gave the Braves a chance to extend the third inning . 	 " The guy 's up there hacking
column22: " Strasburg said of Gattis . " I throw one up at his neck and he tomahawks it out . " 	 After Eric O'Flaherty worked a perfect eighth for the Braves
column23: Jason Heyward hit a run - scoring grounder in the ninth for a 3 - 1 cushion . Craig Kimbrel then got three straight outs for his sixth save in six tries . 	 The victory kept the first - place Braves unbeaten on the road ( 5 - 0 ) and increased their lead over Washington to three games . Atlanta ( 9 - 1 ) is off to its best start since 1994 ( 13 - 1 ) . 	 " It was a big day for us
column24: " Hudson said . " We knew coming in it was n't going to easy . " 	 The Nationals are stuck in their first skid of the season . Washington lost to Atlanta on Friday night after blowing a four - run lead . 	 To worsen matters
column25: catcher Wilson Ramos pulled his left hamstring running out a grounder and could be lost for a while . 	 " It 's a pretty deep pull
column26: " manager Davey Johnson said . " We 'll see how he comes out of it tomorrow
column27: but we 'll probably have to get somebody in here . " 	 In the first inning
column28: leadoff Denard Span singled and advanced when Hudson threw wildly to first on a pickoff attempt . But Span was doubled off second after breaking on a sinking liner by Jayson Werth
column29: which was ultimately caught by center fielder B.J. Upton . 	 " That changed the momentum of the game right there
column30: " Hudson said . 	 Atlanta missed a chance to break on top in the second inning when left fielder Bryce Harper threw out Dan Uggla
column31: who was trying to score from second on a two - out single by Hudson . 	 After the Braves went up 2 - 0
column32: Espinosa halved Atlanta 's lead with his first homer of the season . Prior to that
column33: Hudson had retired 10 of 11 batters . 	 After that
column34: Hudson got seven straight outs to finish his sparkling performance . 	 Game notes 	  Johnson said reliever Henry Rodriguez is still receiving treatment on his right elbow . Rodriguez
column35: who pitched a scoreless eighth inning Saturday

column38: the fifth sellout of a regular - season game in Nationals history . ... The Braves will seek to complete a three - game sweep Sunday . Paul Maholm ( 2 - 0

column1: CLEVELAND --   Mark Reynolds came to Cleveland with the reputation of being a hitter who packed plenty of power . 	 Through the first 10 games
column2: he 's proving that to be true . 	 Reynolds ' fifth - inning grand slam keyed Cleveland 's 9 - 4 win over the Chicago White Sox on Saturday . 	 " He 's so strong and when he 's swinging the bat like that
column4: " Indians manager Terry Francona said of Reynolds
column5: who leads the team with five homers and 13 RBIs . 	 Reynolds also came to town with the reputation of often swinging and missing -- he has struck out more than 200 times in a season three times in his career
column6: after all . He has fanned eight times in 35 at - bats this season but made enough contact off White Sox ace Chris Sale to turn Cleveland 's 3 - 2 lead into a comfortable margin . 	 " I was looking to put the ball in the air
column8: who tied a career high with five RBIs . " It was n't an easy day to get it out of the park
column9: but it 's never an easy day here
column10: so far . " 	 Zach McAllister ( 1 - 1 ) pitched into the seventh . The right - hander allowed two unearned runs in the first thanks to Reynolds ' throwing error . McAllister gave up three runs in 6 1/3 innings and retired 16 of 17 at one point . He allowed five hits and struck out six . 	 Reynolds had an RBI single to give Cleveland a 3 - 2 lead in the third . Nick Swisher and Yan Gomes each hit two - run homers for the Indians . 	 The loss was Chicago 's fifth straight
column11: all on the road . The White Sox are 0 - 5 away from home for the first time since 1972 . 	 Sale ( 1 - 1 ) gave up Swisher 's home run in the first and allowed a career - high eight runs in 4 1/3 innings . The left - hander lost to the Indians for the first time in 15 career appearances
column12: including four starts . 	 " It was a terrible
column14: " Sale said . " My team needed a better effort and deserved a better effort . I did n't give it to them . " 	 Following Reynolds ' home run
column15: Sale 's next hit pitch hit Michael Brantley in the back -- one of three hit batters Saturday -- prompting plate umpire Ed Hickox to immediately warn both teams . Sale then threw a pitch in the dirt that nearly hit Mike Aviles in the foot . He was removed after Aviles flied out before Gomes homered to center off Duente Heath for his first hit of the season . 	 Sale said he did n't hit Brantley intentionally . 	 " That was me being an idiot
column16: honestly
column17: " he said . " Going out there and trying to overthrow and blow it by him . It got away and hit him . If you 're going to hit a guy you do n't do it there . I know enough about the game if I was going to do it intentionally it 's not going to be at that time . Not only does that look bad on my part
column18: it looks bad on my team and that 's not what we 're about and that 's not what I 'm about . " 	 McAllister hit Alexei Ramirez on the left arm with one out in the seventh
column19: but was not ejected . The right - hander was then removed by Francona . 	 " I just stayed aggressive
column20: " McAllister said . " Any time you 're able to get ahead of hitters and throw strikes
column21: you 're going to be successful . " 	 Reynolds ' errant throw to McAllister on Alex Rios ' groundball in the first scored Chicago 's first run . Paul Konerko 's single made it 2 - 0 . 	 Swisher hit his first home run with the Indians to tie the game . He doubled with two outs in the third and scored on Reynolds ' single . Swisher was 0 for 5 with three strikeouts against Sale entering the game . 	 Asdrubal Cabrera led off the fifth with a single and took third when Ryan Raburn doubled . After Swisher was hit in the foot by a pitch
column22: Reynolds hit a 1 - 1 pitch into the home run porch in left field
column23: giving the Indians a 7 - 2 lead . 	 Sale was 2 - 0 with a 2.10 ERA ( eight earned runs in 34 1/3 innings ) in 16 career appearances against the Indians entering the game . 	 The White Sox are the only winless team on the road in the majors . 	 Swisher has hit in 20 consecutive games at Progressive Field
column24: a streak that began in 2008 . He tied Michael Young
column25: who now plays with Philadelphia
column26: for the longest hitting streak in ballpark history . Progressive Field opened in 1994 . 	 Alejandro De Aza hit a two - run homer in the seventh off Bryan Shaw . 	 The Indians played without second baseman Jason Kipnis ( sore left elbow ) and catcher Carlos Santana ( bruised left thumb ) . Francona expects Kipins to play Sunday . Santana was in the original lineup
column27: but the thumb bothered him during batting practice . 	 Konerko leads active players with 46 homers and 172 RBIs against the Indians . 	 Game notes 	  White Sox pitching coach Don Cooper was released from a northern Virginia hospital Saturday where he had been treated for diverticulitis . He became ill Tuesday while the team was in Washington for a series against the Nationals . Cooper will return to Chicago for more tests . ... C Tyler Flowers
column28: who is hitless in his last 21 at - bats
column29: started Saturday after not playing Friday . ... Francona said DH Jason Giambi would probably play Sunday against RHP Jake Peavy . Giambi
column30: who began the season on the disabled list with a strained back
column31: was activated Friday . ... RHP Brett Myers will start for the Indians . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more
column32: this is your one - stop shop as baseball 's 2021 hardware is handed out . 	 Randy Arozarena hit 20 home runs and stole 20 bases this season
column33: leading all rookies with a 4.1 WAR . 	 Take a look back at the best plays from NL Rookie of the Year Jonathan India 's 2021 campaign . 	 Julio Lugo
column34: who played for seven teams in a 12 - year major league career
column35: has died . He was 45 . 	 Jonathan India finished ahead of Cardinals OF Dylan Carlson and Marlins starter Trevor Rogers .

column1: NEW YORK --   Gold Glove shortstop J.J. Hardy bounced a routine throw for his first error this season . All - Star Adam Jones flung his bat and helmet after chasing strike three . Nate McLouth ran through a stop sign and was an easy out at the plate . 	 A messy game for the Baltimore Orioles and yet
column3: Ryan Flaherty and Nick Markakis hit solo home runs
column4: sending the Orioles over the Yankees 5 - 3 Saturday and stopping New York 's four - game winning string . 	 " They do n't dwell on past things
column6: " Baltimore manager Buck Showalter said . " That 's one of the characteristics of our club . " 	 McLouth doubled twice
column7: singled and made a nifty catch in left field to back Jason Hammel ( 2 - 1 ) . 	 Reimold provided a rare boost from the DH slot . Baltimore designated hitters had managed a mere single and zero RBIs in 33 at - bats going into the game until Reimold homered in the fourth . It was a loud shot from the ninth - place hitter
column8: with the crack of the bat reverberating around Yankee Stadium . 	 Batting eighth
column9: Flaherty launched a longball that was equally unexpected . He was 1 for 18 with a single this year before his home run in the second . Markakis led off the third by connecting against the homer - prone Hughes . 	 " We have a great lineup
column10: one through nine . Anyone can hit the ball out of the ballpark
column11: " Markakis said . " I 'd stack our lineup up against anybody 's . " 	 The Yankees ' lineup had a new look
column12: too . Robinson Cano shifted to shortstop for the ninth inning
column13: the first time the Gold Glove second baseman has played any other position in the majors . 	 With Derek Jeter injured
column14: Eduardo Nunez sitting out a day after being hit by a pitch and starting shortstop Jayson Nix leaving for a pinch - hitter in the eighth
column15: Cano moved over . He did n't get any plays in the field . 	 " I was ready
column16: " Cano said . " I take groundballs over there with Jeter and with Nunez
column17: joking around and serious . " 	 Hammel allowed two earned runs and eight hits in six innings . Orioles relievers Brian Matusz
column18: Darren O'Day and Jim Johnson each pitched a scoreless inning . Johnson closed for his fifth save
column19: shutting down a team that tagged him in last year 's AL playoffs . 	 Travis Hafner and Vernon Wells hit solo homers for the Yankees . Phil Hughes ( 0 - 2 ) was booed off the mound after giving up three long drives in three - plus innings . 	 Two innings after he appeared to coast around the bases and was caught at home
column20: McLouth atoned . 	 Down 5 - 2 in the fourth
column21: the Yankees put two runners on with one out . Lyle Overbay hit a long liner to the opposite field
column23: stuck up his glove and made the catch on a tough ball . 	 Hardy also made a nice recovery . 	 In the second
column24: he fielded Francisco Cervelli 's two - out grounder but bounced his throw for a two - base error . Overbay blooped an RBI single over Hardy 's head -- as the next batter stepped in
column25: Hardy took off his glove
column26: slapped his hand against the mitt and scuffed at the dirt . 	 Hardy had an RBI grounder the next inning for a two - run lead . 	 Hughes never looked comfortable
column27: and taking Matt Wieters ' hard one - hopper off his body on a chilly afternoon did n't help
column28: either . Slowed in spring training by a bulging disk in his back
column29: Hughes lost his season debut last weekend after coming off the disabled list to start at Detroit . 	 Reliever David Phelps kept the Yankees close
column30: giving up one hit in four shutout innings and striking out six . 	 Game notes 	  Nunez left Friday night 's game after being hit by a pitch in the right wrist . The Yankees said he was OK . ... Orioles RHP Steve Johnson ( lat strain ) pitched three innings and LHP Tsuyoshi Wada ( elbow surgery ) threw two innings at extended spring training . " It was a big day to get through
column31: " Showalter said . ... Baltimore LHP Wei - Yin Chen starts Sunday night against Yankees RHP Hiroki Kuroda . ... Yankees RHP Chien - Ming Wang threw the equivalent of 5 2/3 scoreless innings against the Pirates in his second extended spring training game . He said he felt close to being ready to pitch in a regular minor league game . ... The Yankees and Indians will play a traditional doubleheader on May 13 in Cleveland to make up for a pair of recent rainouts . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column2: Mo. -- R.A. Dickey hopes the injury to Jose Reyes sparks the Toronto Blue Jays . 	 After finding out the star shortstop likely will be sidelined until the All - Star break
column3: Dickey allowed one run and five hits in 6 1/3 innings Saturday night in the Blue Jays ' 3 - 2 win over the Kansas City Royals . 	 Reyes is likely out for three months with a severe left ankle sprain
column4: an injury sustained stealing a base on Friday night . 	 " It certainly hurts to lose a player of Jose 's caliber and personality
column5: " Dickey said . " I think it also provides us with an opportunity to come together and collectively shoulder the burden that we will miss with his absence . Sometimes a situation like that can really cause a team to jell . " 	 Jose Bautista hit a two - run homer off James Shields ( 1 - 2 )
column6: who pitched a two - hitter with six strikeouts and three walks and was the hard - luck loser . 	 Reyes was hitting .395 and led the majors with five stolen bases before the injury . 	 " We 're going to go as far as the rotation is going to bring us
column7: " Blue Jays general manager Alex Anthopoulos said . " That 's really what it comes down . It starts there . No question
column8: Reyes is a big loss offensively
column9: but I do think we have enough depth from our offensive standpoint to be fine . We just need to get the rotation going . " 	 Coming in
column10: Toronto 's revamped rotation had a 7.55 ERA and J.A. Happ ( 2 - 4 ) was the only Blue Jays started to win . 	 " Nobody has been happy with the way things have gone
column12: " Dickey said . " We all talk about it . It 's obvious we have n't performed
column14: but our ability . And we all feel very responsible to that . That being said
column15: nobody in here is panicking and nobody in here is trying any less hard than normal . If we just keep eating up innings
column16: keep looking to get better
column17: improving
column18: growing
column19: we 're going to be fine . " 	 Acquired from the New York Mets after going 20 - 6 last season and winning the NL Cy Young Award
column20: Dickey was 0 - 2 with an 8.44 ERA in his first two starts for Toronto . Against the Royals
column21: the knuckleballer struck out four
column22: walked two and hit a batter
column23: throwing 64 of 100 pitches for strikes . 	 " We never could muster a consistent attack against Dickey
column24: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . " His knuckler was really dancing . We never could get any consistent momentum . " 	 Jarrod Dyson chased Dickey with a two - out double in the seventh . After Darren Oliver relieved
column25: Dyson stole third and scored on Chris Getz 's bunt single . 	 Casey Janssen pitched the ninth for his third save in as many chances
column26: allowing a two - out single to Getz
column27: who took second on defensive indifference and scored on Alex Gordon 's single . Alex Escobar followed with a game - ending flyout . 	 " It got a little hairy at the end
column28: but Janssen got it done
column29: " Blue Jays manager John Gibbons said . " You do n't win too many games when you get two hits
column30: but homers win . " 	 Toronto went ahead when Maicer Izturis doubled leading off the third
column31: advanced on Henry Blanco 's groundout and scored a sacrifice fly by Munenori Kawasaki
column32: called up from the minors after Reyes severely sprained his left ankle on an awkward slide . 	 Kawasaki walked leading off the sixth and scored on Bautista 's third home run of the season
column34: who batted ninth and played shortstop
column35: hit .295 in six seasons with Fukuoka in Japan 's Pacific League
column36: but just .192 with a .202 slugging percentage with one extra - base hit in 104 at - bats last season with Seattle . 	 Toronto mustered just enough to defeat Shields . 	 " He pitched a great ballgame
column37: " Yost said . " He threw 115 pitches and if he had to take any one back it would be the curveball to Bautista .   Bautista 's a strong guy and he got it out .   The one pitch made the difference . " 	 Royals 1B Eric Hosmer has tightness in his right quadriceps and did not start for the second straight night . ... Emilo Bonifacio
column38: who started eight games at second base and batted ninth in eight games
column39: played right field for the first time since Sept. 15
column41: and batted leadoff . Bautista started at third base for the first time since Aug. 4

column1: MIAMI --   In a season that 's had far more downs than ups
column2: Chris Coghlan helped deliver a boost for the Miami Marlins . 	 Coghlan hit a game - ending single against a draw - in infield with one out in the ninth inning Saturday night
column3: giving the Marlins a 2 - 1 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies for just their second win . 	 " It 's huge for the morale
column4: " Coghlan said . " We 've lost a lot of tight games and our record obviously shows that . " 	 Marlins 20 - year old phenom Jose Fernandez pitched six scoreless innings to outduel Cole Hamels . Miami ( 2 - 9 )
column5: playing without slugger Giancarlo Stanton for the second straight day because of a bruised left shoulder
column6: became the last team in the major leagues to win two games this year . 	 " It was n't perfect
column7: but it 's nice to get a win
column8: " Marlins manager Mike Redmond said . " ( Coghlan ) was a late addition to the lineup and we talk about opportunities . " 	 Fernandez gave Miami the lead in the fifth with an RBI single . 	 Placido Polanco led off the ninth with a walk against reliever Phillippe Aumont ( 1 - 1 ) . Greg Dobbs followed with a hard - hit grounder to first baseman Kevin Frandsen
column9: who could not make the play . The ball rolled into right field for a hit
column10: and Polanco advanced to third . 	 After Austin Kearns struck out
column11: Coghlan hit a hard grounder to second baseman Chase Utley
column12: playing on the infield grass . Utley bobbled the grounder and his throw was late to the plate as Polanco slid headfirst for the winning run . 	 " I tried to pick it clean on the in - between hop and I was n't able to pick it clean
column13: " Utley said . 	 Steve Cishek ( 1 - 1 ) pitched the ninth . 	 Fernandez allowed only two hits and two walks while striking out five . 	 " Every time I go out there I try to enjoy it and have fun
column14: " Fernandez said . " It 's fun to pitch here in Miami in front of the crowd . It was a really good feeling and I 'm going to continue to enjoy it . " 	 Hamels yielded one run and three hits in six innings . He struck out five and walked three . 	 " Still really trying to get ahead of hitters early
column15: " Hamels said . " I was able to make an improvement there
column16: but I still was n't where I know I 'm able to just get that first - pitch strike . " 	 Hamels
column17: who entered with a 10.97 ERA in his first two starts
column18: held the Marlins without a hit until the fifth inning when Adeiny Hechavarria tripled to right - center field with two outs . Hechavarria 's two - out triple was the Marlins ' first three - base hit this season and 16th extra - base hit . Miami is batting .206 and has a paltry .266 slugging percentage . 	 Fernandez then got his first big league hit to knock in the first run . 	 " I just threw probably the worst pitch I could throw
column19: " said Hamels on the hit by Fernandez . 	 Fernandez was pulled after six innings in favor of A.J. Ramos
column20: who promptly allowed a base hit to Domonic Brown
column21: the Phillies ' first hit since Freddy Galvis ' two - out single in the second . 	 Second baseman Donovan Solano tried turning the double play
column22: but his throw ended up in the stands for an error that allowed Brown to score and make it 1 - all . 	 The Phillies had an opportunity to score in the second . Laynce Nix and Galvis both singled with two outs
column23: but Fernandez calmly retired Erik Kratz to get out of the inning . 	 " We did n't hit the kid
column24: " Phillies manager Charlie Manuel said . " Actually he took them to a good place in the game really . We did n't hit him . That was the bottom line . He held us and pitched good . " 	 Game notes 	  Fernandez has a 0.82 ERA in his first two starts and has struck out 13 in 11 innings . ... Phillies RF Laynce Nix made a diving catch in the first inning to take a hit away from Polanco . ... Marlins OF Justin Ruggiano ( groin ) was a late scratch to the lineup and was replaced by Coghlan . Ruggiano is considered day to day . ... Philadelphia will send RHP Roy Halladay ( 0 - 2
column25: 14.73 ERA ) to the mound Sunday for the series finale and the Marlins will counter with RHP Kevin Slowey ( 0 - 2

column1: PHOENIX --   With his parents and a contingent of South Korean students from nearby Arizona State cheering him on
column2: Hyun - Jin Ryu had the biggest night yet in his young major league career . 	 Not just on the mound . At the plate
column3: too . 	 The left - hander struck out nine in six innings and got his first three big league hits as the Los Angeles Dodgers held off the Arizona Diamondbacks 7 - 5 Saturday . 	 " I ca n't remember
column4: " Ryu said through an interpreter when asked the last time he had three hits in a game . " Even in high school
column5: I do n't think I got three this in one game . " 	 Adrian Gonzalez went 3 for 4 with a home run and two RBIs as the Dodgers stopped a six - game losing streak in Arizona dating to last season . Matt Kemp singled in two runs
column6: Skip Schumaker had an RBI double and Andre Ethier singled in a run for Los Angeles . 	 The Dodgers led 6 - 1 after six innings
column7: but Arizona tried to rally behind pinch - hit RBIs from Eric Hinske
column9: and a home run by Martin Prado . 	 Ryu ( 2 - 1 ) allowed three runs and six hits with just one walk . 	 " He has good stuff . He has four pitches and he throws them at any time
column10: " Arizona 's Paul Goldschmidt said . " He located his fastball on both sides of the plate . He used his changeup . He has a little curveball and a hard slider . He was mixing it up and keeping guys off balance . " 	 It was Ryu 's 100th professional victory . He said his parents have been there " for 99 of them . " 	 His parents jumped up and down when he doubled in his first at - bat . He also had two singles
column11: becoming the first Dodgers pitcher with three hits in a game since Randy Wolf went 3 for 4 against Arizona at Chase Field on Aug. 16
column12: 2009 . 	 Ryu expects to succeed on the mound
column13: which Dodgers manager Don Mattingly noted from the day the pitcher arrived . 	 " I 'm sure he has still lots of things to deal with as far as the culture and the language and a lot of things
column14: " Mattingly said . " But the pitching part
column16: and that confidence has been there since day one . " 	 The hitting was another matter . 	 " I was most surprised by my hitting today
column17: " Ryu said . " Surprise is the key word . " 	 Brandon League pitched a perfect ninth for his fourth save in as many tries . 	 Arizona 's Ian Kennedy ( 1 - 1 ) gave up six runs and 10 hits in 5 2/3 innings
column18: striking out four and walking four
column19: one intentionally . 	 The Diamondbacks ' Cliff Pennington was ejected for the first time in his big league career after slamming his bat to the plate following a called third strike by umpire Jim Reynolds with runners on first and second in the seventh . The bat broke
column20: and Pennington went back and picked up the shattered piece before he left the field . 	 Arizona went on to score two runs in the inning and close to 6 - 3 . Prado 's homer off Kenley Jansen leading off the eighth made it 6 - 4 . Miguel Montero singled with one out and Hill
column21: out of the lineup since being hit in the left hand by a pitch on Tuesday
column22: doubled to deep left with two outs to make it a one - run game . 	 Ramon Hernandez 's RBI double down the right - field line in the ninth boosted the lead . 	 Gonzalez led off the fourth with his second home run of the season
column23: then the Dodgers added two in the fifth . Ryu singled
column24: then Crawford reached on a fielder 's choice and flew around the bases to score from first on Schumaker 's double . Gonzalez was walked intentionally
column25: then Ethier singled sharply to bring home Schumaker with a 3 - 0 lead . 	 Arizona scratched one across in the fifth when Pennington led off with a single
column26: took second on a wild pitch
column27: advanced to third on Kennedy 's sacrifice and scored when A.J. Pollock grounded out . 	 Los Angeles chased Kennedy in a three - run sixth
column28: with all the damage coming with two outs . Ryu singled and Carl Crawford doubled to put runners at second and third . Schumaker walked to load the bases
column29: then Kemp -- batting .189 entering the game -- singled in two runs . Left - hander Matt Reynolds replaced Kennedy and gave up an RBI single to Gonzalez putting the Dodgers up 6 - 1 . 	 Ryu left after giving up singles to Alfredo Marte and Josh Wilson to start the seventh . Reliever Ronald Belisario got Pennington out on strikes
column30: but pinch hitters Hinske and Chavez each singled in a run to cut it to 6 - 3 . 	 Game notes 	 The Dodgers announced LHP Chris Capuano will start Tuesday against San Diego
column31: taking the spot that would have gone to Zack Greinke before he broke his collarbone in the bench - clearing brawl with the Padres on Thursday night . ... Arizona placed OF Jason Kubel on the 15 - day DL with a strained left quadriceps and activated OF Cody Ross
column32: who opened the season on the DL with a left calf strain . ... In the series finale Sunday
column34: 4.91 ERA ) goes for Los Angeles and RHP Trevor Cahill ( 0 - 2
column35: 5.91 ) for the Diamondbacks . ... League is 10 for 10 in saves with the Dodgers . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more
column36: this is your one - stop shop as baseball 's 2021 hardware is handed out . 	 Randy Arozarena hit 20 home runs and stole 20 bases this season
column37: leading all rookies with a 4.1 WAR . 	 Take a look back at the best plays from NL Rookie of the Year Jonathan India 's 2021 campaign . 	 Julio Lugo
column38: who played for seven teams in a 12 - year major league career
column39: has died . He was 45 . 	 Jonathan India finished ahead of Cardinals OF Dylan Carlson and Marlins starter Trevor Rogers .

column1: SAN DIEGO --   Wilin Rosario followed a terrible night at the plate with one of the best of his career . 	 Rosario had a career - high four hits and drove in three runs
column2: leading the Colorado Rockies over the Padres 9 - 5 Saturday night . 	 Rosario broke a 1 - 1 tie in the second with his fourth home run of the season
column3: a two - run drive off Edinson Volquez ( 0 - 3 ) . Rosario made it 5 - 1 with an RBI single in the third
column4: singled off Thad Weber leading off the fifth and singled off Joe Thatcher in the ninth . 	 A night earlier
column5: Rosario was 0 for 4 with three strikeouts . 	 " Some days you come to the plate and maybe your mind is not on the field
column6: " Rosario said . " I do n't want to say that 's why I was 0 for 4 yesterday and today 4 for 5 . Sometimes you 're good ; sometimes you 're not . Today I was seeing the ball really well . " 	 Jhoulys Chacin ( 2 - 0 ) allowed two runs and four hits in five innings
column7: his ERA rising from 1.35 to 1.96 . He threw 83 pitches to beat the Padres for the second time this season and improve Colorado to 5 - 0 against San Diego . 	 " It 's really nice to be able to win a game when you 're not pitching that well
column8: " Chacin said . " I was n't getting much movement on my fast ball and I got behind too many hitters . But with our offense you might be able to give up even four runs and still win . " 	 Chacin extended the Rockies ' streak of consecutive games without a 100 - pitch start to 113 . 	 " Chacin put us in position to win again
column9: " Rockies manager Walt Weiss said . " He labored a bit and was working hard to get through that one . " 	 Volquez gave up seven runs -- six earned -- six hits and three walks in 3 1/3 innings
column10: leaving him with an 11.68 ERA . San Diego 's fourth straight loss dropped the Padres to 2 - 9 . 	 " Over the course of 33 starts
column11: you 're going to have some rough ones
column12: " Padres manager Bud Black said . " Volky has had them right out of the get go . Let 's hope that he can get it straightened out . It 's the ball - strike ratio
column13: pitching ahead in the count . " 	 San Diego 's Carlos Quentin
column14: on the active roster while the players ' union appeals his eight - game suspension stemming from Thursday 's brawl with Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Zack Greinke
column15: popped out to the catcher as a pinch - hitter in the eighth with runners on second and third and one out . 	 Michael Cuddyer hit a two - run homer in the fourth off Weber
column16: giving the Rockies a major league - leading 15 on the road this season . Carlos Gonzalez had three hits and a walk
column17: and Troy Tulowitzki had two hits and two RBIs . 	 Todd Helton hit an RBI double in the third
column18: tying Ivan Rodriguez for 20th on the career list with 572 doubles . 	 San Diego 's Everth Cabrera tied his career high with four hits
column19: including a triple and home run in the seventh off Edgmer Escalona . Will Venable homered off Escalona later in the inning . 	 With the chance to become the first Padres player to hit for the cycle
column20: Cabrera singled in the ninth . 	 The Padres have been one hit away from the cycle 344 times in their 45 - year history . 	 Game notes 	 Reid Brignac was in the starting lineup at third base for the Rockies as Chris Nelson was given the night off by manager Walt Weiss . Weiss said Yorvit Torrealba will be the starting catcher Sunday when Jorge De La Rosa starts . Clayton Richard pitches for the Padres . LF Mark Kotsay left the game in the fourth inning with a mild hamstring strain . ... Padres 3B Chase Headley had a double in three at - bats on Friday at Class - A Lake Elsinore on an injury rehabilitation assignment after breaking his left thumb . " It felt great
column21: " Headley said . I was real happy with the way I swung the bat
column22: I got jammed and it did n't hurt . " He is to return to Lake Elsinore on Sunday and play in the field . Headley was in San Diego to receive his Gold Glove and Silver Slugger awards from last season . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column2: Calif. --   Josh Hamilton homering and Albert Pujols hitting a game - ending double . Just what the Los Angeles Angels needed to end a five - game losing streak . 	 Hamilton hit his first home run for the Angels and Pujols hit a two - run double off Jose Veras with two outs in the ninth inning
column3: helping Los Angeles beat the Houston Astros 5 - 4 on Saturday night . 	 " It 's good to get the first one out of the way
column4: and also get a walkoff win . The combination of both was very exciting
column5: " Hamilton said . " When I looked up and saw the crowd give me an ovation
column7: ` Whew . ' I 've been satisfied with my at - bats lately . I 've been going a little deeper in counts and hitting the ball right at people and not finding holes . So I did n't change anything today . " 	 A loss would have dropped the Angels to the first 2 - 9 start in the franchise 's 53 - year history and the team 's first 0 - 5 opening at home . 	 " You can do everything right and fail
column8: and you can do everything wrong and succeed . That 's baseball
column9: " Hamilton said . 	 Hamilton had gone 10 games and 37 at - bats without a home run . The seven - year veteran 's longest homer drought from the start of a season is 13 games and 46 at - bats in 2010 -- the same year he was voted AL MVP after winning the AL batting title with a .359 average
column10: hitting 32 homers and driving in 100 runs . 	 " In 2010 I started pretty slow and the power was n't there at the beginning
column11: " Hamilton said . " But it 's amazing how the game can change . One game can turn into a good week and then a good month . But more than anything
column12: we want to start racking up some Ws . " 	 Veras ( 0 - 1 ) came on in the ninth to protect a 4 - 3 lead for Lucas Harrell and walked No . 9 hitter Luis Jimenez with one out . J.B. Shuck flied out
column13: Mike Trout reached on a two - out infield single to the left side and Pujols followed with a drive inside third base and down the left - field line . 	 " Albert Pujols is Albert Pujols . He 's one of the best players for a reason
column14: " Astros manager Bo Porter said . " It 's a tough loss
column15: and it 's unfortunate because the guys played their hearts out . " 	 Michael Roth ( 1 - 0 ) pitched two perfect innings with four strikeouts to win in his major league debut . The 23 - year - old left - hander was promoted earlier in the day from Double - A Arkansas . 	 The Astros
column16: who had won their previous three games
column17: led 4 - 1 in the eighth . Right fielder J.D. Martinez dropped Howie Kendrick 's fly for a two - base error that allowed Pujols to score
column18: and Chris Iannetta followed with a sacrifice fly to center . Kendrick was doubled off second after shortstop Marwin Gonzalez cut off the throw from Justin Maxwell and fired to second baseman Jose Altuve for the third out . 	 Angels starter Garrett Richards allowed four runs
column19: three hits and three walks over 6 1/3 innings in place of ace Jered Weaver
column20: who broke his non - pitching arm getting out of the way of a line drive by Mitch Moreland on April 7 at Texas . The 24 - year - old right - hander started for the first time since last Aug. 1
column21: joining a rotation that entered with a 6.02 ERA . 	 Facing the Astros for the first time
column22: Richards became the first Angels starter this season to get past the sixth inning . 	 " I thought I threw the ball well tonight
column23: " Richards said . " I did n't have 100 - percent command of my breaking ball early on
column24: but I started to develop a feel for it later in the game and just kept moving the fastball in and out . My arm feels good
column25: my body feels good
column26: and I 'm just going to step in and try to give us a chance to win every time . " 	 Harrell allowed a run and six hits in 5 2/3 innings and struck out five in his first career appearance against the Angels . 	 Chris Carter put the Astros ahead with a two - run homer in the fourth
column27: but Hamilton 's sixth - inning drive cut the lead in half . 	 " He threw me the exact same pitch before that
column28: and I tried to get too big and got too long and swung through it
column29: " Hamilton said . " I thought maybe he 'd give me something away to chase up and away
column30: or he might come back with the same pitch again . And he came back with the same pitch . " 	 Sean Burnett relieved Richards with the bases loaded in the seventh and gave up an RBI single by Matt Dominguez and Gonzalez 's run - scoring squeeze bunt . 	 Game notes 	  Trout was presented with his 2012 AL Rookie of the Year award at home plate before the game by manager Mike Scioscia and general manager Jerry Dipoto . The only other player in club history to win it was RF Tim Salmon in 1993 . ... The Angels signed 12 - year veteran RHP Kip Wells to a minor league contract . Wells
column31: who turns 36 on April 21
column32: led the NL in losses with 18 in 2005 ( Pittsburgh ) and 17 in 2007 ( St. Louis ) . He has thrown only 37 1/3 innings in the big leagues since 2009
column33: when he pitched for Washington and Cincinnati . ... Angels SS Erick Aybar and RHP Kevin Jepsen were placed on the 15 - day DL . The move with Aybar was retroactive to April 10 . ... Shuck was recalled on Saturday from Triple - A Sale Lake
column34: becoming the Angels ' fourth different leadoff batter in four games and third since Trout was moved to the No . 2 hole . column1: SEATTLE --   In his first full major league game
column2: Leury Garcia did n't look like a rookie even in the midst of a wacky play . 	 Garcia picked up his first major league hit leading off the sixth inning of the Texas Rangers ' 3 - 1 win over the Seattle Mariners on Saturday night . 	 Four batters later
column3: he was on third after the Rangers loaded the bases
column4: and Nelson Cruz hit a broken - bat line drive with one out at Justin Smoak . 	 The ball hit the heel of the first baseman 's glove
column5: bounced out and Garcia broke for home . Smoak grabbed the ball and threw to second for the forceout . While Ian Kinsler got caught between second and third and was tagged out by third baseman Kyle Seager for an inning - ending double play
column6: Garcia managed to cross the plate with the tying run . 	 " For the first time out there
column7: he did n't show any nerves
column8: " Texas manager Ron Washington said . " He had a good game . " 	 That tied the score 1 - all
column9: and Texas took the lead in the eighth when Elvis Andrus and Adrian Beltre hit RBI singles with two outs . 	 " I saw the line drive
column10: so it was like a freeze
column12: limited to one pinch - hit at - bat coming in . " And then I saw him drop it and -- gone . " 	 Mariners shortstop Brendan Ryan already had booted a potential double - play ball earlier in the sixth . Smoak said   Beltre
column13: who was intentionally walked to load the bases
column14: momentarily blocked his view . 	 " I should have caught the ball
column16: but Beltre coming back to the bag kind of blinded me
column17: " Smoak said . " It happened so quick
column18: I just threw it to second . " 	 It was the only run the Rangers got off of Mariners starter Joe Saunders
column19: who did n't get a decision . He allowed one run -- unearned -- and three hits in seven innings and is 7 - 0 with a 1.71 ERA in 11 starts at Safeco Fiel . 	 Carter Capps ( 0 - 1 ) walked Craig Gentry leading off the eighth and then got two outs before Andrus broke the tie with a hit to right field . Andrus stole second and kept going to third when Capps ' pitch went to the backstop for a wild pitch
column20: and he scored on Beltre 's single . 	 " It 's been like that . We have n't been swinging the bat the way we 've wanted lately
column21: " Beltre said . " The key to us has been the pitching staff keeping us in the game . ... We hang around for a couple innings
column22: then we score one or two and that 's it
column23: that 's all we need . " 	 Joe Ortiz ( 2 - 0 ) pitched two innings for his second win in three days

column26: Endy Chavez popped up to left
column27: but it was too shallow for Shoppach to attempt to score . 	 Bay followed with a liner to center that hit Gentry 's glove as he dove . The ball bounced off

column1: CLEVELAND --   The Chicago White Sox finally found the formula to win on the road . 	 Jake Peavy struck out 11 in seven innings
column2: Paul Konerko homered and the White Sox defeated the Cleveland Indians 3 - 1 Sunday . 	 Not only did the White Sox break their five - game losing streak
column3: they won for the first time this season away from U.S. Cellular Field . 	 Chicago began the day as the majors ' only winless team on the road . The White Sox were swept three games in Washington before dropping the first two against the Indians . Chicago avoided its first 0 - 6 start on the road since 1968 . 	 " In this five - game skid
column4: we 've had a chance to get that big hit and make that big pitch and we just have n't been able to do it
column5: " Peavy said . " It 's not like we 've been getting boat - raced every night . " 	 Peavy ( 2 - 1 ) gave up a home run to Michael Bourn on his first pitch of the game -- a line drive that landed in Chicago 's bullpen -- but held the Indians to five hits overall and did n't walk a batter . 	 " I did n't expect Bourn to swing there
column6: " Peavy said . " He got me . " 	 Indians manager Terry Francona gave full credit to Peavy
column7: who retired 12 straight batters at one point and improved to 4 - 0 in five career starts against Cleveland . 	 " Bournie kind of ambushed him the first pitch of the game
column8: but after that we did n't have many opportunities to score until late
column9: " Francona said . " He 's just a really good veteran pitcher . " 	 A day after watching left - hander Chris Sale allow a career - high eight runs in 4 1/3 innings
column10: White Sox manager Robin Ventura liked what he saw from Peavy . 	 " He was just sharp today
column11: " Ventura said . " It was one of those ( games ) where he just seemed to be hitting the glove . " 	 Bourn left in the eighth with a cut on hand that needed five stitches to close and is expected to sideline him for several games . 	 First baseman Adam Dunn fielded Bourn 's slow grounder and tossed to pitcher Matt Thornton
column12: who was covering on the play . Bourn made a headfirst into the bag for an infield hit
column13: but Thornton stepped on his hand . 	 Francona and a trainer examined Bourn
column14: who was removed because of the cut on the index finger of his right hand . 	 Addison Reed pitched the ninth for his fourth save
column15: retiring Jason Giambi with a runner on to end the game . 	 Konerko 's two - run homer ruined a solid effort from Brett Myers ( 0 - 2 )
column16: who took a shutout into the sixth . Cleveland 's right - hander allowed 14 earned runs
column17: including seven homers
column18: in 10 1/3 innings in his first two appearances
column19: but held the White Sox to four hits through five . 	 After Jeff Keppinger reached on third baseman Lonnie Chisenhall 's error to begin the sixth
column20: Alex Rios bounced into a double play . Dunn walked and Konerko hit a 3 - 1 pitch into the bleachers . 	 The home run was the second of the season for Konerko
column21: who has hit 30 or more home runs seven times in his career . 	 " I feel like I 'm climbing a little bit
column22: " he said . " I feel better . I would n't say I 'm clicking on all cylinders
column23: but just trying to grind through here . Early on
column25: tough pitching and all that stuff . And it does n't come easy . " 	 Said Peavy : " We knew it was a matter of time that somebody was going to come up with a big hit . Who better than our captain ? " 	 Konerko has 16 career home runs and 75 RBIs at Progressive Field . 	 The White Sox have made a habit of playing close games in the early going . Chicago has played 12 games
column26: with 11 being decided by three runs or less . The exception was Saturday 's 9 - 4 loss . 	 " It looked like after that first few innings it was going to shake out to be a tight ballgame
column27: as it was
column28: " Peavy said . " We were fortunate enough to come out on the right side of things . " 	 Giambi made his first appearance for the Indians
column29: starting as the designated hitter and going hitless in four at - bats . He began the season on the disabled list with a strained back and was activated Friday . 	 The Indians again played without second baseman Jason Kipnis ( sore left elbow ) and catcher Carlos Santana ( bruised left thumb ) in the starting lineup . Kipnis was also out on Saturday while Santana
column30: who walked as a pinch - hitter in the ninth
column31: had missed three straight games . 	 The Indians are off Monday and begin a three - game series Tuesday against Boston at Progressive Field . Francona will face the Red Sox
column32: the team he managed for eight seasons
column33: for the first time since being replaced following the 2011 season when Boston collapsed down the stretch . Francona led the Red Sox to World Series titles in 2004 and 2007 . 	 Game notes 	  Chicago
column34: which is on a 10 - game road trip
