column1: MIAMI --   Roy Halladay found a remedy for his early - season woes -- the Miami Marlins . 	 Halladay earned his 200th career victory Sunday
column2: bouncing back from consecutive poor outings to pitch eight innings and help the Philadelphia Phillies beat the offensively challenged Marlins 2 - 1 . 	 Halladay ( 1 - 2 ) allowed five hits
column3: walked one and lowered his ERA from 14.73 to 7.63 . He was facing a Miami team ranked last in the majors in runs and home runs and playing without Giancarlo Stanton
column4: sidelined by a bruised left shoulder . 	 " Stanton was n't in there
column5: and offensively they have n't been as good
column6: " Halladay said . " But I feel like if I can make pitches confidently and make them early in the count
column7: I can be successful . " 	 That 's what Halladay did against the Marlins ( 2 - 10 )
column8: who have scored only 20 runs all season . 	 The victory counted
column9: just the same . Halladay 's the 109th pitcher to reach the 200 - win milestone
column10: and the first to do so in a Phillies uniform since Hall of Famer Steve Carlton in 1978 . 	 The low - key Halladay received a celebratory bottle of champagne from the Phillies but said he did n't whoop it up . 	 " I want to win a World Series
column11: " he said . " That 's why I 'm here . The personal milestones are great . My son
column13: my family -- they 're all excited about it . But for me the ultimate goal is to get to the playoffs and win a World Series . When that happens
column14: I 'm going to go in the back room and yell . " 	 Laynce Nix
column16: broke a 1 - all tie with his second pinch - hit homer of the season in the ninth inning . 	 Rocky efforts in Halladay 's two previous starts raised doubts about the future of the two - time Cy Young Award winner
column17: who went only 11 - 8 and battled injuries in 2012 . 	 " More than anything
column18: I had been putting a lot of pressure on myself
column19: " he said . " In the past I tried to control too much and do too much and worry about too much . " 	 Today the plan was simpler -- execute pitches one at a time
column20: and not worry about what 's going on
column21: and it made a big difference . " 	 Halladay struck out only two
column22: but he walked just one and threw only 87 pitches . 	 " He was good . Real good . Better
column23: " manager Charlie Manuel said . 	 Manuel said the performance should n't be discounted just because it came against the short - handed Marlins . 	 " They can beat you
column24: " he said . " I 'm sure they 're going to play hard
column25: and they 'll beat some people you do n't think they might beat . " 	 The Marlins managed to win one of three games in the series even though they totaled just four runs . They 're batting .204 with 17 extra - base hits
column26: including two homers
column27: and their slugging percentage is .262 . 	 With runners in scoring position they 're batting .174 . They went 1 for 6 against Halladay in those situations . 	 " They got the big hit
column28: and we did n't
column29: " Marlins manager Mike Redmond said . 	 Stanton sat out for third consecutive game . He said he wo n't play Monday but might return later in the week . 	 Outfielder Austin Kearns was scratched from the Miami lineup and taken to a hospital with an irregular heartbeat . He was held for observation overnight . 	 Philadelphia could n't muster much offense either
column30: until Nix batted with one out in the ninth and homered into the upper deck in right field off Jon Rauch ( 0 - 2 ) . It was the seventh run batted in by a Phils pinch hitter . 	 Jonathan Papelbon pitched around a leadoff walk in the ninth for his third save in as many chances . That gave the victory to Halladay
column31: who leads all active pitchers with a winning percentage of .662 ( 200 - 102 ) . 	 Among those active
column32: only the New York Yankees ' Andy Pettitte has more victories with 247 . 	 Miami 's lone run scored in the seventh
column33: and a baserunning blunder allowed Halladay to escape further damage . Rob Brantly misjudged a routine fly
column34: and after the ball was caught he was doubled off second to end the inning . 	 " We ca n't make those kinds of mistakes
column35: " Redmond said . " Those things ca n't happen . " 	 Brantly declined to talk to reporters . 	 Game notes 	  Phils SS Jimmy Rollins was given a rest and held out of the lineup after starting the first 11 games . ... The retractable roof was closed on an 87 - degree afternoon . ... Marlins RHP Jose Fernandez is the first pitcher 20 or younger to allow less than two runs and less than four hits in each of his first two career starts since Rudy May of the Angels in 1965
column36: according to STATS LLC . ... LHP Cliff Lee ( 2 - 0
column37: 1.08 ) is scheduled to start for the Phils when they open a series Monday at Cincinnati against Bronson Arroyo ( 1 - 1

column1: BOSTON --   Clay Buchholz was a nervous 23 - year - old rookie when he threw a no - hitter in his second major league start . He was more relaxed when he nearly did it again Sunday . 	 " A lot more than the last time it happened
column2: " the 28 - year - old right - hander said after not allowing a hit until Kelly Johnson 's broken - bat single leading off the eighth inning of Boston 's 5 - 0 win over the Tampa Bay Rays on Sunday . 	 That 's not the only difference in Buchholz from that second start for the Red Sox on Sept. 1
column3: 2007 . 	 " He knows himself more as a pitcher
column4: " said Red Sox manager John Farrell
column5: who was their pitching coach from 2007 - 10 . " I think where that shows up is in those spots where he 's got men on base
column6: runners in scoring position . You do n't see that emotional spike as evident as maybe his first year or so . That 's where he 's been able to execute quality pitches in those tight spots . " 	 There were n't many of them Sunday
column7: when Buchholz had excellent command of four pitches . He   allowed two hits and four walks in eight innings and struck out a career - high 11 . 	 Johnson singled with an 0 - 1 count on Buchholz 's 101st pitch
column8: sending the ball over first baseman Mike Napoli while the top part of the bat landed near the front edge of the infield between first and second . Buchholz got Sam Fuld to ground into a double play and then allowed Desmond Jennings ' double off the left - field wall . Ben Zobrist flied out to left fielder Jackie Bradley Jr. 	 Johnson had struck out in his other two at bats . 	 " I was feeling I had to do something different
column9: " he said . " I put my back foot a tad closer to home plate and picked up a Sam Fuld model bat . He threw me two breaking balls
column10: and I was n't expecting that . Luckily I was in a good enough position on the second one . " 	 Catcher Jarrod Saltalamacchia took the end of the no - hit bid hard . 	 " It killed me because I 've seen Clay throw really well
column12: " but today was amazing . " 	 Buchholz ( 3 - 0 ) lowered his ERA to 0.41 and has allowed one earned run in 22 innings He left after 109 pitches
column13: and Andrew Miller finished with a one - hit ninth . 	 " I always tell people when they ask me about the no - hitter and everything
column14: I tell them I 've been trying to do it again since that day and it has n't happened
column15: " Buchholz said . " That shows you how far luck goes with being able to go out there and throw a game like that . " 	 Of course
column16: the Rays have been struggling against just about every pitcher . 	 Their batting average dipped from .221 to .212 on Sunday and they 've scored just 33 runs
column17: the fewest in team history after 11 games . And they have only four homers
column18: tied with Kansas City for the fewest in the AL . 	 " We 've got to hit the ball better to get everybody 's spirits up
column19: " Tampa Bay manager Joe Maddon said . " When you 're not hitting the ball well
column20: you get that bad vibe among the group . It 's hard to really keep them pushing
column21: moving or motivated . But we 'll get going . We 're just not hitting the ball . " 	 Buchholz 's performance came one day after the Mets ' Matt Harvey pitched 6 2/3 hitless innings at Minnesota before Justin Morneau homered off the right - field foul pole in New York 's 4 - 2 win . 	 Alex Cobb ( 1 - 1 ) allowed four runs -- three earned -- and seven hits in 6 2/3 innings
column22: and Tampa Bay lost for the fifth time in six games . 	 Boston took a 4 - 0 lead in the third . Mike Napoli hit a two - run double to deep right - center and Stephen Drew hit into a run - scoring
column23: bases - loaded forceout . After first baseman James Loney threw to second
column24: shortstop Yunel Escobar threw wildly past Loney trying for a double play
column25: and Daniel Nava scored from second on the error . 	 Will Middlebrooks added a sacrifice fly in the eighth against Jamey Wright . 	 One run would have been enough for Buccholz . 	 " His performance pretty much speaks for itself
column26: a guy that had four pitches working for strikes
column27: " Farrell said . " I think he struck out guys on four different types of pitches . After the seventh inning
column28: the pitch count 's climbing . I certainly did n't want to be a guy that 's going to walk out there with him with a no - hitter intact . " 	 But would he have taken Buchholz out if he had thrown nearly 130 pitches and still had a no - hit bid ? 	 " I do n't think we 'll ever know
column29: will we ? " Farrell said with a smile . 	 Game notes 	  The Rays have no homers in their last six games . ... The teams finish the rain - shortened series Monday when Jeremy Hellickson ( 0 - 1 ) pitches for Tampa Bay against Ryan Dempster ( 0 - 1 ) . The opener of the four - game series was postponed by rain on Friday night . ... Buchholz has allowed two earned runs or fewer in 10 of 15 starts against the Rays . ... column1: WASHINGTON --   Forget about last year . This season
column2: the Atlanta Braves are looking very much like the team to beat in the NL East . 	 Justin Upton and Andrelton Simmons homered
column3: and the Braves cruised to their ninth straight victory Sunday
column4: beating Washington 9 - 0 to complete a three - game sweep of the defending division champion Nationals . 	 Chris Johnson had four hits and two RBIs for the Braves
column5: who received a sparkling pitching performance from Paul Maholm . After forging two - run victories on Friday and Saturday
column6: Atlanta took a 7 - 0 lead in the third inning against Gio Gonzalez ( 1 - 1 ) and coasted to the finish . 	 " We know the Nationals are supposed to be pretty good
column7: so it was good to make a statement early
column8: " Simmons said . " Let them know we 're going to be tough to beat . " 	 In compiling the best record in the major leagues
column9: the Braves ( 11 - 1 ) have outscored the opposition 62 - 23 and built a 20 - 6 advantage in home runs . 	 " It 's early
column10: " manager Fredi Gonzalez said . " I do n't think we 're going to play .998 baseball the rest of the way
column11: but it sure is better than 1 - 11 . " 	 The Braves have swept three straight series ( Cubs
column12: Miami and Washington ) for the first time since April 2000
column13: when they swept four in a row ( Phillies
column16: and Padres ) . 	 Washington has lost seven straight to Atlanta
column17: dating back to last year . The final game of this series was a stark contrast to the other two . 	 " We should have won the first one . We were right there on the second
column18: " Nationals manager Davey Johnson said . " We just got waffled today . I do n't put too much stock in it . " 	 Maholm ( 3 - 0 ) allowed four hits in 7 2/3 innings
column19: walking one and striking out seven . The left - hander has not surrendered a run this season in 20 1/3 innings over three starts . 	 " He mixed it up well
column21: " Fredi Gonzalez said . " We gave him a nice little cushion to work with
column22: and he kept it . Sometimes that 's not easy to do . " 	 After giving up two singles in the eighth
column23: Maholm was replaced by Luis Avilan
column24: who walked Bryce Harper to load the bases before retiring Ryan Zimmerman on a comebacker . 	 Gonzalez yielded seven runs and seven hits in five innings for the Nationals
column25: who won 98 games a year ago to Atlanta 's 94 . 	 " I take the blame on this one 100 percent
column26: " the left - hander said . " The Braves right now are running hot . They 're red hot right now . You got to give them the credit . They 're a tough hitting lineup and a good rotation . " 	 Gonzalez came in with an 0.82 ERA in two starts
column27: but he struggled from the outset in this one . 	 B.J. Upton lined the first pitch of the game into the left - field corner for a double
column28: only his second extra - base hit in 39 at - bats this season . Brother Justin Upton walked with one out and Evan Gattis doubled in a run before Johnson delivered a two - out
column29: two - run single up the middle for a 3 - 0 lead . 	 Justin Upton hit his seventh homer leading off the third -- he did n't hit No . 7 last year until June 23 . After a walk to Dan Uggla and a single by Johnson
column30: Simmons drove a full - count pitch over the left - field wall to make it 7 - 0 . 	 That
column31: essentially
column32: decided the issue . 	 " Our job is to make sure we keep them as close as possible
column33: and I did n't do that today
column34: " Gio Gonzalez said . " Leaving the ball up
column36: they made me pay for it . " 	 Maholm
column37: on the other hand
column38: permitted only one runner to reach second base over the first seven innings . 	 " He 's pitching incredible this year
column39: " Washington shortstop Ian Desmond said . " He threw a great ballgame all day . He was working efficiently . Getting first strikes
column40: getting ahead . His team gave him a big lead early . That 's what you 're supposed to do . " 	 The Braves added two in the sixth against reliever Zach Duke . Maholm and B.J. Upton singled
column41: Jason Heyward doubled in a run and Gattis hit a sacrifice fly . 	 B.J. Upton
column42: who came into the game with four hits this season
column43: went 3 for 5 to up his batting average from .105 to .163 . 	 Game notes 	  The Nationals placed C Wilson Ramos ( left hamstring strain ) on the 15 - day disabled list and recalled C Jhonathan Solano from Triple - A Syracuse . ... Atlanta is 8 - 0 when scoring first . ... Washington 2B Danny Espinosa was hit in the right hand with a pitch in the second inning and left in the fifth inning with a sore hand . ... The Nationals will send Jordan Zimmermann ( 2 - 0 ) to the mound Monday night at Miami . The Braves are off . ... Atlanta 's bullpen has not allowed an inherited runner to score this season . ... Maholm improved to 2 - 6 lifetime against Washington

column1: PITTSBURGH --   Michael McKenry knows he is n't going to get many curtain calls as a backup catcher . 	 So he savored the moment Sunday when he called out of the dugout following his second home run of the day
column2: a drive that tied the game as the Pittsburgh Pirates overcame a five - run
column3: seventh - inning deficit to beat the Cincinnati Reds 10 - 7 . 	 " Neil Walker pushed me out of the dugout and told me to go to tip my cap
column4: " McKenry said . " It was special . It 's good to have good teammates who want you to get recognized
column5: and it 's great to have the fans be so supportive and cheer that hard for you . A guy in my position
column6: you just do n't expect it . " 	 McKenry got his curtain call after his two - run drive made it 6 - 6 in a six - run eighth inning against Jonathan Broxton ( 0 - 1 ) . 	 McKenry had the first two - homer game of his four - year major league career
column7: and Starling Marte hit a tiebreaking two - run drive . 	 Cincinnati has lost five straight
column8: its longest slide since last Aug. 5 - 9 . The Pirates swept the Reds for the first time since April 16 - 18
column10: in Pittsburgh . 	 Pittsburgh trailed 5 - 0 when McKenry homered off Mat Latos leading off the seventh . Travis Snider 's RBI double off the top of the right - field wall -- upheld after a video review -- chased Latos
column11: Andrew McCutchen doubled in a run against Logan Ondrusek and pinch - hitter Gaby Sanchez had an RBI single off Manny Parra . 	 " The home run gave us some hope
column12: " Snider said . " We hit some balls hard early in the game and did n't have anything to show for it
column13: but then Latos started making a lot of tough pitches . We hung with it
column15: and it 's a testament to the character of this team . " 	 Latos said McKenry hit a good pitch . 	 " It was low and in the zone
column16: " Latos said . " He did what he was supposed to do
column17: and you 've got to give him credit . " 	 Jack Hannahan 's pinch RBI single off Jared Hughes ( 1 - 0 ) boosted Cincinnati 's lead to 6 - 4 in the eighth
column18: but Broxton walked Pedro Alvarez leading off the bottom half and McKenry 's second homer tied it . Jose Tabata walked with one out
column19: and Marte 's first home run of the season gave the Pirates an 8 - 6 lead . 	 " You just do n't expect to do that kind of damage against pitchers Latos and Broxton
column20: " McKenry said . " They 're very good pitchers
column21: and Latos has been particularly tough on us . I did n't know if we 'd get to him the way he was pitching . " 	 Pitcher Jonathan Sanchez pinch hit for Hughes and reached on Broxton 's third walk of the inning and scored on Gaby Sanchez 's sacrifice fly . Walker added an RBI single . 	 Pittsburgh 's three homers doubled its total this season . The Pirates have 32 runs during a 5 - 1 spurt after scoring eight in a 1 - 5 start . 	 The two homers and six runs allowed tied career highs for Broxton
column22: a nine - year veteran . Reds manager Dusty Baker attributed Broxton 's struggles to rustiness as he had not pitched in a week . 	 " He warmed up three times yesterday just to try to stay sharp
column23: " Baker said . " We need to get him some work . We need to start getting some more leads so we can get him in there more often . " 	 Walker had three hits for Pittsburgh
column25: and Marte and McCutchen had two hits each . 	 Cincinnati 's Brandon Phillips drove in three runs on a pair of singles
column26: a day after attending his grandfather 's funeral . 	 Cincinnati 's Shin - Soo Choo had two hits and has reached base in all 12 games this season . Todd Frazier broke an 0 - for-16 slump with a third - inning single and Chris Heisey ended a string of 14 hitless at - bats with a single in the second . 	 The Reds ' Joey Votto led off the ninth with his first home run since June 24 . He also drew three walks . 	 Pirates starter Phil Irwin had a rocky major league debut . He was recalled from Triple - A Indianapolis to replace left - hander Wandy Rodriguez
column27: who strained his left hamstring Monday . 	 A 21st - round draft pick from the University of Mississippi in 2009
column28: Irwin allowed five runs -- four earned -- six hits and four walks in 4 2/3 innings while striking out four . 	 " As I much as I tried to stay calm and act like I was calm
column29: nerves got the better of me early on
column30: " Irwin said . " I finally settled down in the third inning and I thought I did OK after that . " 	 Latos gave up three runs and nine hits in 6 2/3 innings . He is 4 - 0 with a 2.55 ERA in 10 starts dating to August and has 48 strikeouts in 45 innings during seven career starts against the Pirates . 	 " It 's a tough loss
column31: the toughest one we 've had in a long time
column32: " Baker said . " That was a rough day for all of us . " 	 Game notes 	  The Reds are not expected to update RHP Johnny Cueto 's injury status until Monday ; he left Saturday night 's game in the fifth inning with a strained right triceps . A 19 - game winner last season
column33: was to be examined by team doctors in Cincinnati late Sunday afternoon . ... Pittsburgh optioned INF / OF Josh Harrison to Indianapolis to open a roster spot for Irwin . ...   Heisey was dropped from second to seventh in the batting order . ... Cincinnati opens a three - game home series against Philadelphia on Monday night with RHP Bronson Arroyo ( 1 - 1

column2: Mo. --   Ervin Santana kept the Kansas City Royals in the game
column3: wiggling out of every jam that the Toronto Blue Jays created . Alex Gordon made all the work pay off . 	 The hot - hitting Gordon drove home Chris Getz with a single in the ninth inning
column4: and the Royals beat the Blue Jays 3 - 2 on Sunday to avoid a three - game sweep . 	 " Erv gave us a chance and we just persevered at the end
column6: who extended his hitting streak to 11 games with a pair of base hits . " It felt good . " 	 Santana pitched eight sharp innings
column7: and Kelvin Herrera ( 1 - 0 ) kept the Blue Jays off the board in the ninth . Toronto brought in Darren Oliver to face three straight left - handed hitters
column8: even though left - handed bats have been 5 for 8 against the reliever this season . 	 Oliver ( 0 - 1 ) retired Jarrod Dyson to start the ninth
column9: but Getz doubled to right to bring up Gordon
column10: whose single allowed Getz to slide home easily in front of the tag . 	 " To get a win like that
column12: it 's a nice boost of energy
column13: " Getz said . " You do n't want to get swept
column14: so to scratch out a game like that is nice . " 	 Alcides Escobar and Lorenzo Cain also drove in runs for Kansas City . 	 Edwin Encarnacion homered and drove in both runs for the Blue Jays
column15: who had won six straight and eight of 10 against the Royals at Kauffman Stadium . That included a four - game sweep in their only series in Kansas City last season . 	 " They 're scrappy . They battle you
column16: " Blue Jays manager John Gibbons said . " The thing that stands out is their defense . They take away hits . In tight ball games
column17: that makes a difference . " 	 The Blue Jays struck in the first inning when Melky Cabrera and Jose Bautista delivered back - to - back base hits . Dyson bobbled Bautista 's routine single in center
column18: and that sent Cabrera to third base . He scored moments later on Encarnacion 's groundout . 	 Dyson atoned for his miscue with a leadoff triple in the third inning . After Gordon extended his hitting streak a check - swing single that went about 15 feet
column19: Escobar hit a deep sacrifice fly to right field that knotted the game 1 - all . 	 Encarnacion
column20: who 'd been 5 for 44 on the season
column21: gave Toronto the lead back in the sixth . He sent the first pitch of the inning skimming over the wall in left field for a homer . 	 " That 's huge
column22: " Gibbons said . " That 's a good sign for Eddie . " 	 Kansas City matched him in the bottom half
column24: when Billy Butler sent a blooper to right field
column25: reached second on a two - out single by Eric Hosmer
column26: and then managed to chug home on Cain 's base hit to left field -- the big DH looked as if he needed oxygen when he got back to the dugout . 	 The fact that the game was 2 - all at that point was a testament to some nice defense . 	 And some fairly clutch pitching . 	 Toronto 's Brandon Morrow allowed just the two runs in six innings
column27: at one point retiring eight straight batters . He struck out three and only issued an intentional watch . 	 " I did n't have my best stuff
column28: " he said
column29: " but I made a lot of good pitches and kept us in it . " 	 So did Santana
column30: who put the leadoff runner aboard in the second and third innings but got some help from a pair of inning - ending double - plays . Santana also left two stranded in the fifth
column31: thanks to a nice play by Dyson of tracking down Emilio Bonifacio 's fly ball in center field . 	 His greatest Houdini act may have come in the eighth
column32: when Santana walked Encarnacion to put runners on first and second with two outs . He struck out J.P. Arencibia to escape the inning . 	 That gave Getz and Gordon the opportunity to win the game . 	 " I have confidence in my offense
column33: " Santana said . " We have a lot of young talent . I know they can get the job done . " 	 Game notes 	  Royals RHP Jeremy Guthrie
column35: will start Tuesday 's interleague game at Atlanta . Blue Jays RHP Gavin Floyd will start Monday against the White Sox . ... Blue Jays 3B Brett Lawrie ( ribs ) made a rehab start for Class A Dunedin at 2B on Sunday . ... Royals 3B Mike Moustakas got the day off from the starting lineup . He was 1 for 17 on the homestand . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column36: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column37: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million

column1: ST . LOUIS --   After setting a team record for the most consecutive innings without scoring a run
column2: the Milwaukee Brewers now have a new streak going -- one they much prefer . 	 Jonathan Lucroy hit a solo homer in the 10th inning as the Brewers rallied past the St. Louis Cardinals 4 - 3 Sunday and avoided a sweep . 	 The Brewers had been shut out in 32 innings before Ryan Braun hit a two - run homer off reliever Trevor Rosenthal in the eighth that made it 3 - 2 . 	 Milwaukee tied it with another run in the ninth and then won on Lucroy 's shot . Lucroy credited Braun with getting the Brewers on track . 	 " After he hit that homer
column3: we had a little bit rolling
column4: " Lucroy said . " You could feel the tide turn a little bit . I think we were pressing a lot to score some runs . That was a big homer that opened it up for us . It let us relax and play a little better . " 	 Braun 's second home run of the season snapped a 39 - inning shutout streak for St. Louis pitchers . The Brewers had not scored since the second inning Tuesday against the Cubs and had lost three in a row . 	 " It 's been a scuffle
column5: " Milwaukee manager Ron Roenicke said . " It 's been really difficult to get wins thus far . We did a nice job battling back in the eighth and the ninth . That 's always a positive . " 	 Milwaukee tied it in the ninth on a leadoff single by Carlos Gomez and an RBI double by Yuniesky Betancourt off Mitchell Boggs . The Cardinals ' closer - for - now left without retiring a batter and blew his second save in five chances . 	 " This was there for us to take
column6: " Boggs said . " The bottom line is I had a chance to get the win for us and I did n't get the job done . " 	 After retiring Rickie Weeks on a fly to start the 10th
column7: Fernando Salas ( 0 - 2 ) gave up Lucroy 's first home run of the season . 	 " Any time is a good time for a homer
column8: " Lucroy said . " I have n't had a lot of success off that guy in the past . It was nice to hit a ball hard off him . " 	 Brandon Kintzler ( 1 - 0 ) pitched a scoreless ninth and got the first out in the 10th . Burke Badenhop retired pinch hitter Carlos Beltran on a grounder for the final out and his first save . 	 Matt Adams had another big day in the loss for St. Louis
column9: as he had a solo home run and a single in four at - bats . Adams has homered in three straight games and has a hit in all five games he has played . 	 Adams is batting .611 ( 11 - for-18 ) with three homers and eight RBI . 	 Matt Holliday had an RBI single and Yadier Molina an RBI double for the other St. Louis runs . 	 The Cardinals broke through for the game 's first two runs against Marco Estrada with four consecutive two - out hits in the third
column10: including an RBI single by Holliday and an RBI double to the gap by Molina . Allen Craig was thrown out at the plate trying to score on Molina 's hit . 	 Adams made it five straight hits when he led off the fourth with a 419 - foot homer to center that made it 3 - 0 . 	 Game notes 	  Molina received his fifth consecutive Gold Glove award before the game . ... Milwaukee hitters in the cleanup spot are 2 for 30 since Aramis Ramirez went on the disabled list on April 6 . Weeks was hitless in four tries from that spot Sunday
column11: completing a 1 - for-21 road trip . ... On Saturday
column12: Adam Wainwright became the first St. Louis pitcher with a shutout in which he struck out at least one batter in every inning since Bob Gibson accomplished the feat on June 17
column14: at San Diego . 	 Randy Arozarena hit 20 home runs and stole 20 bases this season

column1: CHICAGO --   With a record number of wild pitches in the middle of the game and a balk near the end
column2: the San Francisco Giants sure got plenty of help from the Chicago Cubs . 	 They 'll take it . 	 Edwin Jackson and Michael Bowden tied a major league record by combining to throw five wild pitches in an inning
column3: and the Giants got another big assist from a Cubs pitcher in a three - run 10th Sunday that led to their 10 - 7 victory over Chicago . 	 The Cubs matched the record for wild pitches by a team in an inning during a four - run sixth that put San Francisco ahead 5 - 4
column4: but the Giants had to rally again . 	 Chicago led 7 - 6 before Hunter Pence 's solo homer on a 2 - 2 pitch off Shawn Camp ( 0 - 1 ) with two outs in the ninth . 	 One - out singles by Hector Sanchez and Brandon Crawford put runners at the corners in the 10th . With Buster Posey batting
column5: Camp was called for a balk as he stepped off the rubber to try to throw to first
column6: giving San Francisco an 8 - 7 lead . Posey followed with an RBI single and
column8: Marco Scutaro added a run - scoring double . 	 Camp had no issue with the balk call
column11: and I just froze up . " 	 George Kontos ( 1 - 1 ) pitched a scoreless inning for the win
column12: and Sergio Romo worked the 10th for his seventh save in eight chances . 	 Starlin Castro and Nate Schierholtz hit two - run homers in the first off Tim Lincecum for a 4 - 1 lead . 	 Jackson got in trouble in the sixth when he threw two wild pitches and Bowden added three more . The Cubs matched the mark set by Bert Cunningham of Buffalo in a Players League game in 1890 and matched by the St. Louis Cardinals ' Rick Ankiel in the 2000 NL Division Series against Atlanta . Jackson and Bowden also combined to walk four in the inning
column13: with Jackson starting the inning with free passes to Pence and Brandon Belt . 	 Gregor Blanco doubled in a run and Jackson allowed another run with his second wild pitch of the inning . 	 Bowden came in when Nick Noonan pinch hit for Lincecum
column14: and he threw a wild pitch . Noonan hit a two - run single for a 5 - 4 lead . 	 Bowden threw two more wild pitches
column15: walked Angel Pagan and got Scutaro to hit into an inning - ending double play . 	 " The guy was throwing well and throwing hard
column16: great stuff
column17: " Giants manager Bruce Bochy said . " You get some breaks there and you take them . You 're hoping someone comes through with a big hit
column18: Noonan 's was huge . " 	 Jackson was furious at himself . 	 " I feel like first of all it 's unexcusable to let your team down like that when you self - imploded like that and not make an adjustment to regain control of your pitches
column19: " he said . 	 Blanco hit another RBI double in the seventh against Hector Rondon
column20: and Alberto Gonzalez pulled the Cubs to 6 - 5 when he homered off Chad Gaudin in the bottom half . Chicago went ahead in the eighth when on Jeremy Affeldt 's bases - loaded walk to Luis Valbuena and Gonazalez 's sacrifice fly off Santiago Casilla . 	 Lincecum
column21: 1 - 0 after three starts
column22: allowed four runs and six hits in five innings . He settled down after the early homers
column23: but his ERA rose to 5.63 . 	 " It just comes down to focus
column24: executing your pitches when you need to
column25: " said Lincecum
column26: who gave up six runs in his previous start against Colorado . " I could have ended that inning with two runs maybe . I guess I just did n't focus the way I should have . " 	 Jackson gave up five runs -- four earned -- five hits and four walks in 5 1/3 innings . He 's walked nine in his past two starts . 	 " I would n't change my pitch selection
column27: but I 'd definitely change the way I made adjustments
column28: " he said . 	 Game notes 	  The Cubs placed C Steve Clevenger on the 60 - day DL because of a strained left abdomen and claimed RHP Kameron Loe off waivers from the Seattle Mariners . They also optioned RHP Rafael Dolis to Triple - A Iowa . Clevenger injured the left oblique muscle and fell to the ground in pain when he struck out ending Saturday 's loss to San Francisco . Loe was 1 - 1 with a 10.80 ERA in four relief appearances with the Mariners
column29: then was designated for assignment on Thursday . ... The Cubs agreed to a minor league deal with RHP Kevin Gregg . He was with them in 2009 and was replaced as closer by Carlos Marmol . ... LHP Travis Wood starts Tuesday for Chicago against Texas with LHP Derek Holland pitching for the Rangers . ... LHP Barry Zito pitches Tuesday for San Francisco at Milwaukee

column2: Calif. --   Now that Josh Hamilton has homered in consecutive games
column3: Mike Trout has found his power stroke and C.J. Wilson has gotten his first win of the season
column4: the Los Angeles Angels hit the road for frigid Minnesota with a warm
column5: fuzzy feeling inside . 	 Trout hit his first home run of the season
column6: teaming with Hamilton and Wilson to beat the Houston Astros 4 - 1 Sunday . 	 Trout put the Angels ahead for good with his solo homer in the third inning . He also doubled and scored three times . 	 Hamilton tripled and singled before hitting his second homer of the year
column7: a two - run drive in the eighth . 	 " It 's big to get that first series win . We just want to take that momentum into Minnesota
column8: " Trout said . 	 Wilson ( 1 - 0 ) allowed one run and five hits in six innings . He struck out three
column9: walked four and threw 115 pitches . 	 The left - hander held the Astros to a pair of singles after giving up back - to - back doubles by Ronny Cedeno and Matt Dominguez with none out in the second . 	 " We talked about how he had some command issues in his last start
column10: so working counts was definitely part of our approach as a team
column11: " Astros center fielder Justin Maxwell said . " We did a really good job of making him work . I think almost every one of our batters had a full count at one time or another . So it worked pretty well
column12: and we got some runners on . " 	 Wilson
column13: who threw 43 pitches during the first inning of his previous start last Monday against Oakland and gave up three runs
column14: made 29 this time in the first . He escaped a bases - loaded jam when Carlos Corporan grounded out . 	 " I know exactly what went wrong the last time -- after the fact
column15: " Wilson said . " During that game I did n't really know . I was sort of searching for the reason once I started missing . " 	 " But today I figured it out . I knew I was missing
column16: but I just was n't going to give in -- because I knew at some point that I was going to get a groundball or a strikeout to get out of the inning
column17: " he said . " Usually
column18: the book on them is that they 're a high - swinging percentage team . And they barely swung the bat today -- which is very weird . " 	 Ernesto Frieri
column19: the fourth Angels pitcher
column20: got four outs for his second save . 	 Philip Humber ( 0 - 3 ) allowed two runs and seven hits in seven innings and struck out four . The Astros did n't score a run in either of his first two outings for them
column21: which he lost 4 - 0 loss to Texas and 3 - 0 at Seattle . 	 " The guys are battling and today we got some runners on
column23: " Humber said . " He made pitches when he had to make them
column24: and their bullpen pretty much shut us down . " 	 " As a pitcher
column25: you ca n't really control wins and losses . You just go out there and try to give the team a chance to win when it 's our turn . There are times when I go out there and do n't deserve to win and my teammates have picked me up . That 's happened a lot in the past
column26: so you just keep going
column27: " he said . 	 One night after getting a successful suicide squeeze bunt from Marwin Gonzalez
column28: Houston manager Bo Porter tried it again with Cedeno in the sixth with the Astros down by a run . But Wilson charged in and flipped the ball to Hank Conger for the tag on Carlos Pena . 	 " They had a bat - handler up there in Cedeno
column29: so it was zero surprise
column30: " Wilson said . " I came up set
column31: just knowing that this was possibly where they were going to try it -- because anything that they can do to get the momentum back is huge for them . I threw him a cutter up and in
column32: which is the textbook kind of thing you 're supposed to do
column33: and it just bounced right at me . I was fortunate to get a good break off the mound and field it clean . I was very excited . " 	 Trout
column35: 83 RBIs and .326 average last season helped him win AL Rookie of the Year honors
column36: gave the Angels a 2 - 1 lead . It was his first RBI in four games since manager Mike Scioscia switched him from first to second in the batting order . 	 " The difference today was just being more relaxed
column37: " Trout said . " The last couple games I had been jumpy
column38: a little anxious . I calmed myself down and told myself to relax a little bit
column39: and I kept myself balanced most of the game . I got a couple good pitches to hit and put good swings on them . " 	 Hamilton
column40: who homered in Saturday night 's 5 - 4 win
column41: hit an opposite - field drive that just cleared the fence in left - center as Maxwell made a leaping attempt . 	 " I thought he was camped under it
column42: " Hamilton said . " He was playing there
column43: anyway . I think he would have caught it if he had n't jumped into the wall . I think he got a little too close to the wall . I 've done that myself . " 	 The Angels got a run in the first when Trout doubled and scored from third on Hamilton 's two - out infield single . 	 Game notes 	  The last three teams Humber has pitched for -- Oakland

column1: SEATTLE --   Brandon Maurer shook the nerves
column2: went back to relying on his primary pitches and finally displayed why the Seattle Mariners felt the 22 - year - old was ready to make the jump from Double - A to the majors . 	 The result was a celebratory shower that left the rookie shivering . 	 " He 's going through another first right now
column3: " Seattle manager Eric Wedge noted as cheers emerged from the clubhouse . 	 Dustin Ackley snapped a sixth - inning tie with his first RBI of the season
column4: Maurer rebounded from a horrible start to throw six strong innings for his first career victory and the Mariners beat the Texas Rangers 4 - 3 on Sunday . 	 Raul Ibanez added a solo homer as Seattle salvaged a split of the four - game series thanks largely to Maurer ( 1 - 2 ) finally showing the promise he displayed in spring training that earned him a spot in the rotation . 	 " He was much more in control today . More at ease
column5: more comfortable out there and obviously his stuff played out
column6: " Wedge said . " He 's going through a lot of firsts as everybody does when they get to the big leagues
column7: especially for a starting pitcher . 	 " He was noticeably different I felt like out there today . " 	 In his first home start last Tuesday against Houston
column8: Maurer recorded just two outs and gave up six earned runs . It was about as horrible a home debut as could be imagined for the rookie . But his recovery on Sunday was impressive
column9: allowing five hits and only two runs before turning it over to the bullpen . Tom Wilhelmsen pitched the ninth for his fifth save . 	 Maurer showed his youth and inexperience in his first two starts . He got caught up in the moment both in his first start in Oakland and his first home start against the Astros . But Seattle continued to believe in Maurer 's stuff to the point that newly acquired starter Aaron Harang took the rotation spot of Blake Beavan and not Maurer . 	 Maurer backed up that belief with the finest performance of his young career . He struck out five and walked only one . And when Texas did get to him for runs -- in the second and fifth innings -- Maurer immediately responded with 1 - 2 - 3 innings the next time out . 	 " To be honest the game plan was just to throw my game and not look too much into hot zones and cold zones for hitters
column10: " Maurer said . " Get back to the basics . " 	 Texas took the lead in the fifth scoring twice with two outs . Leury Garcia hit a one - out triple off the top of the wall in deep right - center
column11: but was cut down trying to score on Elvis Andrus ' grounder to second . Craig Gentry was hit by a pitch and Lance Berkman ripped an RBI single on a full - count pitch to score Andrus . Gentry advanced to third on Berkman 's hit and score the go - ahead run when Seattle catcher Jesus Montero could n't handle Maurer 's tailing fastball and it went all the way to the backstop for a passed ball . 	 Texas starter Nick Tepesch ( 1 - 1 ) went 5 2/3 innings in his second career start
column12: but could not get through the sixth holding the lead . After striking out Justin Smoak to open the sixth
column13: Kyle Seager hit his second double of the game -- he lined an RBI double in the second . Montero followed with a broken - bat single that dropped softly into shallow right field and allowed Seager to score the tying run . The throw home was wide and Montero was able to advance to second . 	 That proved large when Ackley -- hitting just .108 entering the day -- dribbled a single back up the middle
column14: scoring Montero . 	 " I think you can see the hits were capable of getting in bigger situations and I think that 's all we 've been away from winning ball games lately is one hit or two hits . Today we showed that we can do that
column15: " Ackley said . 	 Texas threatened in the seventh after Mitch Moreland walked against reliever Bobby LaFromboise and advanced to second on Garcia 's sacrifice bunt . Stephen Pryor took over and struck out Andrus and Gentry to end the threat . 	 Pryor walked Adrian Beltre in the eighth and left with two outs after straining a latissimus muscle . Oliver Perez gave up a bloop single to David Murphy to put runners on the corners
column16: but Geovany Soto popped out to end the inning . 	 " Our pitching staff has done a great job as a whole . They 've kept us in ball games and helped us get off to a pretty good start
column17: " Murphy said . " Our offensive definitely needs to get in gear sooner than later . " 	 Game notes 	  Rangers manager Ron Washington said Berkman will probably be used in a pinch - hitting role the next three games with Texas beginning interleague play at the Chicago Cubs . ... Seattle CF Franklin Gutierrez is still bothered by tightness in his legs and was out of the lineup . Seattle manager Eric Wedge is hopeful Gutierrez and OF Michael Morse ( finger ) could be ready to play on Tuesday . ... Seattle is off on Monday
column18: the last team in baseball to get a day off . The Mariners ' reward is 16 straight games after the day off . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column19: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers

column1: SAN DIEGO --   The San Diego Padres brought in the right - field fences in an attempt to make Petco Park play a little fairer
column3: too . 	 Todd Helton is glad they did . 	 Helton 's pinch - hit
column4: two - run homer in the seventh inning hit the top of the new right - field fence
column6: bounced over the Jack Daniel 's Old No . 7 Deck and into the seats to break a scoreless tie . Coupled with a combined two - hitter by Jorge De La Rosa and three relievers
column7: it carried the Colorado Rockies to a 2 - 1 victory Sunday against San Diego
column8: their second three - game sweep of the Padres this season . 	 " It helped a little bit in that situation . So
column11: " Helton said when asked if he likes the new fences
column12: which were also lowered by several inches . 	 Last year
column13: Helton 's fly ball would have been just another long out . 	 Instead

column1: BOSTON --   The Red Sox and Rays were making their ways out of Fenway Park when two explosions near the finish line of the Boston Marathon were heard at the stadium . 	 The Red Sox beat the Rays 3 - 2 on an RBI double by Mike Napoli in the ninth inning on Monday in Boston 's traditional Patriots ' Day morning game . column1: MIAMI --   Jordan Zimmermann succeeded after Washington Nationals teammates Stephen Strasburg and Gio Gonzalez faltered . 	 It surely helped that Zimmermann was pitching against the woeful Miami Marlins . 	 The right - hander threw a six - hitter for his third victory in three starts this season
column2: and Washington bounced back from a humbling series to beat Miami 10 - 3 Monday night . 	 Washington was outscored 18 - 5 while being swept in a three - game weekend set at home against Atlanta
column3: with Strasburg and Gonzalez each taking a loss . The Nationals took out any lingering frustration on the Marlins ( 2 - 11 )
column4: who came into the game tied for the worst record in the majors . 	 " It 's nice to have success
column5: especially after that series we just came from
column7: who had four of the Nationals ' 16 hits . " Jordan did a great job . It seems like we all hit better when Jordan pitches . " 	 Washington has scored 21 runs in Zimmermann 's starts
column8: and he 's 3 - 0 for the first time . The nine - inning complete game was his first . 	 " It means a lot
column9: " Zimmermann said . " It means I 'm doing my job staying in the game and putting up zeros . It 's the kind of pitcher I want to be . I want to be a workhorse and someone who can eat up innings . " 	 The right - hander struck out six
column10: walked one and threw 102 pitches . His only complete game in 83 previous career starts was an eight - inning effort in a 1 - 0 loss in 2011 . 	 " Jordan was outstanding
column11: " manager Davey Johnson said . " He has been outstanding all year . " 	 Zimmermann retired the first 10 batters
column12: and the score was 8 - 0 before Miami had a baserunner . Ryan Zimmerman hit his first home run and had four RBIs
column13: while Tyler Moore drove in three runs . 	 The carousel of baserunners for Washington was constant
column14: even though Miami center fielder Chris Coghlan threw out two of them . The Nationals ' run and hit totals were season highs
column15: and they had six extra - base hits
column16: including doubles on three consecutive pitches . 	 Ballpark personnel tightened security in the wake of the explosions Monday at the Boston Marathon . A moment of silence was observed before the national anthem . 	 Announced attendance was 15
column18: and there were more than a few boos when the score reached 6 - 0 . Coghlan triggered a big roar when he singled in the fourth to become Miami 's first baserunner . 	 The Marlins went without a homer for the ninth consecutive game
column19: tying the franchise record set by the 1993 expansion team . But manager Mike Redmond said he saw signs of improvement . 	 " I felt we had much better swings than we 've had in the last few days
column20: " he said . " Hopefully that 's something we can grow on . " 	 The Nationals scored four runs in the first inning
column21: when their first six batters reached against Wade LeBlanc ( 0 - 3 ) . One of them -- Bryce Harper -- was thrown trying to go from first to third on a single . 	 Zimmerman singled home the first two runs
column22: and Moore also had a two - run single . That was all Zimmermann needed . 	 " It 's a lot easier to pitch when you get runs early in the game
column23: " he said . 	 The Nationals kept swinging
column24: and in the third they hit three consecutive doubles with two outs . The first two
column25: by Desmond and Moore
column26: sailed over the center fielder 's head . Steve Lombardozzi then pulled an RBI double into the corner for a 6 - 0 lead . 	 John Maine relieved LeBlanc in the fourth
column27: and Zimmerman hit the first pitch into the nightclub beyond left field to make it 8 - 0 . 	 Miami 's starting pitching had been solid despite the team 's awful record
column28: but LeBlanc allowed seven runs in 3 2/3 innings . 	 " That 's not a good team to make mistakes against
column29: " LeBlanc said . 	 Zimmermann beat LeBlanc for the second time this month
column30: and the Nationals improved to 4 - 0 against Miami . 	 The Marlins have scored only 23 runs all season and played short - handed . Slugger Giancarlo Stanton sat out for fourth consecutive game because of a bruised left shoulder
column31: and reserve outfielder Austin Kearns was unavailable after undergoing tests for an irregular heartbeat . 	 Game notes 	  Washington 2B Danny Espinosa
column33: sat out and said he hopes to rejoin the lineup Wednesday or Friday . ... Zimmerman has 19 homers against the Marlins . ... A bright spot for the Marlins : They came into the game batting .174 with runners in scoring position but went 4 for 7 in those situations . ... Washington RHP Dan Haren ( 1 - 1 ) is scheduled to start against RHP Alex Sanabia ( 1 - 1 ) on Tuesday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column34: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column35: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million
column36: sources confirmed to ESPN . 	 From who we think deserves MVP and Cy Young to if the voters got it right
column37: this is your one - stop shop as baseball 's 2021 hardware is handed out .

column1: MINNEAPOLIS --   Minnesota 's starting pitching is still undergoing significant repairs . 	 Kevin Correia
column3: has given this lagging rotation quite a lift . 	 Joe Mauer had a home run among his four hits and drove in three runs for the Twins in an 8 - 2 victory over the Los Angeles Angels on a cold
column4: windy Monday night that helped send several fly balls to the deepest parts of Target Field . 	 Correia ( 1 - 1 ) earned his first American League win after finishing seven innings for the third time in as many starts with the Twins
column5: getting two double - play grounders to help him limit the Angels to solo home runs by Peter Bourjos and former Twins utility infielder Brendan Harris . 	 " The thing that I was most impressed about was early on he did n't really have his best stuff
column6: and he navigated through that lineup with pitches other than our normal game plan . Then he kind of found it later on
column8: " Mauer said . 	 Albert Pujols went 1 for 4 and Josh Hamilton was 0 for 4 with two strikeouts . The Angels
column9: with the sixth - highest payroll in the majors
column10: fell to 4 - 9 for the second straight year . 	 Angels starter Joe Blanton ( 0 - 3 ) was battered again for nine hits
column11: one walk and four runs in 4 2/3 innings . Mauer doubled and scored in the first and led off the fifth inning with a homer to left - center . Trevor Plouffe also went deep off Blanton
column12: and Justin Morneau drove in a run with a double . 	 Mauer added RBI singles against relievers in the sixth and eighth
column13: when Pedro Florimon also hit a two - run double . 	 " The ball was carrying better today
column14: " Mauer said . " I 've been disappointed in previous seasons
column15: but tonight it was just flying a little bit better . " 	 Correia gave up eight hits and a walk while striking out five . When he signed a $ 10 million
column16: two - year contract last winter
column17: it did little to excite Twins fans . But the 32 - year - old has been by far their best starter so far with a 2.95 ERA . 	 " He 's not going to wow you with his stuff
column18: but he had a little cutter
column19: changed speeds . Had some movement on his ball
column20: " Angels manager Mike Scioscia said . " I think he pitched a strong game tonight . " 	 Said Twins manager Ron Gardenhire : " He 's a very competitive guy
column21: and we see that in him . " 	 Correia was supposed to pitch on Sunday
column23: sleet and rain led to that game against the New York Mets being postponed until August . The first - pitch temperature was 38 degrees Monday
column24: actually the third - warmest of six home games for the Twins in this frosty start to the season . The wind was gusting toward center field at 16 mph
column25: and it showed . 	 Bourjos
column26: the slap - hitting speedster in the leadoff spot for now
column27: sent a drive into the left - center bullpen on Correia 's fourth pitch . Harris
column28: whose last major league home run was for the Twins on April 8
column30: against the Angels
column31: hit one nearby to start the third inning . 	 " What are you going to do ? The first hitter of the game
column32: you ca n't really pout too much . You 've got a long game ahead of you
column33: " Correia said . " You 've got some really good hitters coming up after him and you 've got to get a lot of outs after that
column34: so the easiest thing to do was to kind of shake it off and pretend like it did n't happen . " 	 By the seventh inning ? 	 " Got my body temperature up . Could feel the ball finally
column35: " Correia said . 	 Blanton bore the brunt of the breeze
column36: but he 's been throwing a bunch of hittable pitches all month . As one of three newcomers in the rotation with Tommy Hanson and Jason Vargas
column37: Blanton has an 8.59 ERA over three starts . He has allowed 26 hits and six home runs in 14 2/3 innings . 	 " It 's early
column38: but at the same time it 's not
column39: " Blanton said . " It wo n't be early long . It 's time to start getting deep into games . " 	 Garrett Richards
column40: on Saturday
column41: was the only Angels starter to pitch into the seventh inning in 13 games this year . Three - time All - Star Jered Weaver
column42: the staff ace
column43: is out for at least another three weeks because of a broken bone in his left ( non - throwing ) elbow . 	 Oswaldo Arcia singled in his first major league at - bat for the Twins
column44: but he also dropped a routine pop fly for a two - base error in the seventh inning . 	 The 21 - year - old
column45: one of the organization 's top outfield prospects
column46: was recalled from Triple - A before the game . He played left field for Josh Willingham
column48: but was sent back to Rochester after the game when Wilkin Ramirez was reinstated from the paternity leave list . 	 " It was fun to watch him walk to the plate
column50: 4.76 ERA ) will pitch for the Angels on Tuesday against Mike Pelfrey ( 1 - 1
column51: 7.36 ) . ... Arcia was the first Twins player to debut before age 22 since Francisco Liriano in 2005 . Mauer
column53: is the only other to do so since 2000 . ... Harris went 117 at - bats between homers . He 's gone deep 30 times in 1
column54: 603 career at - bats . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column2: Calif. -- Tommy Milone was Oakland 's most consistent starter as a rookie in 2012 . He 's doing the same thing this year
column3: and the results are looking even better . 	 It sure helps that the Athletics have been giving him plenty of run support along the way . 	 Milone won his third straight start
column4: Jed Lowrie drove in four runs and Oakland beat the Houston Astros 11 - 2 on Monday night . 	 " You pretty much know what you 're going to get out of Tommy every time he goes out there
column5: " A 's manager Bob Melvin said . " He works quick
column6: he knows what he wants to do and has conviction in what he 's doing . Since the day he 's gotten here his first spring training
column7: he 's been a model of consistency . " 	 Milone ( 3 - 0 ) had a season - high six strikeouts and did n't walk a batter for the eighth time in his career . The left - hander
column8: who won an Oakland rookie record 13 games in 2012
column9: pitched out of jams in the fourth and sixth before leaving following Jose Altuve 's one - out RBI single in the seventh . 	 The A 's
column10: who swept the Astros in Houston earlier this season
column11: needed it after Brett Anderson and Jarrod Parker were roughed up by Detroit last weekend . 	 Then again

column1: DENVER --   Carlos Gonzalez homered and tripled
column2: Todd Helton hit a go - ahead single and the Colorado Rockies beat the New York Mets 8 - 4 in the opening game of a doubleheader Tuesday that was delayed 2 hours as 8 inches of snow was cleared off the field . 	 One day after a spring storm postponed the first game of the series
column3: the teams were scheduled to play two in frigid conditions . The temperature at first pitch was 39 degrees and was expected to dip even lower for the nightcap -- maybe even with more snow . 	 David Wright homered twice for the Mets
column4: finally back on the field after cold weather postponed two straight games . Wintry conditions in Minneapolis on Sunday prompted their game against the Twins to be called off and rescheduled in August . 	 Juan Nicasio ( 2 - 0 ) struggled with his command
column6: but still earned the win . He lasted five innings and allowed four runs before being lifted for a pinch hitter . 	 Dillon Gee ( 0 - 3 ) had another rough outing
column7: going 4 2/3 innings and giving up five earned runs . He yielded seven runs in three innings at Philadelphia a week ago . 	 Early on Tuesday morning
column8: Rockies owner Dick Monfort took the field with a shovel and helped clear the way for the game to be played . A crew of team employees lent a hand as well
column10: the general manager of the Mets . 	 Players tried everything to stay warm . Some wore extra layers and others kept close to the dugout heaters as much as they could . Colorado second baseman Jonathan Herrera even wore a ski mask
column11: just to keep the biting wind off his face . 	 Between pitches
column12: Gee and Nicasio blew on their hands in an effort to keep their fingers from getting stiff . 	 The teams originally scheduled a split doubleheader to make up Monday 's postponement . But all the snow and the late start Tuesday turned it into a traditional twinbill
column13: with just a short break between games . 	 A sparse crowd showed up for the day game
column14: bundled up in heavy coats and stocking caps . The Rockies did n't plow the upper deck and allowed all fans to sit in the lower level . Even then
column15: the stands looked awfully empty even though the attendance was announced as 21
column16: 510 . 	 Helton put the Rockies ahead with a two - run single that chased Gee in the fifth . Eric Young Jr. added two late RBIs for Colorado . 	 Gonzalez had a solo homer and scored two runs . Young knocked in runs with a single in the sixth and a triple off the fence in the eighth . 	 The Rockies had a reason for concern in the fifth when Troy Tulowitzki was hit on the left elbow by a pitch from Gee . Manager Walt Weiss came out to check on his All - Star shortstop
column17: along with the trainer
column18: before Tulowitzki motioned that he was all right . Tulowitzki missed the majority of last season with a groin injury that eventually required surgery to remove scar tissue . 	 He 's the catalyst in the offense
column19: providing protection for Gonzalez . 	 Colorado scored three runs in the fifth to take a 5 - 4 lead . Helton had the big hit
column21: two - out single that just rolled under the glove of second baseman Daniel Murphy . 	 Wright hit his first homer of the season in the first
column22: a two - run liner into the bullpen in right . The Mets have hit at least one homer in every game this season
column23: the only team to accomplish the feat . 	 In the fifth
column24: Wright hit another to center for his 19th career multihomer game . 	 This much is certain : Wright enjoys hitting at Coors Field . He finished 3 for 4 with three RBIs on Tuesday and is batting .398 with 10 homers in the ballpark . 	 The Rockies were without leadoff hitter Dexter Fowler
column25: who rested a tender left foot . Fowler fouled a pitch off the foot on Sunday and had precautionary X - rays that came back negative . Fowler leads the Rockies with six homers . 	 Since the Mets and Rockies did n't celebrate Jackie Robinson Day the day before
column26: the players all donned No . 42 on Tuesday . 	 " It 's an honor
column27: " Mets manager Terry Collins said . " I really believe what somebody said yesterday -- it 's one of the most important days in the history of baseball . I agree with that . Every ethnic person who plays the game should respect what Jackie had to go through and what he meant . It 's an honor to have No . 42 on for one day . " 	 Game notes 	  Nicasio threw 97 pitches . The last time a Colorado starter reached the century mark was June 12 last year

column1: CLEVELAND --   They scrambled to put the jersey together
column2: and then the Red Sox hung it proudly on the dugout wall . 	 For nine innings
column3: No . 617 with " Boston " above the numerals and " Strong " below them reminded the players of home -- where they were needed
column4: where they wanted to be . 	 They were playing for much more than each other . 	 " It was just something to let them know
column5: they 're out of sight right now
column6: but definitely not out of mind
column7: " outfielder Jonny Gomes said . " We just wanted to let people know we 've got a heavy heart over here . " 	 Mike Napoli hit a three - run double in Boston 's seven - run second inning and the Red Sox
column8: playing their first game since the deadly bombings back home
column9: beat the Cleveland Indians 7 - 2 on Tuesday night . 	 Boston 's players had already boarded buses for the airport Monday when they learned of the explosions and horror near the Boston Marathon 's finish line
column10: where three people were killed and more than 170 injured . The Red Sox were hoping to bring some relief to those affected by the tragedy
column11: and they may have while winning their fourth straight . 	 " Given what 's taken place
column12: this is fresh on everyone 's minds
column13: " manager John Farrell said . " Even though we may not be in Boston right now
column14: we carry this with us . We feel very much a part of the city and the community and everything that goes on there . 	 " We have not forgotten by any means . " 	 Before the game
column15: Gomes asked one of Boston 's clubhouse workers to make up the gray jersey with No . 617 -- Boston 's area code -- on the back . Farrell said there was discussion among the players of how they could help
column16: and the jersey became a fitting symbol of how much they care . 	 " This is being carried by each guy
column17: " Farrell said . " Guys are really conscious of what has taken place for sure . " 	 The series opener was also Indians manager Terry Francona 's first game against the Red Sox
column18: the team he led to two World Series titles during eight seasons in Boston . 	 Helped by five walks
column19: the Red Sox scored seven runs in the second off Ubaldo Jimenez ( 0 - 2 ) and gave Felix Doubront ( 1 - 0 ) all the support he needed . 	 Staked to the big lead
column20: Doubront allowed two runs and four hits in five innings . He struck out seven . 	 Monday 's tragic events in Boston brought a somber tone to Francona 's reunion as well as to the Red Sox . Before the game
column21: in a clubhouse devoid of its usual pregame sound and bustle
column22: several players spoke of how a memorable Patriots Day win over Tampa Bay turned horrific . 	 With the American flag clinging to the pole and at half - staff
column25: solemnly took the field for a moment of silence before the national anthem to honor those who lost their lives in the Boston bombings . 	 As players placed their caps over their hearts
column26: closed their eyes and bowed their heads
column27: Boston 's " B " logo appeared on the left - field scoreboard with " STRONG " written underneath . 	 " You get so ramped up for a baseball game because it 's so important to us and then you look up and realize why you 're having a moment of silence
column28: " Francona said . " If you need perspective
column29: it gives it to you in a hurry . " 	 And then before the first pitch
column30: Fenway Park music standard " Sweet Caroline " filled the ballpark
column31: another nod to Boston and moving forward . 	 " That was a very classy touch
column32: " Francona said . 	 Francona was hoping the game could bring Red Sox Nation -- and everyone affected by the tragedy -- some comfort . 	 " If it helps anybody at all
column34: " he said . " I do n't know how you quantify what happened . It 's just unfair . I just hope maybe this game does help some people . " 	 Cleveland did all it could to make the visitors welcome . A young Indians fan presented the Red Sox with a sign he wrote in red ink and ordained with hearts . The note
column35: which was hung in Boston 's dugout
column36: read : " From our city to your city : Our hearts and prayers go out to you
column37: Boston . Love
column38: Cleveland . " 	 For Francona
column39: there will be another day to reflect and get nostalgic about his years in Boston . 	 This was n't the time or place . 	 Francona did all he could to downplay his first meeting against the Red Sox since he was fired following the 2011 season
column40: when Boston collapsed down the stretch . 	 The year he spent working as an ESPN analyst may have helped heal some of the hurt feelings
column41: but Francona knows things will be different on Cleveland 's visit to Boston next month . 	 " We 're not in Boston . I had mostly eight really good years ( there )
column42: " he said . " I do n't think I would 've scripted the end the way it ended . And you move on . Sometimes it 's time to move on . I 'm really happy where I 'm at here
column43: and I think it 's unfair to the players for me to have like nostalgia week . 	 " Our job is to beat them . And it is ' them . ' " 	 His starting pitcher did n't help . 	 Jimenez was atrocious in his two - inning stint . The right - hander walked five
column44: including two with the bases loaded
column45: to force in a pair of runs . 	 Pedro Ciriaco hit a sacrifice fly and Jacoby Ellsbury had an RBI single off Jimenez
column46: who was pulled after walking Dustin Pedroia to load the bases on his 59th pitch . As he walked slowly to the dugout
column47: Indians fans let Jimenez know how they felt about his latest poor performance . He is 1 - 12 since the second half of last season . 	 Cody Allen relieved Jimenez and gave up Napoli 's three - run double to make it 7 - 0 . 	 The Indians got a run off Doubront in the second on Mike Aviles ' sacrifice fly . They had a chance to catch up in the fifth
column48: loading the bases with one out . A passed ball with two outs got Cleveland within 7 - 2
column49: but Doubront got Mark Reynolds to pop to short right and end the threat . 	 It 's a good thing the Red Sox struck early . They struck out 16 times against five Cleveland pitchers . 	 Game notes 	  The Red Sox placed closer Joel Hanrahan on the disabled list with a hamstring injury . ... The Indians will place CF Michael Bourn on the 15 - day disabled list in the next few days . Bourn sliced his finger open diving into first base Sunday and got stepped on by White Sox pitcher Matt Thornton . Francona wants to make sure LHP Scott Kazmir can pitch Saturday before making the roster move . ... To commemorate Jackie Robinson Day
column50: both teams wore No . 42 jerseys . Francona was asked if Indians Hall of Famer Larry Doby
column52: should have his No . 14 retired . " He probably endured every bit as much
column53: but you do n't hear as much
column54: " he said . ... Red Sox DH David Ortiz was hitless in four at - bats on a rehab assignment at Triple - A Pawtucket . The slugger is rehabbing an Achilles injury and has n't played for Boston this season . Farrell hopes Ortiz will return for a weekend home series against Kansas City . column1: NEW YORK --   Robinson Cano and the New York Yankees found all sorts of ways to salute Jackie Robinson . 	 Cano
column2: whose big league father named him for Robinson
column3: hit a three - run homer . Mariano Rivera
column4: the last major leaguer still wearing the late Hall of Famer 's No . 42 on a daily basis
column5: closed for a save . 	 The final score of the Yankees ' win over the Arizona Diamondbacks on Tuesday night seemed equally appropriate : 4 - 2 . 	 A fitting tribute
column7: to the man who broke baseball 's color barrier . 	 " That 's what we try to do
column8: not only today but every day
column9: " Rivera said . " It 's special . " 	 The Yankees also honored victims of the Boston Marathon bombings
column10: starting with a pregame moment of silence . 	 Major League Baseball held Jackie Robinson Day on Monday
column11: the anniversary of the date he debuted for the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947 . Arizona and New York were off Monday
column14: coaches and umpires at Yankee Stadium wore his number on this evening . 	 " It 's amazing to get the chance to wear 42
column15: " Cano said . 	 The Yankees remembered Boston
column16: home of their longtime rivals
column17: by playing the Fenway Park favorite " Sweet Caroline " after the third inning . Several other teams around the majors followed suit . 	 Yankees fans sang along with the Neil Diamond hit as it came over the public - address system
column18: and some people in the crowd wore Red Sox hats and jerseys . 	 " Thank you NY Yankees for playing ' Sweet Caroline ' for the people of Boston
column19: " Diamond wrote on his Twitter page . " You scored a home run in my heart . With respect
column20: Neil # OneBoston . " 	 A ribbon was shown on the scoreboard displaying the insignia of the Red Sox and Yankees and the words : " New York stands with Boston ... Pray for Boston . " 	 A message that read " United We Stand " showing the Red Sox and Yankees logos was posted on an electronic board atop the ballpark . 	 Earlier in the day
column21: Yankees manager Joe Girardi said it was time to " put the baseball teams aside " and recognize " we 're all behind the people in Boston . " Yankees infielder Kevin Youkilis
column22: a longtime Red Sox star whose wife has run the Boston Marathon
column23: said his family was " sick to our stomachs " watching news coverage of the bombings . 	 The Diamondbacks made their first trip to the Bronx since 2007
column24: two years before the new Yankee Stadium opened . Arizona lost all three games at the old Yankee Stadium in the 2001 World Series
column25: but wound up winning the championship at home in Game 7 . 	 Cano 's shot in the fourth helped the Yankees start the unusual portion of their interleague schedule -- they 'll face an NL opponent every month this season . 	 Ivan Nova ( 1 - 1 ) labored through five innings in his first game since April 5 . Rivera pitched a perfect ninth for his third save . 	 " It 's kind of funny seeing 42 face three 42s
column26: " Girardi said . 	 Brandon McCarthy ( 0 - 2 ) escaped bases - loaded jams in the first two innings before Cano hit his fourth homer for a 3 - 2 lead . McCarthy threw 102 pitches in the short outing . 	 " Just completely out of sync . I was not able to do a whole lot
column27: " he said . " I do n't know what it was . I could n't get right . " 	 Eduardo Nunez added a sacrifice fly in the seventh . 	 Arizona took a 2 - 0 lead in the third on a sacrifice fly by Miguel Montero and an RBI single by Cody Ross . 	 Game notes 	  Cano 's father

column1: TORONTO --   Paul Konerko 's base running as well as his power helped give the White Sox a much - needed win . 	 Dayan Viciedo doubled home the go - ahead run in the ninth inning
column2: Konerko later scored on a sacrifice fly and Chicago rallied to beat the Toronto Blue Jays 4 - 3 on Tuesday . 	 " It was a gritty win
column3: " Konerko said . " It was a good win because we 've played a lot of games that looked like that in this ballpark and they always seem to be losses . " 	 Chicago came in having lost 19 of their past 22 games in Toronto
column4: but Konerko made sure they did n't lose on Tuesday . The veteran DH hit a game - tying homer and scored three runs as the White Sox won for just the second time in eight games . 	 The White Sox were swept in a three - game series in Washington last week and dropped two of three at Cleveland over the weekend before losing Monday 's opener in Toronto . 	 " This has been a road trip from hell for us
column5: " slugger Adam Dunn said . " We have n't been able to score any runs . " 	 They scratched out just enough to win this one . Facing reliever Steve Delabar
column6: Dunn walked to begin the ninth and was replaced by pinch runner Dewayne Wise . 	 Konerko followed with a walk and Conor Gillaspie struck out before Viciedo drove in Wise with a double over the head of center fielder Emilio Bonifacio . 	 " Those are the kind of things that help your offense as far as giving you a good feeling
column7: " White Sox manager Robin Ventura said . 	 Alexei Ramirez was intentionally walked and Darren Oliver came on to face Hector Gimenez
column8: who drove in Konerko with a sacrifice fly to right . Konerko slid home safely when the throw from Davis missed wide . 	 " It 's not always easy to score Paulie from third
column9: " Ventura said with a wry smile . 	 No one knows that better than Konerko . 	 " I 'm never really confident when it comes to me trying to outrun a ball
column10: " he said . " I ran as fast as I could . Obviously the throw was off line a little bit . Even then it was still close . " 	 Dunn called it a " hold your breath " play . 	 Matt Lindstrom ( 1 - 0 ) got one out for the win and Addison Reed finished for his fifth save in as many opportunities . 	 Edwin Encarnacion and Adam Lind hit consecutive singles off Reed to begin the ninth
column11: just the second and third hits he 's allowed this season . Brett Lawrie followed with a sacrifice fly
column12: but Reed got Rajai Davis and Maicer Izturis to fly out . 	 Colby Rasmus and J.P. Arencibia hit solo home runs for the Blue Jays
column13: who could n't hold on after taking a 2 - 1 lead in the sixth . 	 Delabar ( 1 - 1 ) allowed two runs and one hit in 1 1/3 innings . 	 The White Sox opened the scoring in the second
column14: loading the bases with two singles and a walk before Konerko scored from third on a wild pitch by Blue Jays right - hander Josh Johnson . 	 Rasmus tied it in the bottom half with a two - out blast to center
column15: his fourth . 	 Arencibia put the Blue Jays in front with a two - out homer in the sixth
column16: his fifth of the season and second in two days . 	 Johnson had retired 10 straight White Sox batters
column17: but his streak ended quickly in the seventh as he fell behind 3 - 0 on Konerko before allowing a game - tying homer to left . For Konerko
column18: the drive was his third . 	 " His stuff was really good tonight
column19: " Konerko said of Johnson . " I got lucky to get a couple of fastballs that did n't have a lot of movement . " 	 Neither starter figured in the decision . Chicago 's Dylan Axelrod allowed two runs and seven hits in six innings
column20: walked one and struck out four . Johnson allowed two runs and four hits in a season - high seven innings . He walked two and struck out eight
column21: also a season high . 	 " He was terrific
column22: " manager John Gibbons said of Johnson . " I thought maybe early he was overthrowing a little bit but he settled in and did a great job . He kept us in the game . We 're still waiting for the offense to break out . " 	 Lawrie made his first start of the season after being activated off the 15 - day disabled list Monday . Lawrie had been sidelined since early March with a strained left ribcage muscle suffered at the World Baseball Classic . 	 Blue Jays slugger Jose Bautista was held out of the starting lineup for the second straight game suffering from a sore back and flu - like symptoms . 	 " He was n't ready to pinch hit
column23: " Gibbons said . " Hopefully he 'll be ready ( Wednesday ) . " 	 Game notes 	  Following the game
